<div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Artesia, NM is seeking an Accounting Administrator. This position will be responsible for non-repetitive bookkeeping and accounting related clerical work and fiscal record keeping. Under general supervision, conducts and monitors basic to moderately complex yields accounting assignments as assigned and provides time keeping administration and associated data-entry for maintenance.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Maintains and analyzes accurate daily refinery yields, assisting with determining profit and loss for the refinery<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reconciles various accounts and enters them into the system, ensuring integrity of data and compliance with accounting principals<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prepares various accounting statements and reports<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews and analyzes problems or variances arising within the refinery<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews, updates, and maintains files on a periodic basis<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists with preparing refinery month-end close by obtaining information from various reports, entering it into the system and verifying that debits and credits balance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates accounting matters with other departments, refineries, divisions and subsidiaries<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Processes Payroll timesheets including tracking overtime<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Organizes vacation scheduling for hourly and salaried employees<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs exception time reporting for payroll, by inputting and reviewing special assignment or overtime requirement work schedules, printing and distributing bi-weekly schedules and tracking and auditing vacation and sick time<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Communicates with all levels of management on information related to department projects or any other requests<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prepares, updates, and maintains various periodical files and binders on a regularly scheduled basis and distributes as directed<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of four years of on-the-job experience are required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High school Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Organized, detail-oriented team player with strong multi-task skills, flexible, creative, resourceful, and highly-motivated with a desire for self-improvement. Ability to analyze basic account entries and adjustments and apply basic mathematical calculations to calculate tax or other accounting amounts accurately. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication, with attention to accuracy and detail and interpersonal skills. Proficient with computer word processing, database, e-mail and spreadsheet applications. Ability to collect, review and organize business related data; prioritize work activities; achieve planned objectives and handle multiple projects simultaneously to successful completion. Basic reading and writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based. Petroleum refinery and out-of-doors environment. Subject to all temperatures.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, climbing up to 40ftperceiving color differences, and ability to wear personal protective equipment (beards not permitted)<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Experience in revenue accounting, accounts payable, SAP FI\u002FCO, SAP BI, and DataStream is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n accounting analysis. Basic knowledge of Microsoft products. Basic experience with accounting and maintenance software. Entry-level understanding of accounting practices and procedures. Basic reading and writing skills. Interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication. Ability to perform basic mathematical calculations.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with occasional work in a petroleum refinery environment. May be required to work flexible hours.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, perceiving color differences, and ability to wear Personal Protective Equipment (beards not permitted) when out in refinery or during emergencies. Job conditions may require standing, walking, and lifting and\u002For carrying up to 25 lbs.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair, located in Anacortes, WA is seeking an IE Technician. This position’s primary duties include: troubleshooting, testing, repairing of existing installations and maintaining Instrument and Electrical systems.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Perform all job tasks with safety and respect for the environment as the number one priority.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Perform job tasks in a motivated, self-directed fashion independently or as part of a team.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Troubleshoot, repair, install, and calibrate, pneumatic, electronic and HART protocol flow, pressure, level and temperature field instrumentation.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Basic understanding of control valves and positioners to troubleshoot control loops.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Have a basic understanding of Honeywell DCS systems to troubleshoot control systems.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Have a basic understanding of PLC hardware and ladder logic to troubleshoot systems.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Troubleshoot and maintain 480 volt motor control systems.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Follow NFPA 70E safe work practices and the NEC while working on electrical systems.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Test, maintain and document Safety shut down systems.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Communicate to operations, and supervision verbally and in writing details regarding job tasks. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Use a basic understanding of the SAP work order system to access and write work orders.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Receive training on or off site to be qualified to perform successfully as an I&amp;E tech. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Be willing to train other personnel in any instrument\u002Felectrical functions. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Read and comprehend instrument and electrical drawings to troubleshoot and repair systems. <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p>Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Minimum of two years of verifiable instrumentation\u002Felectrical experience and two years of technical school, or five years of verifiable instrumentation \u002F electrical experience.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Minimum of a high school diploma.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Willingness to work nights, weekends, holidays and overtime. Willingness to work at heights, walk on high elevation grating and to walk up and down stairs. Willingness to work in confined spaces. Must be able to speak, read and write English. Reside within 60 miles of the site, or relocate without assistance to within 60 miles. Willingness to work outside in inclement weather. Must be willing to use safe lifting techniques to lift 50 pounds from the ground to waist level. Must be comfortable using computers in a work environment. Willingness to support HF Sinclair’s policy of a drug-free work environment.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Field based. Petroleum refinery, out-of-doors environment, and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, exposure to the risk of electrical shock, and working in confined spaces. Subject to all temperatures.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Artesia, NM is seeking a Chemist. This position conducts routine to complex chemistry\u002Flaboratory assignments for the Lab Department under limited supervision. May lead the work of others from time-to-time.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Samples and conducts standard tests on raw materials, intermediates, and finished products and may train others to perform standard tests depending on location<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures testing is carried out as per established methods\u002Fprocedures<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures the quality of work through quality assurance testing and documentation<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Records, reports, and certifies results<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs routine maintenance and calibrations on laboratory equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Creates QA documents and protocols<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> May also perform other duties, including:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Monitors process control of plant streams, product purity and fuel gas composition, liquefied petroleum products, and various levels of Hydrogen<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports other departments in sampling, testing, and compliance monitoring<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Operates Chromatographs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ships samples designated as hazardous<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors drinking water streams for compliance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides support to operations with product blending<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works with outside testing laboratories to coordinate special requests and compliance testing<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum zero of five years of on-the-job experience is required. Career level will be determined based on the candidate's knowledge, skills, and abilities.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor's Degree of Science in Chemistry or related field is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Working knowledge of laboratory testing and ability to apply this knowledge. Working knowledge of petroleum products and testing. Depending on location, may require the ability to train and lead the work of others. Intermediate reading and writing skills, ability to perform advanced mathematical calculations, effective communication with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Depending on the candidate's experience, may lead the work of others regularly.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with occasional refinery visits, and up to 10% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery\u002Findustrial environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, and rotating equipment. Subject to all weather, and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair in Anacortes, WA is seeking a SIS Specialist. This position is responsible for the run and maintain technical oversight of PSR’s SIS systems, and technical assistance to other groups in support of SIS and other instrument and control systems.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: <\u002Fp>\n    <p>Delivers technical expertise to support reliable refinery production and maintenance, including but not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><br> Supports the SIS (also called IPF) work process through documentation and recordkeeping; maintenance and optimization of SIS testing schedule; testing coordination, oversight, and support; troubleshooting; event investigation; SIS metrics data assembly and reporting, etc.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides assistance and technical input to the creation, maintenance, and execution of SIS test procedures, system descriptions, operations SIS system mitigation plans, and other required plans, processes, and documentation.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate in the MOC process on SIS and other instrument systems by providing technical consultation and evaluation, identification of change, assistance with documentation, training assistance, oversight of change implementation, and MOC tracking application use<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Technical assistance to I&amp;E maintenance, production, turnaround planning, projects, and other work groups related to SIS systems or other instrument and control systems<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Become familiar with and act as subject matter expert on a selection of complex instrument systems including dock line leak detection, tank gauging, flare flowmeters, compressor shutdown systems, over-speed protection systems, anti-surge protection systems, etc <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Provides instrument technical support during turnarounds, including construction, commissioning, and startup support.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Five (5) years refinery or chemical plant experience in instrument and SIS maintenance. Familiarity with instrument troubleshooting, testing, and calibration techniques required. SIS testing and documentation experience. Logic system troubleshooting experience.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Preferred Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Technical degree or equivalent plant experience in instrumentation and control systems. PLC and SIS system programming, preferably Triconex TMR programming. PLC \u002F SIS hardware and firmware maintenance experience. SIS test procedure development. Knowledge of industry standards and practices including IEC 61511. Basic knowledge of instrument-electrical codes and standards desired (NEC, ISA, API, etc).<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of a Journeyman-level technical certification\u002Fdegree in instrumentation or a related field; or an equivalent combination of education and work experience, is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Ability to lead and direct the work of other associates.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Strong problem solving skills required.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Knowledge of DCS, PLC, and field instrumentation including, but not limited to; instrumentation required for pressure, temperature, flow, level and equipment monitoring controls.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Strong verbal and written communication skills required. Must be able to work with all levels of the organization as well as equipment vendors and contractors.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Computer program familiarity with MS Office suite.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> May be responsible for the supervision of contracted Inspectors and Technicians.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office and field based with up to 5% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, exposure to the risk of electrical shock, and working in confined spaces. Subject to all temperatures, weather, and varying road conditions. Extensive use of computers with business and engineering applications (Email, spreadsheet, CAD, engineering design programs, etc).<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p> Salary Range: The salary range includes the minimum, midpoint, and maximum base salary values. A candidate's offer can vary depending on differentiating factors, including but not limited to education, training, or experience.<br> <br> This position has a salary minimum of $87,600.00 and maximum of the physical tasks involved with moving, shipping and receiving materials, parts, supplies and equipment and placing warehouse materials and inventory in their assigned locations under general supervision. Checks goods against shipping orders and for damaged items, performing repairs and equipment maintenance as needed depending on location.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Coordinates handling of materials from receipt at warehouse dock to site delivery, safely offloading delivered materials, verifying materials are correct as ordered and not damaged, and performing Positive Material Identification (PMI) as required per policy depending on location.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Places materials into correct row\u002Fbin or correct staging area; coordinates storage, tracking and delivery of bag &amp; tag (kitted) and other materials; processes returns to inventory; assesses bin space for new inventory; fills customer requests from inventory, issues, rotates and completes cycle inventories as directed.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ensures safe packaging of outbound shipments, prepares shipping documents, including bills-of-ladings and manifests, ensures correct tagging including MSDS is attached, and contacts carrier representatives to make arrangements to pick up orders.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Updates delivery and shipping information including delivery time windows on computer database system and inputs receipts accurately into inventory system.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Reads shipping orders to determine quantity and type of transportation needed and ensures orders are shipped on correct ship date.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ensures a safe working environment in accordance with federal regulations and company policies and procedures, attending periodic safety meetings and completing required safety training.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Makes runs to town for materials required immediately.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Prepares and maintains all related shipping documentation including requisitions, making photocopies, maintaining filing system and completing forms.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Operates vehicles, forklifts, banding equipment, and hand tools as required for handling, crating and uncrating materials safely and effectively.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> Other duties may include some or all of the following:\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Monitors all necessary communications as required on an ongoing basis on computer database system, reports any failures or problems to Supervisor\u002FManager.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Annotates shipping orders to inform shipping department of loading location and transportation time of arrival.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Prepares periodic environmental reports, facility safety reports and Standing Work Authorizations as required.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Completes paper work for Bin location, description changes and manual count of daily issued material and fills out description change sheets for Warehouse Supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Follow-Through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Create and maintain a well-organized and professional-looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Other duties as assigned by manager\u002Fsupervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education\u002FExperience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required. Three years of shipping and receiving with some experience working with an inventory control system, and \u002For previous refinery experience in material handling and inventory control beneficial depending on location is preferred. Experience with UPS and FedEx online software is desirable. Forklift license and Hazmat training a plus.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to operate machinery such as a forklift, hand jack and wrapper and vehicles; punctual, dependable, and flexible. Basic reading and writing skills, with the ability to perform basic mathematical calculations skills. Ability to learn and apply new information and basic skills in area of operations\u002Fspecialty. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Artesia, NM is seeking an Accounting Associate. This position is responsible for routine bookkeeping and accounting-related clerical work and fiscal record keeping. Under moderate supervision, ensures all accounting assignments are completed including paying accounts and posting all invoices to provide accurate management reports.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Prepares various accounting statements and reports<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prepares, updates, and maintains files daily\u002Fmonthly<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Processes end of month journal entries<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Processes invoices for payment and may communicate with vendors concerning invoice issues<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> May perform some or all of the following duties:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Reconciles inventory between terminals and accounting<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Measures volumes and track actual vs. budgeted volumes by site<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prepares diesel and jet fuel entries<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Tracks and enters all branding master file additions, changes, de-branding<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reconciles exchange between companies<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Sets up new carriers for the HEP Terminals, supporting the TopHat system and provides backup for the TopHat Coordinator<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides support and clerical help for submitting requisitions in the DataStream system<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides clerical support and relieves other area staff as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains project and general files for the administrative area<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of two years of related work experience in an office setting is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High school Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Associates degree or higher is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to perform routine accounting analysis. Working knowledge of Microsoft products, accounting and maintenance software, and accounting practices and procedures. Familiarity with the operation of general office equipment such as ten key calculators, fax and copy machines. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication, ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations, and intermediate reading and writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Drivers are responsible for the proper and efficient completion of assigned duties and operation of his or her vehicle within company policy and Department of Transportation regulations.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Pay and Benefits<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> $5,000 sign-on bonus paid after 6 months of satisfactory service<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Paid $0.60 per mile when driving and $21.00 per hour for all time loading &amp; unloading product, training, when broken down or for any other applicable work performed, plus a per diem for any overnight stay<\u002Fli>\n    <li> $4,000 Safety Bonus Program (potential of $1,000 per quarter)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Medical, dental &amp; vision coverages available for you and your family<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Company-paid life insurance at no cost to you<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Best in class 401k plan with competitive company match and additional Employer Retirement Contribution (ERC) based on years of service<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Paid time off including vacation time, 9 sick days and a floating holiday<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Designated Equipment - We are proud of our equipment and we know our drivers are too. destination<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Operate controls for loading\u002Funloading product at a variety of sites<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Climb ladders to open\u002Fclose dome lid (must be open for loading\u002Funloading)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Inspect truck for defects and safe operating conditions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Complete pre and post trip vehicle inspection reports per DOT regulations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Complete written reports per manager’s request in accordance with company policy<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Verifies Bills of Lading to determine nature of load and check for accuracy<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Submit written report on truck condition after each trip in accordance with policy and DOT regulations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Apply knowledge of commercial driving skills in difficult situations, weather, and tight-loading areas<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Report all incidents and accidents involving driver or company equipment immediately<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Report delays due to breakdowns, weather, or emergencies<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maneuver hoses in, around, and through all types of equipment as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Other duties as assigned<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Three years’ experience driving a commercial motor vehicle.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> High School Diploma or <div>\n   <p> None<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Field based. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver-based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, working in confined spaces, and exposure to the risk of electrical shock. Subject to all temperatures and weather. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; talk or hear and taste or smell. The employee must regularly lift and\u002For move up to 50 pounds.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Company LLC fleet in a timely and efficient manner following, all Sinclair Wyoming Refining Company safety guidelines.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Repair tires for the Sinclair Wyoming Refining Company LLC fleet.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Perform repairs (when trained) and preventive maintenance in a timely and efficient manner following, all Sinclair Wyoming Refining Company LLC safety guidelines.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Rail King Factory training.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Follow-through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Create and maintain a neat, clean and well-organized and professional-looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Other duties as assigned by supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Three years of experience with diesel, gas conventional and electronic engines required. Industrial experience a plus. Computer skills required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> High school diploma or general education development certificate (GED).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\") is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Sinclair, WY is seeking an E&amp;I Superintendent who will assure optimal performance of Refinery instrumentation and electrical systems for safe, efficient, and environmentally compliant refinery operation. Supervise the work activities and development of the Electrical and Instrumentation Technicians.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Instill and embrace a “safety first” attitude and outlook.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Develop safety compliance within department.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Assure optimal performance of Refinery instrumentation and electrical systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Develop preventive maintenance programs for all electrical and instrumentation in the Refinery.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Develop and maintain desired performance of department personnel.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provide leadership, direction, and training for department technicians.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Specify, order, receive, and deliver work materials to work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Comply with Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) regulations, Wyoming Department of Environmental Quality (WYDEQ) requirements, and National Electric Code (NEC)<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Assign project materials and personnel support for project completion.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Follow-through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Create and maintain a neat, clean and well-organized and professional-looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Other duties as assigned by supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Experience\u002FEducation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> High school diploma or general education development certificate (GED) required. Electrical licensing and practical electrical and instrumentation experience required. Instrumentation knowledge and training. Ability to set priorities, manage time of self and others and plan projects effectively. Excellent communication and organizational skills. Demonstrate an ability to safely troubleshoot electrical, instrumentation and control systems.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Artesia, NM is seeking an Electrician. This position primary duties include: troubleshooting, testing, and repairing of existing installations; maintaining AC motor switch gear and control systems; installing electrical conduit and components in compliance with the latest edition of the NEC.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Troubleshoot, repair or replace medium voltage (Ex. 480V and 4160V) lighting systems.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Evaluate the condition of motor windings using test equipment (Ex. Baker Motor Tester)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Test dielectric properties of a new barrel of transformer \u002F starter oil is within specification<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Test phasing and voltage on power feeders, starters, and substations using 12,000-V Hot Sticks and other methods<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Test and troubleshoot problems on UPS system and repair or replace bad parts<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Test and troubleshoot electrical problems using appropriate test equipment and repair or replace bad cables, insulators, defective boards in control panel during schedule or unscheduled plant shutdown<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Test and perform preventive maintenance on 480V and 4160V motor starters and replace defective parts as needed including bearing replacement<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Block out and disconnect motor for maintenance repair and reconnect and unblock motor upon completion of maintenance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Perform substation switching, pole switching, etc., per procedures as directed by supervisor<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Run conduit and install conduit supports per Engineering Drawings using NEC Electrical Standards<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Troubleshoot and repair or replace bulbs, ballasts, and electrical fixtures. Retro fit light fixtures to LED. Work at heights up to 300’<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Operate test equipment and interpret test results in order to troubleshoot equipment, verify proper electrical connection, and \u002F or provide requested data<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Use conduit equipment to cut, ream, thread and bend conduit<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Troubleshoot induction motor problems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Locate, select, retrieve correct basic electrical parts in the shop area<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Perform various safety procedures including communicating any unsafe conditions and ensure all work and operations are performed in accordance with safety policies and procedures, and participate in monthly safety walk through audit<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintain electrical shop work area clean and organized.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintain vehicle transportation clean and well maintained per manufacture recommendations. Maintain tools organized and in good working condition.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Willingness to work extended hours outside of routine schedule; including weekends, holidays, etc.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Willingness to travel to our Lovington site for various electrical work.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Knowledge of National Electric Code and Grounding requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Control circuit trouble-shooting – various low voltages up to 480v.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Infrared \u002F thermography electrical switch gear and power line preventive maintenance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Vibration analysis on rotating equipment may be required<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Laser alignment of rotating equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Read and create wire diagram and schematics<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May lead contract electricians and helpers<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Three or more years of on-the-job experience required<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School degree or equivalent is required and New Mexico Journeyman’s license.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Good verbal\u002Fwritten communication, computer literate, good mathematical &amp; problem solving skills, ability to read &amp; interpret various instructions, procedures, rules, and regulations. Must have the ability to enter manways on towers, work in high places, and around high temperatures. Perform work of consistent quality and visual acuity (including color, depth perception, and field of vision). Team player, self starter, independent worker, good time management and analytical skills and priority setting ability.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Field based<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Must be flexible to changing schedule. Must be willing to work overtime as needed. Able to work rotating 12-hour shift schedules. Able to work in adverse weather conditions. Must be able to grip, hold, operate various power tools and make precise hand and finger movements. Able to lift up to 50 pounds. Able to lift, carry, climb, walk, stand, stoop, kneel, push, reach, climb stairs and ladders and have a sense of balance. Able to hear alarms, emergency horns and make visual inspections. Able to wear and utilize negative and positive pressure breathing apparatus.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Our One HFC Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HollyFrontier, we are united through our One HFC Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> About HollyFrontier Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HollyFrontier Corporation, headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent petroleum refiner and marketer that produces high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel and other specialty products. HollyFrontier owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, and Utah and markets its refined products principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. In addition, HollyFrontier produces base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and Netherlands, and exports products to more than 80 countries. HollyFrontier also owns a 57% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminal line, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HollyFrontier Corporation subsidiaries. <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HollyFrontier Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
