<div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Artesia, NM is seeking a Refinery Accounting Analyst. This position conducts and monitors basic to moderately complex yields accounting assignments as assigned with direct supervision.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Maintains and analyzes accurate daily refinery yields, assisting with determining profit and loss for the refinery<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reconciles various accounts and enters them into the system, ensuring integrity of data and compliance with accounting principals<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prepares various accounting statements and reports<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews and analyzes problems or variances arising within the refinery<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews, updates, and maintains files on a periodic basis<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists with preparing refinery month-end close by obtaining information from various reports, entering it into the system and verifying that debits and credits balance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates accounting matters with other departments, refineries, divisions and subsidiaries<p> Other duties may include some or all of the following:<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li> Act as lead for administrative employees<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conduct routine financial and operational risk-based audits and review of internal controls of the Company's operations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Perform routine audit fieldwork testing<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintain documentation of process-related controls, including flowcharts and matrices<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitor testing results of process controls, and provide feedback to management<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Process credit card file reports<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Invoice marketers<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Measure volumes and track actual vs. budgeted volumes by site<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Make diesel and jet fuel entries<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Track and enter all branding master file additions, changes, and de-branding<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prepare special month end product movement reports for the Manager of Product Distribution<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of four years of related job experience are required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Bachelor's Degree in business, accounting, finance or related field is preferred. Masters or CPA is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Basic ability to perform some accounting analysis. Basic knowledge of Microsoft products. Basic experience with accounting and maintenance software. Entry-level understanding of accounting practices and procedures. The ability to effectively communicate to others, both written and verbal communication; basic reading and writing skills; and ability to perform basic mathematical calculations.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Experience in revenue accounting is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None typically but May act as lead for the work of up to three administrative employees.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with occasional refinery visits from time to time. Sometime will be required to work in petroleum refinery environment. May be required to work flexible hours<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HollyFrontier Asphalt Company located in Albuquerque, NM is seeking a Plant Manager who will manage day to day operations and maintenance of the Asphalt Terminal. This position facilitates the safe, reliable and environmentally sound operation of assigned facility through effective planning and scheduling of routine, capital and preventative maintenance. Committed to the goals, objectives, and success of the team. Must demonstrate a commitment to understanding and complying with all Federal, State, local and Company regulations, policies, guidelines, and procedures.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides oversight &amp; direction to the 24\u002F7 facility operations staff to meet the production plan within safe operating limits<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Schedules employees necessary to meet all material receipts, shipments, and manufacturing demands<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Shipping and delivery schedules, receipt handling via rail, truck, barge, and coordinating optimization of these activities with manufacturing schedules. Applicable documentation with these will be in place (i.e. BOL, SDS, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures all maintenance activities are performed in compliance with HF Sinclair Operations &amp; EH&amp;S procedures and guidelines.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates and facilitates work priorities and ensure safe and profitable facility operation. Helps troubleshoot operational issues related to maintenance needs.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Formulates processes and programs for operations &amp; maintenance such as PM program, winterization plan, steam trap program and steam leak program, working with peers to insure consistency.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors supplies and chemicals for assigned facility related to normal production operation, outages and other special events.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees development of operating, shutdown, start-up and Lock Out\u002FTag Out (LOTO) lists and procedures, obtaining final approval for Management of Change (MOC's) in area of responsibility. Facilitates completion of MOC requirements in a timely and efficient manner<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Accountable for the facility budget; report on variances and develop an action plan to achieve budget<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures all environmental rules and regulations are being met relative to equipment availability<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates to eliminate production problems that create waste in product and opportunity cost<\u002Fli>\n    <li> The facility’s TOE, budgets, administration, shipping documents, and related P &amp; L statements, etc.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Implements daily production\u002Fquality\u002FEH&amp;S meetings to establish culture in the facility<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supervises plant operations staff, hiring, terminating, performance reviews\u002Fissues, discipline, etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their Manager, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five years of experience of manufacturing emulsions and other liquid asphalt products are required. Operations background and general knowledge of maintenance protocol is also preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Must be able to lead and direct the work of others. The successful candidate will have past, hands on experience in environmental regulations and compliance, safety, production scheduling, and employee development. A Minimum of Intermediate or better of computer skills, reading and writing skills and the ability to perform mathematical calculations. Team player with ability to effectively communicate with others through written and verbal communication (verbal, listening, written) and work with difficult people under high stress situations. Self-motivated, team-player with interpersonal skills, ability to maintain positive customer relations and act courteous\u002Frespectful of others. Proven ability to make sound decisions with solid time management skills to effectively multi-task, meet deadlines and manage complexity within the work day<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Responsible for the supervision of a team of employees.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with up to 10% travel by land and air required. Petroleum facility, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, and rotating equipment. Subject to all temperatures, weather, and varying road conditions. Subject to occasional weekend and after hour calls to aid in facility support.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling 25lbs, climbing up to 100ft, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates, valid state driver’s license and proof of insurance, ability to wear personal protective equipment (beards not permitted), and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair is seeking an experienced, strategic <b>Communications Manager<\u002Fb> for our refining segment, to be based in Dallas, TX at our headquarters. This position will be responsible for the development and execution of effective internal and external communications in support of HF Sinclair’s refining fleet, along with supporting general corporate communication needs and initiatives. This role will also engage in key stakeholder relations, providing guidance for external engagement planning in an effort to enhance our organization’s reputation and will act as a key member of the emergency response team.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><b> Communications<\u002Fb>\n     <ul>\n      <li> Supports various initiatives by developing and executing strategic internal and external communications that reinforces our One HF Sinclair values, articulates the business strategy and culturally connects the refining fleet.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Delivers communications in a timely, effective manner to a broad range of stakeholders, such as leader communications, employee communications and external conference presentations\u002Fpanel discussions.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Owns and drives division communications for all channels, including the company’s intranet, social media, webinars, etc.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Partners with business leads to develop internal and external communication strategy designed to engage employees and align business strategy.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Provides strategic counsel to leaders to support effective, timely and transparent communications.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Supports the implementation of corporate initiatives, using tactics based on the needs and uniqueness of roles within the refining organization.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Assists with planning and executing events\u002Ftown halls for the division in an effort to create a professional, consistent experience, while meeting business objectives.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <li><b> Public affairs<\u002Fb>\n     <ul>\n      <li> Oversees the development of site Engagement Plans and Stakeholder Maps, providing strategic direction and counsel to local plan owners, aligning ESG initiatives and supporting implementation, including community advisory panels.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Develops and oversees the community investment strategy for the refining division, working with regional leads to support local business and community needs.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Provides direction and guidance on internal community support campaigns in an effort to boost employee morale and build awareness of our local community’s needs.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <li><b> Issues management<\u002Fb>\n     <ul>\n      <li> Maintains and strengthens the reputation of HF Sinclair through crisis response strategies.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Develops Issue Notes, including key messages, for both immediate and emerging issues and opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Plays key role in supporting incident command structure.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Assist with producing company policies and reports that support our local operations while fulfilling regulatory requirements.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their director, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of 10 years of relevant experience.<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Experience working with senior management and stakeholders within a large and complex organization.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Experience working with unionized operating facilities and\u002For remote workforce.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Experience leading and\u002For implementing projects to completion within a changing environment.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a University degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, Public Relations, Journalism or associated field.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Excellent and effective verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate in a variety of styles and formats. Ability to work with corporate management, employees, media and the larger community. Proficient in MS Office Suite or related software. Excellent organization skills with attention to detail. Superior ability to write in a journalistic style that is customary for corporate and external publications and the ability to conduct research. Ability to use tact and professionalism including in times of extreme stress. Excellent managerial and interpersonal skills. Ability to think, plan and communicate strategically, and to think creatively. Ability to coordinate efforts of various teams in order to present a coherent message. Effective project management and time management skills, including creating project schedules and prioritizing work appropriately, to meet project deadlines and remain within budget.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Provides leadership and oversight to one direct report.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with travel up to 30% by land or air is required. Subject to varying road and weather conditions<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n The Terminal Technician conducts intermediate level operations, assignments and duties for the Pipeline Department under general supervision. Works unsupervised the majority of the time and may be required to utilize independent judgment based on knowledge of the operation, making decisions about safety standards and operations as needed.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Oversees product receipts quality control checks on the product<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Operates the truck loading rack and troubleshoots problems when required<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs tank lineups for outbound shipments and inbound receipts and ensures timeliness and efficiency of the process<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Follows written procedures for various job duties and adheres to all safety procedures at all times Represents Company policy to truck drivers, contractors and third parties working close to company assets and monitors their activities<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Operates Company vehicle and equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responsible for dig test one call system, monitoring one calls, and dispatching to the location as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains balance of the terminal (i.e., Barrels in\u002FBarrels out) and Product Accountability of the Terminal<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Proves Truck Rack and Pipeline meters to ensure accuracy<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generates various reports for daily distribution<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Locates underground pipelines and assets using instrumentation<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Preferred Education:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelors Degree is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Intermediate knowledge of the pipeline department. Intermediate reading and writing skills with the ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Manages customers representatives and contractors while on company property.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Field based. Petroleum refinery, out-of-doors environment and driver based environment, including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, exposure to the risk of electrical shock, and working in confined spaces. Subject to all temperatures. Must be available for 12 hour rotating shift scheduled through weekends, holidays, and after hour call-outs.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, perceiving color differences, making precise hand or finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 60 ft, strenuous physical activity, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates, ability to wear personal protective equipment personal protective equipment (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Holly Energy Partners located in Artesia, NM is seeking a Pipeline Controller In Training. The Pipeline Controller In Training conducts monitoring and scheduling assignments related to all Pipeline quality and quantity controls at all times with general supervision. May provide training and guidance to less experienced staff<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Monitors and maintains around the clock controls on the incoming crude and on the shipments of refined product on various pipelines<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors system loads and controls system flow directly or through local staff to maintain effective flow within scheduled requirements revising as necessary to allow for unforeseen events<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responds to equipment and power failures by re-routing or re-scheduling flows<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works independently to balance the pipelines based on purchases and shipments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Liaises regularly with other company and non-company facilities during operations or maintenance activities<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Oversees œdig tests'\u009D one call system, monitoring one calls, and dispatching to the location as needed<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their manager, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of three years of pipeline control room experience, or five and a half years of general work experience, or may substitute experience for a two year technical degree (Associate'™s Degree in a technical field), as well as having passed a mandatory training period is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Experience as a machine operator in manufacturing, pipeline controller, or field technician is preferred<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a high school diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Associate'™s or Bachelor'™s Degree in a technical field<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Must have passed mandatory training period and Department of Transportation testing and obtained all required certifications. Mechanically inclined, working knowledge of pipeline control center board software, flow diagrams, and basic knowledge of overall pipeline operations, understanding and ability to comply with all Federal, State, Local, and Company regulations, policies, procedures, and guidelines. Ability to multitask in a fast paced environment and integrate new processes quickly and efficiently and follow instructions; self- motivated and able to work with limited supervision, and make quick decisions as needed. Ability to read, write, the ability to effecittvely communicate with others, both written and verbal communication skills, and perform mathematical calculations at a basic level.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Pipeline control room based. Must be available to work a flexible schedule (e.g., overtime, weekends, and holiday, rotating shifts).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require sitting, talking, hearing, making visual inspections and making precise hand &amp; finger movements. Job conditions may require standing, walking, reaching, grasping.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HollyFrontier Refining and Marketing, located in Glendale, Arizona, is seeking a Lab Technician II. This position is responsible for finished product quality control and specification compliance testing including calibration and standardization of test equipment and complex laboratory tasks. As needed, train others in conducting various test methods.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Conducts product quality control and specification compliance testing and may train others in laboratory testing methods<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Enters lab results in proper databases and communicates results to assigned area’s management and other personnel to direct formulation adjustments <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ensures work area is kept clean and organized<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conducts calibration and standardization of testing instruments and ancillary test equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Executes required assigned area’s Health Safety &amp; Environmental programs and initiatives<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> May include some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Execute requirements of HAC Quality Manual and related quality systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conduct experiments aimed at securing and verifying asphalt supply and other special assignments critical to HAC business<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conducts proficiency sample testing<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Collects and distributes samples to customers and others<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of two years of related material testing experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Intermediate level algebra and proficiency with spreadsheet and word-processing software applications. Good mechanical ability and understanding of operational principles of assigned area’s laboratory testing instruments. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication. Ability to complete all required classroom and CBT training. Exhibit superior Z-scores on proficiency testing programs. Ability to perform basic mathematical calculations, basic reading and writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May be required to lead the work of less experienced technicians. <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with up 10% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors, and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, and rotating equipment. Subject to all temperatures, weather, and varying road conditions. May be required to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and a rotating schedule required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n administrative support as required for multiple senior executives. Works under minimal supervision with latitude to use initiative and independent judgment.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Prepares correspondence, reports, studies, forms, and documents<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Compiles and analyzes data, making calculations and preparing reports as requested<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops, coordinates and maintains record keeping and filing systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates work between departmental units and departments; Advanced ability to implement new systems and procedures and to evaluate their effectiveness and effectively interpret plans and procedures. Must be organized, able to prioritize, and take initiative. Intermediate interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication, basic reading and writing, ability to perform basic mathematical calculations.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movement, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 10lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 10lbs, climbing up to 2ft.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Parco Refining LLC in Sinclair, WY is seeking a Health and Safety Manager who oversees and ensures compliance with all applicable local, state and federal occupational health, safety, emergency response, contractor safety, security and process safety laws, regulations, standards as well company policies and procedures. Oversees the development of department program(s) and training. Manages risk, ensures compliance and promotes a safe work environment.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Serve as a Refinery Leadership Team Member reporting directly to the Refinery Manager.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides leading and lagging metrics to the Refinery Leadership Team and collaborates with them on continuous improvement and compliance initiatives.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manages the Health &amp; Safety Department, Process Safety Department, Contractor Safety, Security and Emergency Response.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prepares and maintains necessary accident and safety records and reports required by the company, associations, and governmental bodies<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees the development and management of department budgets and related capital projects.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides Health &amp; Safety and Process Safety oversight during refinery turnarounds including daily safety audits with feedback.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees regulatory audits as required.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Follow through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Create and maintain a well-organized and professional-looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Other duties as assigned by the supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in refining or equivalent is required. A minimum of five (5) years management experience. Preferred five (5) years of experience in Safety, Emergency Response or Process Safety.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Safety, Engineering or related field is required. Certified Safety Professional, Certified Industrial Hygienist or Professional Engineer is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to lead and direct the work of others. Advanced knowledge of OSHA and EPA regulations. Working knowledge of Microsoft products. Working knowledge of Fault Tree Analysis and Quantitative Analysis preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Responsible for the supervision of up to eight employees.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and field based with up to 15% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, working in confined spaces, exposure to the risk of electrical shock, fumes, loud noises, vibrations, and airborne particles. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, perceiving color differences, wearing personal protective equipment, and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n with discovery responsibilities on cases and matters working with other attorneys.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops litigation strategy and supervises implementation of the strategy by attending depositions, hearings and trials.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists with litigation matters and projects, including legal research related to those matters.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works closely cross-functionally to advise on legal implications of litigation.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Plans and develops solutions to existing or potential legal problems, and advises management and employees concerning legal rights and obligations and risks.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Interfaces with, and manages, outside counsel on various litigation matters in an efficient and cost-effective manner as needed to compliment the internal legal resources.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responds to subpoenas.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participates in continuing legal education programs and other activities as necessary to keep informed of developments in the law, new and proposed statutes and regulations, economic and social issues and other matters of interest to the Company and the energy industry.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Willingness to take on projects as requested.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by his\u002Fher superior, as determined from time to time in the supervisor’s sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Minimum of five (5) years’ experience as a licensed attorney at a law firm or public corporation.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Strong academic credentials and a stable work history<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Demonstrated litigation or regulatory work experience<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Strong interpersonal and communication skills<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reputation for high ethical standards and integrity<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to work both independently and as a member of a team<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><b> Preferred Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Experience with litigation matters<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Experience managing a large docket of cases<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Minimum of a Jurisprudence Doctorate Degree from an American Bar Association accredited law school is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Advanced legal drafting and analytical skills; strong organizational skills, advanced reading and writing skills; interpersonal, problem solving, research and document review; and word processing skills. Licensed and in good standing with a state bar is required (admission to the State Bar of Texas is strongly preferred). Ability to effectively communicate with others at all levels of the organization and outside counsel, both written and verbal communication. Strong public speaking skills along with presentation skills. Extremely responsive to a high volume of diverse requests.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Self-motivated, organized team player who works well in a high-energy and fast-paced environment. Cooperative encourages collaboration and builds understanding; ability to find common ground and solve problems, and who owns their own projects and commitments.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with travel up to 20% by land and air required. Subject to all weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Petroleum refinery and out-of-doors environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, and rotating equipment.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair is is seeking a Product Specialist based out of our Tulsa, Oklahoma refinery. The Product Specialist is responsible for product development and providing technical expertise for lubricants and specialty products (e.g. base oils, process oils, waxes and\u002For aromatic extracts). Develops products to meet customer requirements that align with corporate growth strategies. Plans and coordinates technical projects to ensure objectives are accomplished within prescribed timeframe. May direct or lead the work of others to accomplish these tasks.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Recognized as a product specialist\u002Fexpert by internal members of the organization and by some members of the Industry<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop formulations for a range of lubricant products and validate their performance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop expertise in lubrication science and applications (including process oil applications)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Apply a range of scientific principles accurately and effectively to support research and technical support activities<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assist with laboratory work which will include preparing samples for analysis, executing physical testing and coordinating testing with external laboratories<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responsible for obtaining data, preparing tables and analysis of data for review with supervisor or senior Product Specialists<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide guidance to more junior Product Specialists and taking responsibility to direct work of Technologists<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide technical leadership and support to Marketing, Sales, Operations, Technical Services and customers<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide product issue resolution support (including production blending, product waivers, product failure complaints) and collaborate within the organization to solve problems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop new and update old products to satisfy customer requirements while allowing for efficient manufacture by identifying customer requirements and translating them into written specifications and manufacturing controls, and working with Manufacturing to minimize production costs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyze and communicate experimental results both internally and externally to multiple levels of the organization. External communications may include customer and\u002For industry presentations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May be required to liaise with industry to help shape and influence product specifications and industry standards (e.g. ASTM, STLE, Rubber Division ACS, Asphalt Institute, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Interact with component suppliers and customers<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Evaluate and analyze competitive products to identify threats or benefits to the company, providing a source of industry intelligence<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assist with developing R&amp;D plans, and tracking spend versus budgets<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Adhere to all safety, quality (ISO 9001) and environmental (ISO 14001) standards, procedures and initiatives. Document and maintain records<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Strong relevant work experience<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Minimum of 5 years of related job experience and R&amp;D<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Comprehensive knowledge of petroleum industry and\u002For related products<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or related field is required<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Demonstrated laboratory experience<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to utilize laboratory testing equipment and formulate products to meet a wide range of uses and specifications<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Aware of technological trends and industry advances<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Familiar with ISO 9001 and ISO 14001<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Demonstrated communication skills including strong technical writing and presentation skills<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Demonstrated project management, leadership and planning skills<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to work well within a team and independently is critical<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Innovative, creative and technically savvy with strong analytical and problem-solving skills<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to perform complex mathematic calculations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Results and customer focused<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Knowledge of the manufacturing process and process engineering of lubricant and\u002For oil products (e.g. base oils, process oils, waxes and\u002For aromatic extracts, etc.) is preferred. Specific Knowledge of Process oil applications and Specialty product development is also preferred. Specific knowledge of one or more of the following; Compounding of Polymer and Rubber for industrial and tire applications, Asphalt, Chemical Processing, Agricultural Science, as well as plant and processing equipment experience. The ability to translate this knowledge to other end use markets.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Coordinate laboratory work of technologist within the group<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manage contract research expenses to obtain product approvals<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide guidance to junior professional staff<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Office and chemical laboratory environment. Refinery based, industrial environment, including, but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, and tanks. Occasional travel by air and land to group meetings, industry meetings and customer sites<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
