Operations Scheduler. This position increases the efficiency of the operations process through the creation of manpower schedules and proper allocation of resources, working in SchedulePro and Kronos. Works with Learning and Performance group to schedule reoccurring training and upgrade training requirements<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Works independently to schedule manpower for Operations Department several weeks in advance to ensure resources are in place.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Understands current site contract requirements pertaining to schedules, and works with area Production Supervisors to maintain those requirements.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Liaises with various departments to determine and set schedules. Revises daily schedule, as necessary, and communicates w\u002F the area Production Supervisors on all changes to affected areas<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintains operations shift and vacation scheduling for the Production hourly and Staff.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintains and supports Production training calendar working with the Learning and Performance department.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Supports schedules for training classes in areas such as ERT, Hazwoper, safety, and any other required specialized training for the Operations department.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> May include some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Assists Training Department with the scheduled demonstration of practices or procedures being taught by the production trainers.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides new hire and temporary employee orientation classes on schedules\u002Fkronos as required for their role within the production department.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coordinates schedules or shutdown outage communications with the Production Supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee word processing, database, e-mail, spreadsheet and other computer applications skills are required. The ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication, basic reading and writing skills, time management skills; detail oriented; ability to present schedule &amp; training materials. The ability to perform basic mathematical calculations, organizational skills, with ability to prioritize, and take initiative.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n    <p><b>Preferred Skills:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Knowledge of on-the-job and classroom training in adult learning principles, LMS experience, SAP\u002FGSAP, Kronos and other Microsoft Products experience are preferred.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Primarily Office work, with some field based with up to 10% travel by land and air may be required to receive offsite training. <\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Sinclair WY is seeking an Unit Process Operator to safely and reliably operate the process and equipment to meet strategic business goals.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Ensure safety procedures are followed.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Recognize hazards and takes action to eliminate\u002Fmitigate and “Stop Work” if necessary.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Participate in shift turnovers.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Pass all Operator testing, training in Process Safety Management, Occupational Safety and Health regulations and perform all Operator requirements as needed.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Work12-hour rotating shifts, including weekends and holidays.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Work alone on a required portion of the unit.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Follow emergency procedures including interlocks, emergency shutdown, vapor release and escape pack use, loss of power and\u002For utilities.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Communicate appropriately both inter and intra shift and with other departments in person or via radio or telephone.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Behave in a manner that promotes teamwork.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Demonstrate a desire for continuous learning.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Follow-through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Create and maintain a well-organized and professional-looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Other duties as assigned by supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Experience\u002FEducation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> High school diploma or equivalent and ACT Workkeys for Job Seekers-Work Place Documents and Graphic Literacy. College, industrial or prior process operations experience a plus. Must be able to read, write and understand instructions, procedures and policies written in English. Computer experience preferred. Must be able to work fair amounts of overtime, some of which is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b><br> Additional Requirements: <\u002Fb>Applications without resumes or your ACT Workkeys results will not be considered. We will accept ACT Workkeys tests if completed within 3 years of application.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> ACT Workkeys for Job Seekers Testing centers are located throughout the United States. To find a testing center near you go to: <b>www.act.org\u002Fcontent\u002Fact\u002Fen\u002Fproducts-and-services\u002Fworkkeys-for-job-seekers\u002Fshared\u002Ftest-site-locator-form.html.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Computer experience a plus. Knowledge of the location and function of all unit vessels and basic process flows. Know how to use Personal Protective Equipment, fill out Job Safety Analysis, look up a Material Safety Data Sheet, safety procedures and how to use all unit safety equipment. Know Lock Out Tag Out procedure, how to fill out permits and proper use of five gas detectors. Knowledge of chemical, electrical and safety hazards. Knowledge of Environmental Limits and how to respond to non-compliance, spill containment and reporting. Knowledge of environmental procedures when draining hydrocarbon and other chemicals, flaring and controlling leaks and spills. Knowledge of rotating equipment, proper lubrication, emergency shutdown, vibration and temperature monitoring and location of switch gear. Knowledge of rail car and truck loading and unloading, how to operate the forklift, Rail King and other supporting equipment.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n on a required portion of the unit.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Follow emergency procedures.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Communicate effectively and appropriately with operations and other departments in person or via High school diploma or equivalent required. College, industrial or prior process operations experience a plus. Computer experience a plus.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><br> Must have legal authorization to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future without requiring sponsorship.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Must be at least 18 years of age.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Must be able to read, speak, and write English fluently and understand operating procedures.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Must demonstrate a competency at using a process computer interface to manipulate and control an operating process unit.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> As a part of the pre-employment selection process, candidates are required to submit to and receive satisfactory results from a pre-employment medical screening, background check, and drug tests.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> With or without reasonable accommodations, be willing to work at heights, climb ladders and stairs, walk on high elevation grating, work in inclement weather, work around loud industrial equipment, work in compact and confined spaces, and work outdoors.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <p>Salary Range estimate from 87,000 to 121,700<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Holly Energy Partners located in Denver, CO is seeking a Terminal Supervisor. The Terminal Supervisor oversees all product movement in and out of the facility. Operations include truck and rail loading\u002Foffloading, tank transfers, pipeline receipts and other duties as they come up.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Pivotal role coordinating with the pipeline scheduling and marketing departments<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Responsible for the computer software training<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Determines work procedures, sets priorities, prepares work schedules and expedites Terminal workflow<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Prioritizes procurement of materials and equipment<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assesses current processes, including evaluating appropriate software, and provides recommendations for automation and efficiencies<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Establishes, maintains and documents procedures for department to organize workflow; organizes and conducts weekly meetings<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Analyzes and develops solutions for problems arising within the department<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Prepares weekly payroll input, verifying employee calculations, and maintains and verifies attendance and leave allocation for account receivable employees<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Acts as liaison between Terminal and other related departments as needed<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Act as a liaison with local, state, and federal regulator authorities<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coordinate training with responding municipal emergency services<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Verifies Terminal documents for accuracy of calculations, information and approvals<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Handles escalated telephone calls and checks and responds to department electronic mail<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develops reports, isolates potential operational issues, and provides recommendations and ad hoc reports to appropriate management<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of seven years of related experience with at least two years in a lead role is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in related field or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Special training and\u002For certifications in computer accounting software and hazardous materials is essential. A significant amount of energy industry and supervisory experience is required. Basic reading and writing skills with the ability to perform basic level mathematical calculations. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Responsible for the direct supervision of 4 employees within the Terminal.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office and field based with 10% travel by land and air required. Refined petroleum products, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, working in confined spaces, and exposure to the risk of electrical shock. Subject to all temperatures, weather, and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand &amp; finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 25lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 25 lbs, climbing up to 60 ft, strenuous physical activity, perceiving color differences, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates, valid State driver’s license and proof of insurance required, and ability to wear personal protective equipment (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <p>HF Sinclair is seeking a <b>Rotational Development Program Associates<\u002Fb> to be based in our headquarters in Dallas, TX. This is a 2 year rotational development program that will provide high potential individuals with the opportunity to rotate throughout several functions before settling on a career direction. The candidate will take ownership on assigned projects and gain cross functional knowledge and experience throughout the program. Rotation options include but are not limited to the Procurement, Internal Audit, Renewables and the Global Logistics departments where the candidate will develop a strong understanding of our business and each department’s role in contributing to the success of our organization. The rotational development program will also provide you with networking opportunities, lunch &amp; learns with company leadership and in-house training opportunities.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Job Duties:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Internal Audit: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Conducts financial and operational risk-based audits and review of internal controls of the Company’s operations; projects cover a wide variety of business risks across financial, operational, technological and strategic areas<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops recommendations for audit findings, focusing on strengthening internal controls, quality and efficiency<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists in annual Sarbanes-Oxley (“SOX”) 404 testing including process documentation, testing execution, issue follow-up, and External Audit assistance<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Procurement: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Researches and extracts spend data from HollyFrontier systems and creates meaningful reporting to identify trends, performance metrics and issues.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conducts industry and market research to understand assigned categories and creates reporting for category managers and business stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists in the design and interface with the business of multi-year category management plans.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Global Logistics:\n   <ul>\n    <li> Partners with key internal\u002Fexternal stakeholders to support logistics systems roadmap.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists in the planning, design, and execution of commercial logistics sourcing activities.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Utilizes data from HollyFrontier and 3rd party logistics systems to investigate and resolve issues related to freight invoice processing and payment. Identify trends and work closely with logistics service providers to resolve on-going issues.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Renewables:\n   <ul>\n    <li> Analysis and proposal on potential future organic or external renewable investment opportunity <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Performs renewable feedstock, low carbon product market or analysis to assist in commercial, capital investment and strategic decision making process<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors industry dynamics and helps anticipate how these trends will impact our business<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Must have successfully completed an internship program or have 0 - 2 years of experience.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Education Level:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> A minimum of a bachelor’s degree in business with a concentration in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Supply Chain or related field with a minimum of a 3.0 GPA.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Required Skills:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Strong skills in Microsoft Office Excel (e.g., V-Lookup, pivot tables); and strong analytical skills with solid attention to detail. Strong project management skills and ability to multi-task complex requirements. Intermediate reading, writing and mathematical skills. Needs to show initiative and strong problem solving skills. Must be results oriented with an ability to influence through good written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Work Conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Office based with up to 20% travel by land or air .Will be required to spend part of the rotation in a refinery location.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> About HF Sinclair:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Equal Opportunity Employer:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> HF Sinclair is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of Manages a team of professionals and associates<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Manages human resource operations and establishes objectives to grow our culture, develop our people and improve efficiency as well as cost effectiveness for the assigned client group<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Utilizes knowledge of the business landscape to proactively develop staffing, succession and workforce plans<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides guidance, facilitation, and administration for the assigned client group(s) on wage and salary administration, talent identification, development and acquisition, performance management, policy or other document interpretation, dispute resolution, HR programs and benefits, and application of appropriate regulatory requirements while ensuring compliance with policies and practices<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Leads HR investigations and\u002For provides guidance in the area of employee complaints\u002Fissues and assists legal<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Serves as primary representative for labor relations including contract negotiations, preparation, chief spokesperson, union\u002Fmanagement meetings including grievances, arbitrations, etc.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Recommends policies and solutions to management and client group(s)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participates in the development of processes and programs with the Centers of Excellence (COE) ensuring successful integration within the assigned client group(s)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Constructively works towards the best possible process within Human Resources to meet the client’s needs while recognizing the demands of the business as a whole<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Creatively grows and promotes the organization’s culture and vision<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coach managers on complex employee relations issues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides leadership &amp; support to client Leadership Teams in the areas of HR strategy, talent development, labor relations, and performance management<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides appropriate communications to support the needs of the assigned client group(s)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures compliance with all relevant regulatory and reporting agencies and legal compliance with all applicable governmental laws and regulations covering the following areas, but not limited to, wage and hour, EEOC, OFCCP, HIPPA, ADAA, FMLA, etc.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews and approves personnel changes in accordance with Company procedures and practices<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees the maintenance of employee files and other record keeping, understands and ensures state and federal laws pertaining to Human Resources, including collecting, sharing, and storing Protected Health Information (PHI) paperwork are followed at all times<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responsible for development of budgets relating to human resources department, headcount and plantwide initiatives<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responsible for facilities management and staff in partnership with local leadership team, Legal and Corporate Health and Safety<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their manager, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of eight years related experience and with five years of human resources experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Experience in a unionized manufacturing environment is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree, in a business or human resources related field, is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to lead and direct the work of others providing clear direction and accountability of staff. Working knowledge of various functions in HR such as organizational planning, employee relations, compensation, talent management and talent acquisition, benefits, policies, etc. Proficient with MS Office applications such as Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc. (Including formulas to more efficiently analyze data), ability to perform intermediate level mathematical calculations is required. Knowledge of laws, pronouncements and regulations pertaining to human resource operations. Strong planning and organizational skills, ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication skills, analytical with the ability to read and appropriately interpret information from multiple sources. Excellent interpersonal skills, tact and maturity to work with all levels of employees and management. Ability to implement and develop supervisor\u002Fmanagement and leadership skills and programs. Presentation skills with the ability to speak in front of a large group. Responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of information including Protected Health Information (PHI) and all applicable compliance issues in relation to relevant HIPAA regulations.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Responsible for the direct supervision of up to 10 employees, both professional and administrative.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with travel up to 25% by land or air required. Subject to varying road and weather conditions. Depending on location, work environment may include weekly visits into a Refinery\u002FIndustrial Environment, Warehouse, or other field locations.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting or carrying and pushing or pulling up to 25 lbs, climbing up to 3 ft. Job conditions may require wearing personal protective equipment (PPE) when in the refinery or other work site (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><br> HF Sinclair is seeking an <b>Internal Controls Analyst<\u002Fb> to be based in our headquarters in Dallas, TX. This position will play a key role in the Company's Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance program and the Internal Controls over Financial Reporting (ICFR). The Internal Controls Analyst will work with Management to increase the operating efficiency of the Company’s internal controls while ensuring compliance by management.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Assist with the planning and execution of the annual SOX risk assessment process to support the SOX compliance plan.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Proactively identify, assess, manage, monitor, remediate, and report inconsistencies, redundancies, and control deficiencies through execution of the annual process<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintenance of SOX documentation including narratives, control library, and risk matrices<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Act as a technical resource for management in the implementation of their controls providing guidance on the proper detective, preventive and corrective controls needed.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Work with process owners to ensure policy and procedure documentation is current and updated as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Perform testing of control design and the testing of control effectiveness for assigned areas on behalf of management, as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assist with broader Accounting, Finance and GRC (governance, risk and compliance) initiatives as they surface.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by supervisor, as determined from time to time at their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of three years of on the job experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Preferred Experience:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Experience in internal audit, control testing, and data analytics.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree, in accounting, finance or related field, is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Preferred Education:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Master’s Degree and\u002For a CPA. CIA is a plus.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Strong knowledge of Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) Section 404, and COSO Internal Controls Framework, and Internal Controls over Financial Reporting. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft products, specifically Microsoft Excel. Experience with large accounting and maintenance ERP software (SAP a plus). An understanding of accounting practices (U.S. GAAP) and procedures is required. Must have proficient reading and writing skills, the ability to perform intermediate to advanced mathematical calculations, analyze and review large batches of data, and the ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbally, across all levels of the organization. Proactive, responsive, takes ownership and accountability, drives processes, meets timelines and critical deadlines.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with travel throughout the United States to the petroleum refinery by land and air occasionally. May be required to work flexible hours. Subject to all weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Holly Energy Partners located in Artesia, NM is seeking a Mechanical Technician. The Mechanical Technician conducts assignments to support the rotating equipment at Holly Energy Partners pipeline. Rotating equipment includes: pumps,compressors,drive systems and similary. Support of these systems includes opportunities to improve system performance and reliability. These goals are accomplished through the following job duties.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Works primarily on pipeline equipment and pump stations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures equipment is operating properly<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responds to upsets and abnormal operating instances<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Verifies compliance with DOT requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures operations and safety procedures are followed at all times<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Represents the company to third parties<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains, repairs, troubleshoots electrical and instrumentation devices, and installs rotating equipment, pumps, gear boxes, and compressors.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Recommend and implement improvements and\u002For modification in sequence of operations, equipment utilization, and related matters.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responds to emergency situations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes data on related components and systems, processes and methods ,to aid operations with decisions.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Must be able to read vibration signatures and evaluate machinery condition from vibration data.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Must be able to isolate the affected machinery component, recognize various common problems, and be able to make recommendations for continued operation or scheduled repairs.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Upgrades, designs, configures, maintains and monitors related equipment and performance.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of 5 years job-related pipeline experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma and Vibration Analysis I Certification are required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED EDUCATION LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Working knowledge of the pipeline industry or related industry. Strong background in rotating equipment, pumps, gear boxes, and compressors. An intermediate level of reading and writing ability and intermediate level ability to perform mathematical calculation is required. Must be able to effectively communicate with.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> General familiarization with DOT safety rules and regulations is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and field\u002Frefinery based with up to 25% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse and plant environment, out-of-doors, and driver environments, including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, and exposure to the risk of electrical shock. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 5 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards are not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid State driver’s license and proof of insurance required, and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair <\u002Fb>is seeking a Crude Oil Scheduler to be based at our Dallas corporate office. Conducts complex assignments for the Crude Oil Supply department under limited supervision.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Schedules and coordinates daily &amp; monthly crude oil movements on assigned transportation carriers and into assigned refinery and at all trading points, including bulk and lease purchasing<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates crisis management for situations involving conflicts arising out of short-term or long-term refinery\u002Flogistical problems causing crude throughput shortages, refinery cutbacks, customer complaints, etc.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors assigned crude inventories which may include daily crude movements and inventory positions, communicating with appropriate departments, and optimizing assigned crude inventories<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews and monitors receipts, deliveries and exchange balances with trading partners<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates with Tank Farm Manager at assigned refinery to manage tank levels outside and inside the Refinery<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes bill of lading (BOL) as needed to resolve measurement disagreement with customer<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Liaises with third party pipeline companies and\u002For carriers on tariffs, expansion or other policy matters that affect company as it relates to the assigned crude inventory<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees movements of assigned crude inventory to appropriate refinery in order to maximize refinery profits<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews and ensures accuracy of contract information in assigned system and contract obligations are fulfilled<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures accuracy of all invoices and cumulative balances are kept at a minimum, working with other departments to facilitate timely crude movements, invoicing, and payments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manages and maintains good working relationships with customers, exchange partners, suppliers and\u002For third party personnel, working with traders and schedulers to maximize crude movements and values for Company depending on assigned crude inventory and refinery<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Resolves service issues with common carrier pipeline<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Keeps Manager and other key personnel informed of conditions, activities and trends in area of responsibility which may have an impact on the business and works closely with Manager to capture market values<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their manager, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five years of job related and industry experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in a technical or related field, or equivalent work experience in lieu of a degree, is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to perform a variety of assignments as they relate to marketing department and multi-task. Advanced computer skills particularly in MS Excel to provide written reports and spreadsheets as well as the ability to learn new programs. Advanced interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication, customer service are necessary to create mutual respect with peers and a positive work environment. Knowledge of safety, environmental and transportation regulations and procedures; capable of writing effective instructions. Ability to maintain positive and productive working relationship within department and with other departments. Intermediate reading and writing skills; ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations. Working knowledge of crude oil inventory by system.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> ECC functional\u002Fend user experience preferred. SAP SD\u002FMM, TSW knowledge is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with up to 30% travel by land and air required. Subject to all weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, perceiving color differences. Job conditions may require standing, walking, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 25lbs.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Sinclair, WY is seeking a Safety Representative who would conduct mid to high level health and safety assignments for the Department under minimal supervision. May direct or lead the work of others from time-to-time. Ensures applicable elements of the PARCO Safety Management System are effectively implemented and sustained through training, coaching and system oversight. Conducts training and personal coaching to communicate expectations and instruct employees in safe work practices. Daily engagement with field supervision and workers to monitor commitment to safe productive work. Daily vigilant oversight of assigned work activity to ensure that requirements of all applicable standards for the worker’s safety are met. Maintains safety related records as required. <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Works to minimize the number of accident and injuries.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Mitigates hazardous conditions and reduces unsafe actions.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews and updates health and safety policies and procedures, as required.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists with safety audit evaluations and identifying areas for improvement.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides consultations and recommendations for safety and health issues.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees the maintenance of health and safety equipment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Guide and sign-off on permitting to include Confined Space Work, Hot Work and High-Risk Work.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop and deliver health and safety trainings for annual safety training, new employee safety training, and specific trainings based on audit, inspection and investigation findings.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides general Plant Safety support.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate in planning and daily supervisory dialog to ensure job health and safety concerns are appropriately communicated and integrated into the daily work scope.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate in Turnaround and Project planning to ensure health and safety concerns are identified at the appropriate stage of the process and integrated into the work scope.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Perform Job Safety Analysis, intervention and follow-up on safety-related issues with frontline supervision and workers.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide support for and\u002For serve as an investigation lead on investigation teams as needed following an incident.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides Safety Hazard input to HAZOP studies, MOCs, PSSRs and supports PSM program as required.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Support site assurance observation and employee engagement efforts.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Follow-through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Create and maintain a well-organized and professional looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Other duties as assigned by your supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Minimum of five years refinery, petro chemical or heavy industrial safety experience and\u002For 8 years of field safety experience.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Bachelor’s Degree or the equivalent years of experience in lieu of the degree is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Working knowledge of occupational safety and industrial hygiene, and ability to apply this knowledge. Special training\u002FCertifications in Industrial Safety, Hazard Assessment, HAZWOPER, and similar occupational industrial safety training. Understanding of Safety Practices basics and application of Safety Policies, and Procedures for field activities. Demonstrated ability to stand firm on doing the job safely if challenged, acting in a diplomatic manner. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication, advanced reading and writing skills, ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations. Computer skills are required with good working knowledge of Word processing and spreadsheet applications. <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or GED equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>PREFERRED EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Trade school or journeyman\u002Fcraftsman training is preferred. A Bachelor’s Degree depending on location is also preferred.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> REQUIRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Knowledge of refinery operations and craft knowledge. Depending on location, extensive knowledge of refinery instrumentation, electrical and rotating equipment. Knowledge of safe work practices related to the specified fields. Intermediate leadership, interpersonal, organization oral, basic reading and writing skills with the ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Computer skills necessary to operate DataStream D7i, Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and Internet Explorer. Ability to lead and train a small group of employees. Multi-tasking and team orientation skills. Self-starter and safety sensitive. Troubleshooting skills and ability to function effectively in a team atmosphere. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> SUPERVISORY\u002FMANAGERIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Depending on location, may provide occasional relief supervisor responsibilities of hourly maintenance employees for various foremen, or direct supervision of five salaried employees and leadership and indirect supervision to other salaried employees of the maintenance department and hourly employees as needed.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>WORK CONDITIONS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Office and field based with up to 5% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver based environment, including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment and working in confined spaces. Subject to varying road and weather conditions. Periodic overtime required. Required to respond to plant related emergencies and be available after hours during critical business situations depending on location.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise finger and hand movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 30lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 200ft, and ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates, perceiving color differences, ability to wear personal protective equipment (beards not permitted), and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> ENVIRONMENTAL, HEALTH, &amp; SAFETY RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Our primary values at HF Sinclair are: We put health and safety first; We care about the environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p> All HollyFrontier employees are expected to work safely every day and be safety &amp; environmental leaders. This includes active participation in the following:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Stops and\u002For reports any unsafe work or conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follows safety &amp; environmental policies and procedures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports safety &amp; environmental goals and initiatives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in safety &amp; environmental meetings, training, emergency drills and hazard recognition programs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reports all accidents, injuries and near misses, and participates in associated investigations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in industrial hygiene, medical surveillance and behavior-based safety programs<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Conducts maintenance assignments and duties for the Maintenance Department under minimal supervision. Increases the efficiency of the maintenance process through the creation of safe and cost effective job plans and schedules. May direct or lead the work of others depending on location. All planning responsibilities may pertain to Instrumentation, Electrical and Mechanic work depending on assignment.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2
