Subject to varying road and weather conditions. Periodic overtime required. Required to respond to plant related emergencies and be available after hours during critical business situations depending on location.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise finger and hand movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 30lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 200ft, and ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates, perceiving color differences, ability to wear personal protective equipment (beards not permitted), and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair is seeking a <b>Strategic Business Planne<\u002Fb>r to be based in our headquarters in Dallas, TX. This position will conduct asset analysis, prepares metrics and reporting assignments for assigned department with minimal supervision.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Creates and analyzes competitive metrics for Company assets<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works with the refinery teams to assist in determining the projects and initiatives that economically improve the competitive position of our assets<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists in driving the applicable teams to a solution for large commercial initiatives<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs economic analysis and presents discretionary and required capital projects for the capital committee<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists with stewarding project process and capital committee preparation<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates between point of view and asset strategy to set priorities, actively participate in strategic studies and drive overall timeline for strategic conclusions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participates in regional developments and strategies (e.g. LCFS\u002FCap and Trade, fuels specification changes, pipeline commitments and tariffs)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works closely with Corporate leaders and Site leaders in Optimization, Crude Supply, Products, Commercial Analytics and Capital Project Groups to develop metrics and point of view and asset improvements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Regularly interfaces with Senior leadership in commercial, operations, capital projects and reliability and corporate finance<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of 8 years of experience in refining are required. Full understanding of refinery asset configuration and experience leading a successful project is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or related field is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to determine and develop multiple approaches to increasing plan profitability and quantitatively evaluating each approach as well as the ability to apply risk\u002Freward factors. Ability to stay abreast of new technology developments and processes is essential. Proficient with Microsoft products and experience with engineering software is required. LP, simulation, or modeling software demonstrated experience required. Excellent oral and written communication skills with ability to communicate effectively with others. Familiarity with standards and practices of the specific discipline. Ability to perform complex mathematical calculations and modeling. Economic thinker that has the ability to build trust within the organization and capable of influencing others. Advanced Critical and Entrepreneurial Thinking with the ability to professionally and tactfully challenge thinking when needed. Ability to make independent decisions within broad guidelines and policies.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and plant based with up to 25% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair headquartered in Dallas, TX is seeking a Product Scheduler who plans, schedules, and coordinates the movement of assigned refined products and\u002For intermediates from the source of supply to the bulk point of sale to ensure continuity of marketing supply under limited supervision.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Crisis management for situations that involve conflicts that arise out of products being off specification, short\u002Flong term refinery\u002Flogistical problems that cause product outages, customer complaints, human error that causes product outages, etc.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Plans, schedules, and coordinates oil movements and\u002For various light oil and\u002For heavy fuel oil products associated with the appropriate refinery by pipeline, rail car, and\u002For truck<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides constant monitoring of assigned light oil and\u002For heavy fuel oil product inventories which may include daily monitoring of oil movements, inventory positions and communicating with appropriate departments<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Schedules Common Carrier Pipelines, rail and\u002For truck movements<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Nominates product movements or tendering loads with appropriate pipeline companies and terminals or truck or railcar carrier and enters nomination in TSW\u002FTMW<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintains good working relationships with transportation carriers, pipeline customers, exchange partners, suppliers and\u002For third party pipeline personnel. Work with blenders, traders, schedulers to maximize product movements and values for HollyFrontier Corporation<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensures accuracy of all invoices and cumulative balance are kept at a minimum<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p> May include some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Works closely with Supply and Light Oils management to capture market values<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitors and coordinate feedstock inventories and deliveries that are moved on pipelines, trucks, and\u002For railcar<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Works with Customs Brokers when exports to foreign countries occur<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identifies areas that would benefit product movements or product sales of HollyFrontier's light oil products and improve purchased prices for pipelined feed stocks. Take ownership in sale\u002Fpurchase\u002Fmovements of mentioned products to help improve refinery profits<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintains close communication with Manager and other key personnel informed of conditions, activities and trends in area of responsibility which may have an impact on the business<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Represents the company at industry functions<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Works closely with trader to manage product exchanges with other refiners<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Produces daily inventory position report for all three refineries<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Analyzes and researches demurrage bills by using geometrix system (for accurate billing)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Updates ethanol sales and receipts into spreadsheet<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides back up support to railcar and pipeline scheduling<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Helps determine alternate routings for oil movements<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Prepares, generates and distributes tariffs information internally and externally<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of five years of on-the-job experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of a Bachelor's degree is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Advanced analytical and research skills required to analyze various data. Intermediate knowledge of the Company's business process including but not limited to tank farm blending, loading, transfer, inspection and shipping procedures, product marketing, refining procedures, invoicing, and cash to order business process. Intermediate to advanced computer skills particularly in MS Excel to provide written reports and spreadsheets as well as the ability to learn new programs such as internet rail programs. Interpersonal, customer service, and communication skills are necessary to create mutual respect with peers and a positive work environment. Knowledge of safety, environmental and transportation regulations and procedures, basic math, reading blueprints, capable of writing effective instructions. Ability to maintain positive and productive working relationship within department and with other departments. Ability to communicate effectively with others, both written and verbal communication, ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations, advanced reading and writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n    <p> SAP TSW, BI, ECC functional\u002Fend user experience preferred. Geometrix rail car tracking system experience preferred.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office based with occasional refinery visits from time to time and with travel up to 30% by land and air required. Petroleum refinery\u002Findustrial environment, including but not limited to, working near moving mechanical parts and\u002For rotating equipment, petroleum products, chemicals, pressure vessels, and\u002For tanks. Subject to varying road and weather conditions.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Job conditions require, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise finger and hand movements, reaching or grasping. Job conditions may require standing, walking, and wearing personal protective equipment (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><b> About HollyFrontier Lubricants and Specialty Products <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>At HollyFrontier Lubricants &amp; Specialty Products (HFLSP), we are powered by experience and driven by our people to provide world-class products and innovative solutions for our customers and stakeholders. HFLSP produces base oils, finished lubricants and specialty products under the Petro-Canada Lubricants, Red Giant Oil and Sonneborn brands, and serves virtually every industry across more than 80 counties.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> About HollyFrontier Corporation <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>HollyFrontier Corporation, headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent petroleum refiner and marketer that produces high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel and other specialty products. HollyFrontier owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming and Utah and markets its refined products principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. In addition, HollyFrontier produces base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and Netherlands, and exports products to more than 80 countries. HollyFrontier also owns a 57% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HollyFrontier.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> HollyFrontier Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of Comply with health, safety and environmental regulations.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Oversees quality of work, safety, and overall performance of assigned staff<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Plans, organizes and oversees all work schedules for assigned employees<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assists engineering as needed<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coordinates with operations in scheduling equipment for repairs, and construction (depending on assignment), and developing work plans<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides training, mentorship and coaching for subordinates and peers<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p> May be required to do some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Monitors and enforces contractor compliance to all refinery safety and environmental regulations<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participates in contract negotiations<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Tracks head count and verifies timesheets to ensure cost and schedule compliance<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Performs on-call duties<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Issues confined space work permits<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Orders plant instrument process controls and indicators<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Inputs and closes I&amp;E and MDI work orders and generate requisitions<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Supervises relief to other maintenance management personnel<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Oversees department’s yearly budget<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintains all electrical and instrumentation equipment in the plant, offices and maintenance shops<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Directs operational personnel on computer screen controls<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Leads safety discussions and demonstrate leadership behavior that reinforces safety policies and culture<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Oversees electrical and instrument maintenance, work conduit and electrical wiring for motor controls for both AC &amp; DC voltage, and lifting, hauling, pumping, etc., service for all maintenance foremen and operations<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of seven years of related job experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in a related field, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience, is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Knowledge of refinery operations. Specific craft knowledge. Proven interpersonal skills. Self-starter and safety sensitive. Troubleshooting skills and ability to function effectively in a team atmosphere. May require special training depending on craft and location: Eng Was (188 Montana) Station Configuration\u002FFiber Optics, Electrical &amp; Instrumentation, Laser alignment, compressors, welding and equipment operation. A significant amount of experience working with job related equipment is essential. The ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication. Basic reading and writing skills. The ability to perform basic level mathematical calculations.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Journeyman Electrical License and equipment operation CDC (190 Artesia &amp; UT) is preferred, depending on craft and location. May require certification in any or all of the following depending on craft and location: Certification in Level II ISA, Journeyman Electrical License, Crane and Rigging Inspector Certification, etc., Measurement &amp; Controls, Fundamental of Management\u002FSupervisor, Control System &amp; P\u002FC geared for ABB (Bailey)(188 Montana) Configuration.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Responsible for the supervision of up to 15 employees. May be responsible for oversight of up to 50 contract employees.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping ,crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 30 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 200ft, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates, valid state driver’s license and proof of insurance, perceiving color differences, ability to wear personal protective equipment (beards not permitted) and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><b> About HollyFrontier Lubricants and Specialty Products <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>At HollyFrontier Lubricants &amp; Specialty Products (HFLSP), we are powered by experience and driven by our people to provide world-class products and innovative solutions for our customers and stakeholders. HFLSP produces base oils, finished lubricants and specialty products under the Petro-Canada Lubricants, Red Giant Oil and Sonneborn brands, and serves virtually every industry across more than 80 counties.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> About HollyFrontier Corporation <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>HollyFrontier Corporation, headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent petroleum refiner and marketer that produces high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel and other specialty products. HollyFrontier owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming and Utah and markets its refined products principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. In addition, HollyFrontier produces base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and Netherlands, and exports products to more than 80 countries. HollyFrontier also owns a 57% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HollyFrontier.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> HollyFrontier Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <p>BASIC FUNCTION: <\u002Fp>\n <p>Oversees departmental requirements specific to Process Engineering and Refinery Technical Services.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Assists in communicating priorities and reporting progress of assignments to the Department Manager<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintains detailed account of all process scope and engineering work performed by the group and provides regular updates<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Organizes and communicates technical service support efforts based on unit monitoring results and requests by the Department Manager and\u002For other refinery departments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Oversees efforts of Process Engineering to monitor unit performance and provide technical service for refinery needs as they arise<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provides process engineering support to various Departments, provides Unit Startup assistance for existing as well as new facilities, review daily unit reports and track performance of assigned units, communicate observations made via recommendations to the Operations Department, perform economic analysis and fill ROI reports for capital upgrades<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitors and tracks catalyst and chemical performance and usage and assist Operations in all catalyst and chemical applications including providing guidelines for startup and\u002For usage. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensures that Process scope development and Engineering meet targeted criteria for Safety Performance, Environmental Compliance, Process scope definition, Instrument scope definition, Process Engineering Contract scope definition, Comprehensive AFE Development, Accuracy and comprehensiveness of Process Engineering Designs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Completes scope development and Process Engineering within target schedule and provides project startup coverage<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Meets all Process Safety Management (PSM) requirements of the As Built project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manages team of Process Engineers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manages vendor relationships as required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate refinery energy conservation efforts as needed<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their superior, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Experience:<\u002Fp>\n <p> A minimum of five years engineering experience in a refinery environment are required.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical Engineering is required.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> REQUIRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Ability to lead and direct the work of others – typically individual contributors. Working knowledge of commonly used engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge analytically and to stay abreast of new technology developments and processes is essential. Knowledge of Microsoft products and experience with engineering software. Advanced reading and writing skills, the ability to perform complex mathematical calculations, and the ability to communicate effectively with others, both written and verbally, are required.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> SUPERVISORY\u002FMANAGERIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Responsible for the supervision of approximately six engineers. May be responsible for overseeing outside contract engineers.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>WORK CONDITIONS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Office, and field based with up to 20% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment and driver-based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels tanks, rotating equipment, and working in confined spaces. Subject to all temperatures varying road and weather conditions.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid State driver’s license and proof of insurance required, and strenuous physical activity. Job conditions may require twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping and working in confined spaces.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> ENVIRONMENTAL, HEALTH, &amp; SAFETY RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Our primary values at HF Sinclair are: We put health and safety first; We care about the environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p> All HF Sinclair employees are expected to work safely every day and be safety &amp; environmental leaders. This includes active participation in the following:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Stops and\u002For reports any unsafe work or conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follows safety &amp; environmental policies and procedures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports safety &amp; environmental goals and initiatives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in safety &amp; environmental meetings, training, emergency drills and hazard recognition programs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reports all accidents, injuries and near misses, and participates in associated investigations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in industrial hygiene, medical surveillance and behavior-based safety programs<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Oversees departmental requirements specific to Process Engineering and Refinery Technical Services.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 ADA)<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Assists in communicating priorities and reporting progress of assignments to the Department Manager<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintains detailed account of all process scope and engineering work performed by the group and provides regular updates<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Organizes and communicates technical service support efforts based on unit monitoring results and requests by the Department Manager and\u002For other refinery departments<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Oversees efforts of Process Engineering to monitor unit performance and provide technical service for refinery needs as they arise<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides process engineering support to various Departments, provides Unit Startup assistance for existing as well as new facilities, review daily unit reports and track performance of assigned units, communicate observations made via recommendations to the Operations Department, perform economic analysis and fill ROI reports for capital upgrades<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitors and tracks catalyst and chemical performance and usage and assist Operations in all catalyst and chemical applications including providing guidelines for startup and\u002For usage.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensures that Process scope development and Engineering meet targeted criteria for Safety Performance, Environmental Compliance, Process scope definition, Instrument scope definition, Process Engineering Contract scope definition, Comprehensive AFE Development, Accuracy and comprehensiveness of Process Engineering Designs<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Completes scope development and Process Engineering within target schedule and provides project startup coverage<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Meets all Process Safety Management (PSM) requirements of the As Built project<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Manages team of Process Engineers<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Manages vendor relationships as required<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coordinate refinery energy conservation efforts as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their superior, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete Subject to all temperatures varying road and weather conditions.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid State driverÃ¢Â€Â™s license and proof of insurance required, and strenuous physical activity. Job conditions may require twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping and working in confined spaces.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Sinclair WY is seeking a Process Engineer who will be accountable for the process health, optimization and management for their assigned unit(s). Should have general knowledge of all process units in the refinery.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Monitor the process unit on daily basis for general health and performance.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Give guidance, understanding economics, to unit supervisor on optimization for area of responsibility.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Track catalyst activity and predict end-of-run. Includes catalyst replacement selection and purchase.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Process trouble-shooting as issues occur. Monitor corrosion and chemical treatment programs in area of responsibility.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Track energy usage and make recommendations to reduce utility cost for the process unit.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide turn-around support for area of responsibility and back-up support for the general refinery.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Continuously evaluating process to identify process and control improvements.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Initiate and support Management of Change to properly document changes made in process unit.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate in unit Product Hazard Analysis; participate and on occasion lead incident investigations.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conduct unit performance tests to update or validate the Linear Program (LP) and HYSYS models.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Improve and maintain good unit weight balance.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Utilize process design skills to develop process support packages for Refinery projects.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide process training to unit personnel.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop well written technical reports and deliver well-structured oral presentations.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Continue personal development with self-driven on-site training and off-site training.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Follow through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Create and maintain a well-organized and professional looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Other duties as assigned by supervisor (may include weekend or night coverage on occasion).<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education\u002FExperience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Accredited Bachelor Degree in Engineering (Chemical, Petroleum, Mechanical) or Chemistry is required. Three or more years of relevant work experience preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair headquartered in Dallas, TX is seeking an IT HR Systems Analyst. This role is in IT organization and is responsible to support HF Sinclair Time and payroll systems along with overall integration of Core HR data. This position will be engaging actively with business process owners on day-to-day operation teams and will serve as the first line of support for Payroll, HR Managers and their teams at plant locations. This role also supports upgrades, patches, testing, implementations and integrations with other systems.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> In-depth knowledge and understanding of overall HR Time &amp; Payroll applications including SAP HCM, UKG Workforce Dimensions \u002F Workforce Central time and attendance along with new and latest HR cloud \u002F SaaS applications. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Must have knowledge of overall integration of HR data to various functions across the organization. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Work closely with the business teams to gather, collect and deliver HR solutions and work with development and cross-functional teams to make sure that the requirements delivered in time and to accuracy.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work closely with Corporate and site HR business teams and assist in day-to-day business operations. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Key daily tasks include monitoring the ticketing queues, resolving and closing the tickets on timely manner that include troubleshooting, providing standard and alternative solutions. Should also work on HR year-end activities, minor enhancements and testing.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Create and execute test plans, test cases and test scripts; identifies defects and works to a resolution with the Developers and business teams<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Communicate effectively across various teams, internal and external customers and stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work with IT and cross-functional teams across the organization to support the assigned projects and tasks related to HR\u002FPayroll.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> May require occasional travel to the sites.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Five plus years of experience of functional configuring knowledge in UKG workforce central and \u002F or Dimensions is required. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Three plus years of functional experience with other Timekeeping and Payroll systems similar to SAP, SucessFactors, ADP is preferred. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Thorough knowledge of interface integrations are needed and good understanding of union contracts \u002F pay practices preferred. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Setting up Accruals, Advanced Scheduling, Work Rules, Pay Rules, Holiday schedules, Attendance, Hyperfind Queries, Navigators, Pay Policies, Device Manager and Interface Tables in the TimeKeeping system are required. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>In depth, experience with more than one HR modules (Payroll, Employee data, Learning, Compensation) is required. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Ability to work closely with the HR and Payroll Business leads, IT functional and development teams and ensure assigned tasks completed in time and to accuracy. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work well with other groups within the delivery organization<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience in supporting Global \u002F Multi country HR applications.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Oil and Gas industry experience is preferred but not required<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 Subject to all weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Job conditions require sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential valid state driver license and proof of insurance required. Job conditions may require standing and walking.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><b> About HollyFrontier Lubricants and Specialty Products <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>At HollyFrontier Lubricants &amp; Specialty Products (HFLSP), we are powered by experience and driven by our people to provide world-class products and innovative solutions for our customers and stakeholders. HFLSP produces base oils, finished lubricants and specialty products under the Petro-Canada Lubricants, Red Giant Oil and Sonneborn brands, and serves virtually every industry across more than 80 counties.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> About HollyFrontier Corporation <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>HollyFrontier Corporation, headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent petroleum refiner and marketer that produces high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel and other specialty products. HollyFrontier owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming and Utah and markets its refined products principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. In addition, HollyFrontier produces base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and Netherlands, and exports products to more than 80 countries. HollyFrontier also owns a 57% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HollyFrontier.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> HollyFrontier Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair in Anacortes, WA is seeking a Crisis Management and Security Supervisor. This position oversees and ensures compliance with all applicable local, state and federal emergency preparedness and security laws and regulations. Leads and assures a management systems approach to emergency preparedness and response training, consistent with the HF Sinclair Emergency Preparedness Standard, to ensure capacity and competency of the site Incident Management Team (IMT) to meet the all-hazard emergency preparedness and regulatory compliance needs of the refinery. Responsible for managing the contract security guard service, security service vendors and off duty police, as applicable, to ensure the security and protection of company employees, contractors, &amp; visitors as well as the physical assets on company property. Interface directly with the Health &amp; Safety\u002FEmergency Response organization to ensure coordination between emergency preparedness, emergency response, and security functionality for the site.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Crisis Management<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Interfaces with Emergency Team Leads and supporting department leads on emergency management and security standards<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure site compliance with state and federal oil spill preparedness and response laws and regulations<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Design and execute annual oil spill table top drill to test the response capabilities of the IMT and effectiveness of the OSRP, to include triennial Worst-Case Discharge exercise<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Close coordination with the Health &amp; Safety\u002FEmergency Response (H&amp;S\u002FER) organization on emergency response training and drills, including site evacuation drills<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Interface with company and industry peers through participation in corporate Emergency Response and Security Network meetings and drills\u002Fschools, NW Area Committee and Coastal Area Contingency Plan meetings, Area Maritime Security Committee meetings, etc.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coordinate with the PSR Assurance Focal Point to facilitate periodic Assurance activities across the Crisis Management and Security activities<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Oversee management of the site Incident Management Team, ensuring the IMT is adequately staffed, trained, and all periodic drills are conducted as required<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coordinate with H&amp;S\u002FER organization and project teams to ensure crisis management and security compliance requirements are appropriately incorporated into project planning and reflected in site emergency response, crisis management, and security plans prior to project start-up.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p> Security<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Conduct and supervise the day-to-day security operation of the facility, ensuring compliance with the Facility Security Plan (FSP).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and maintain security policies, procedures, and programs for the organization consistent with company policies and applicable regulations, including the Transportation Worker Identification program (TWIC) and Marine Transportation Security Act (MTSA)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Update\u002FReview the FSP<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Conduct annual security exercises and quarterly drills to test the effectiveness of the FSP<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Close coordination with HR Department around workplace violence prevention and preparedness, including facilitating support for high-risk interactions<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain working relationships with federal, state, local law enforcement and regulatory agencies<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coordinate the initial security response to incidents.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure security equipment and systems are properly operated, tested, calibrated, and maintained.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Manages the site security and emergency preparedness budget, related capital projects, and support contracts, initiating actions to ensure proper budget goals are met<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensures tracking and closure of Security- and Crisis Management-related Action Items (e.g. incident investigation action items, audit findings, work orders, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to work extended or off-shift hours as required.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their manager, as determined from time to time at their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of 10 years of job-related experience required in crisis management and\u002For security management assignments, or equivalent, is required. Documented experience managing complex incidents.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Bachelor’s Degree in Emergency Management, Security Management, related field or related work experience in lieu of a degree.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Formal and informal leadership skills, ability to influence people outside of direct reporting structure. Advanced knowledge of Federal and WA State Emergency Preparedness and Response regulations. Incident Command System (ICS) implementation knowledge and experience. Working knowledge of Microsoft products. Working knowledge of science, basic refinery operations, maintenance, and engineering practices. Ability to effectively communicate with others through both written and verbal communication. Advanced leadership and interpersonal skills. Technical proficiency and professional competence. Goal oriented and organized. Ability to initiate changes and maintain balance of Business Line customer needs in an environment of governmental regulations. Advanced reading and writing skills, with the ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Preferred Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Advanced ICS training qualifications and ICS instructor certification or experience strongly desired.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Responsible for the direct supervision of contract security workforce management personnel; approximately 22 contractors.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office based with up to 20% travel by land, air and water required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors, driver-based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, working in confined spaces, and exposure to the risk of electrical shock. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Salary Range: The salary range includes the minimum, midpoint, and maximum base salary values. A candidate's offer can vary depending on differentiating factors, including but not limited to education, training, or experience.<\u002Fp>\n <p> This position has a salary minimum of $111,500.00, midpoint of $153,300.00, and maximum of activities between landscapes<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manage change control for SAP and non-SAP business applications<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manage passwords for non-user system ID’s<\u002Fli>\n    <li> class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with travel up to 10% of time by land or air is required. Subject to varying road and weather conditions. Occasional long hours, as well as nights and weekends as needed.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
