<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair in Anacortes, WA is seeking a Process Control Engineer. This position conducts control systems engineering duties and functions as a technical specialist, formulating and developing advanced engineering concepts. Supports refinery production through day-to-day direct contact and engagement.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Provides discipline specific engineering assistance, direction and development assistance to colleagues, Solves technical problems for business unit(s)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Upgrades, designs, configures, maintains and monitors systems related to process control<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develops project scopes, budgets and AFE’s for approval and ensures projects meet budget as well as refinery and OSHA standards<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensures the maintenance and integrity of business unit(s) data<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Optimizes business unit(s) and analyzes data to aid operations with decisions<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Researches and stays abreast of assigned discipline subjects, innovations and leading edge developments<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develops systems to document and track the testing and assist in the maintenance of the various systems<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p> May be required to do some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Participate in and facilitate incident investigations, including those unrelated to process control engineering.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate in activities including: Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), Management of Change (MOC) , and Pre Startup Safety Review (PSSR), Process Safety related audits, Layers Of Protection Analysis (LOPA) reviews, and Process Safety action items solution development and execution.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Devise process control schemes for manufacturing chemicals and products<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Implement processing methods and controls to meet quality standards in the most cost efficient manner<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Investigate and resolve work-in-process problems<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Recommend and implement improvements and\u002For modification in sequence of operations, equipment utilization, and related matters<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Review proposals of outside vendors regarding the purchase of new or modernization of existing equipment, systems, and software<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Improve profitability of the refinery<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Design and build plant additions and modifications<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of five years of progressive work experience in one or more of the following fields of control systems engineering: Process control, advanced process control, instrumentation, DCS systems. A strong understanding of basic refinery or petrochemical processes is required, with operating plant experience strongly preferred. <\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in an Engineering discipline is required. Direct industry experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree may be considered sufficient in compelling cases.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A strong personal and professional commitment to personal safety, process safety, and environmental responsibility is essential. Ability to manage a project is essential. Working knowledge of commonly used engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge analytically. Ability to stay abreast of new technology developments and processes is essential. Ability to communicate effectively with others, strong verbal communication skills, advanced level of reading and writing, ability to perform advanced mathematical calculations. Advanced ability to work effectively with multiple groups throughout the refinery. Strong knowledge of digital office applications (spreadsheet, work processing, email, and other applications); strong interpersonal, time-management and organizational skills; ability to provide training to multiple groups on a variety of applicable assigned discipline topics. Working knowledge of and experience with base layer process control concepts and application on distributed control systems is required. Understanding of process alarm management concepts is required. Understanding and experience managing change is required.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Preferred Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Knowledge of process hazard analysis, root cause analysis, and process safety concepts is preferred. Understanding and experience of advanced process control (APC) concepts and applications is strongly preferred. Working experience with Honeywell Experion and TPS DCS systems is strongly preferred.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Expected to lead informal teams and may be responsible for the supervision of personnel as well as contractors on an ad hoc basis. <\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office and plant based with up to 15% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors. Daily on-premises work at a refinery is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p> Salary Range: The salary range includes the minimum, midpoint, and maximum base salary values. A candidate's offer can vary depending on differentiating factors, including but not limited to education, training, or experience.<br> <br> This position has a salary minimum of $89,200.00 and maximum of <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> The Sales Manager is responsible for soliciting new process oil sales while servicing existing accounts in assigned geography of LA, TX, OK, NM, AZ, NV, CA, UT, CO and other states as determined. Process Oils are used in many industrial manufacturing applications, therefore strong selling skills along with a technical or chemical aptitude and industrial chemical sales experience is preferred. This region has significant asphalt-based applications so experience in this market would be preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Complete customer accountability in assigned geography including pricing recommendations, volume growth, margin and revenue management for direct customer accounts and\u002For distributors<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Aptitude for understanding customer applications and value based selling techniques<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Establish productive, professional relationships with key personnel internally as well as at assigned customer accounts<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Identify potential new customers\u002Flarge distributors and develop and execute appropriate account plans for stability and growth<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Negotiate long term contracts<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Meet goals set for profitable sales margin, volume growth and strategic objectives in assigned accounts and territory<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Proactively lead joint company-strategic account planning processes that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones for the account<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Proactively assess, clarify, and validate customer and\u002For distributor needs on an ongoing basis<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Lead solution development efforts that best address customer and\u002For distributor needs, quality or delivery issues, while coordinating the involvement of Marketing, Technical Service\u002FSales Advisors, Sales Managers, Sales Support, etc., to fully engage the customer in a long term relationship<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Use CRM platform (Salesforce.com) to manage and track customer relationship management at the head office level for existing customers and\u002For distributors and business development opportunity funnel, including call reports\u002Fvalue files, at the head office level<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Identify, manage and negotiate innovative new business opportunities with close interaction with internal resources<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manage and problem solve high priority\u002Fescalated items<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Price and margin management of assigned accounts<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Obtains and provides complete account information, including credit applications and tax exemption certificates for setting up new accounts, and works with Credit to ensure timely payments of invoices<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Learning and operating within the parameters of the account-based and team-based sales processes<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Represent HF Sinclair at industry events and trade functions to obtain new sales opportunities and promote brand loyalty and product awareness<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Helps train distributor sales representatives, monitors performance to business plan with distributor owners and management, and makes sales calls with distributors<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time, in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Industry related process oil sales experience or the aptitude for application-based sales of specialty chemical products in diverse manufacturing settings<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Previous experience in the sales of process oils or specialty chemicals and knowledge of the compounding of rubber, polymer or asphalt product applications preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n mathematical calculations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Strong Interpersonal and leadership skills, ability to move the account along. Organized, self-motivated and self-directed. Ability to achieve planned objectives<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to deal effectively with customers and\u002For distributors at various levels, including purchasing, quality, plant, technical personnel as well as senior management of customers<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to sell direct to end customers or through a Distributor network<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Strong negotiation skills<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to lead resolution of issues with multiple disciplines within the organization<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Strong crisis management skills: ability to handle situations involving conflicts arising out of products being off specification, short\u002Flong term refinery\u002Flogistical\u002Fhuman error, product outages, customer complaints, etc.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Results-focused<\u002Fli>\n    <li> aptitude and\u002For interest<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Computer literacy to ensure efficient communication and maintenance of accounts<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Use of Microsoft Office products<\u002Fli>\n <li> Experience in end use markets including paints and coatings, rubber and polymer, asphalt modifiers, adhesives and sealants and chemical additives preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> This is a home-based role with approximately 70-80% travel required<\u002Fli>\n    <li><b> The assigned territory for this Sales Manager is preferred in the Southwest U.S. and:<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Must reside within 50 miles of a large or medium hub commercial service airport<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Fleet Vehicle Reimbursement program provided<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Must have valid driver’s license<\u002Fli>\n    <li> No Travel restrictions within North America or Internationally<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Occasionally will be required to work in an industrial or refinery environment<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping. Job conditions may require making visual inspections, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 25lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 25lbs, climbing up to 3ft, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates, with valid state driver’s license and proof of insurance, working in confined spaces, and perceiving color differences.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Internal Job Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Petrolia, PA is seeking a Process Engineer who will conduct process engineering, process design, and process safety engineering duties within a petrochemical facility.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Conducts engineering duties for an assigned Engineering discipline and functions as a technical specialist, formulating and developing advanced engineering concepts.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides discipline specific engineering assistance, direction and development assistance to colleagues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Solves technical problems related to projects and troubleshoots and updates report data for business units<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Upgrades, designs, configures, maintains and monitors related equipment and performance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes related components and systems, processes and methods, and refinery processes and economics<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops project scopes, budgets and timelines for approval and ensures projects meet budget as well as facility and OSHA standards<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures the maintenance and integrity of business units data<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Optimizes business units and analyzes data to aid operations with decisions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Researches and stays abreast of assigned discipline subjects, innovations and leading-edge developments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops systems to document and track the testing and assist in the maintenance of the various systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinate, facilitate and document Management of Change and associated hazard reviews, and participate in and facilitate incident investigations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate in, facilitate and support Process Safety related audits, reviews and action items solutions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design plant equipment and devise processes for manufacturing chemicals and products<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conduct research to develop new and improved product manufacturing processes<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design and plan layout for product processes on a commercial scale<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Determine most effective arrangement of operations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Implement processing methods and controls to meet quality standards in the most cost-efficient manner<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Investigate and resolve work-in-process problems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Recommend and implement improvements and\u002For modification in sequence of operations, equipment utilization and related matters<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of two years of progressive work experience in process engineering. A strong understanding of basic chemical processes and the elements of process safety is required for Process Safety Engineering discipline. Experience using distributive control system(s).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical Engineering or closely related discipline is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Ability to manage a project is essential.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Working knowledge of commonly used engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge analytically.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to communicate effectively with others, strong verbal communication skills, advanced level of reading and writing, ability to perform advanced mathematical calculations.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Advanced ability to work effectively with multiple groups throughout the facility.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Strong spreadsheet and word processing applications knowledge.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Strong interpersonal, time management and organizational skills.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to provide training to multiple groups on a variety of applicable assigned discipline topics. Knowledge of various process hazard analysis and root cause analysis methodologies is required for Process Safety Engineering aspect of position.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May be responsible for the supervision of personnel as well as contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Manufacturing facility and office based with up to 10% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards are not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid State driver's license and proof of insurance required. Job conditions may require making precise hand and finger movements, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, and working in confined spaces as permitted.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Artesia, NM is seeking an Inspector. Depending on the candidate's experience this role will conduct inspection duties and routing to complex assignments for the Inspection Department under direct or limited supervision. <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Works to ensure integrity of piping, equipment, and atmospheric storage tanks<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works to ensure company records comply with Regulatory requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides suggestions and\u002For support to help the plant run more efficiently<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generates inspection memos<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists in maintaining a complete database of equipment information<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains department equipment and instruments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs tests under close supervision with appropriate level of training - depending on location; NDE: formal testing such as UT, PT, MT, VT (as recognized by ASNT); hardness, PMI, and infrared thermography<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participates in special emphasis projects as assigned by the Inspection manager; level of participation may vary<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May perform weld inspections depending on location<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time n their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of 2-10 years of related experience in inspection, welding, maintenance, operations, or engineering is required. The level will be determined based on the candidate's knowledge, skills, and abilities.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Working knowledge of inspection methods and ability to apply this knowledge as it pertains to the company. Certifications to Level II UT, PT, MT, and VT along with other specialty training may be required while in the position depending on location. Computer program familiarity including MS Office suite. Intermediate reading and writing skills, ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations, and with the ability to effectively communicate with others.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<br> Special training in infrared camera operation, image evaluation, along with additional NDE certifications, Level 1 Infrared Thermography depending on location are preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Depending on the candidate's level of experience, this position may be responsible for the supervision of contracted Inspectors and Technicians.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HFC Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HollyFrontier, we are united through our One HFC Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> About HollyFrontier Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HollyFrontier Corporation, headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent petroleum refiner and marketer that produces high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel and other specialty products. HollyFrontier owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, and Utah and markets its refined products principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. In addition, HollyFrontier produces base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and Netherlands, and exports products to more than 80 countries. HollyFrontier also owns a 57% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminal line, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HollyFrontier Corporation subsidiaries. <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair located in Anacortes, WA is seeking a MPTA Controls Supervisor. This position supports Maintenance, Project and Turnaround (MPTA) teams by providing financial controls, estimating, forecasting, planning and scheduling for turnarounds, capital projects and routine\u002Fnon-routine maintenance. Site focal for MPTA management tools, controls, and analysis that enables management to make informed decisions with accurate and timely data. Supervises cost controllers\u002Fengineers\u002Fanalysts embedded in MPTA departments.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Provide leadership for all MPTA control processes, procedures and work activities consisting primarily of estimating, forecasting, planning and scheduling. Establish priorities, develop, implement and maintain controls necessary to manage PSR’s turnarounds, capital projects and routine\u002Fnon-routine maintenance <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Supervise the controls personnel within PSR’s turnarounds, capital projects and routine\u002Fnon-routine maintenance teams, consisting of both HF Sinclair employees and contractors.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure alignment of all controls process with planning and scheduling functions.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and implement standardized work processes that align with the HF Sinclair processes and procedures, actively participating in global controls network.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Focal point for data collection, data preparation, quality screening and timely issuance of various controls reports and metrics, including reporting to site management. Increased frequency and detail reporting as needed (e.g. turnaround event execution).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work directly with MPTA field contractors to integrate labor hours, rates, materials, and equipment in estimates and forecasts. Analyze and report CPI\u002FSPI performance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Lead assurance activities related to MPTA controls.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Prepare estimates for turnaround proratables, transparent and fair allocation of shared overhead costs.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure consistency of MPTA control activities with SAP as well as other company based financial and accounting systems.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support preparation of annual Business Plan for MPTA departments.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Lead Solomon reporting activity for MPTA functions.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Introduce new concepts and innovations to ensure continuous improvement in control activities. Setting and implementing policies for ‘best practice’ in controls.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of 10 years in planning, estimating, scheduling and construction\u002Fmaintenance management in a process plant environment is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required. Advanced training\u002Fcertification in project controls is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Broad understanding of engineering, construction, maintenance, turnarounds and financial processes. Advanced knowledge of accounting, contracting, and CMMS systems and processes. Mastery level spreadsheet software skills. Thorough understanding of earned value principles and techniques. Ability to work in a fast paced work environment and deliver to required deadlines. Ability to work additional hours as required to support MPTA control efforts, particularly during turnaround event execution. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Preferred Skills:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Mastery of Microsoft packages Word, Outlook, Excel, Project, Access, etc. Skilled in Primavera scheduling software. General knowledge of SAP software. Strong understanding of refinery maintenance and construction practices. <\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Employee and contract personnel in MPTA departments, which varies with site workload (5-15 personnel).<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office based with up to 5% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels tanks, rotating equipment, loud noise and vibrations. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p> Salary Range: The salary range includes the minimum, midpoint, and maximum base salary values. A candidate's offer can vary depending on differentiating factors, including but not limited to education, training, or experience.<br> <br> This position has a salary minimum of $119,600.00 and <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in El Dorado, KS is seeking an Environmental Specialist who conducts basic environmental assignments and duties for the Environmental Department under general supervision.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Ensures compliance with environmental regulations and permits for air quality, fuels, wastewater, hazardous waste\u002Fmaterials, solid waste, and drinking water systems\u002Foperations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prepares periodic emission reports, summaries and compliance reports<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews daily emissions data<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees entry of pertinent records and documentation of excess emissions and related operating data<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs technical\u002Fregulatory analysis, field sampling and testing, and report preparation<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prepares permit applications and liaises with regulatory agencies on non-compliance emissions and discharges<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Interacts with and monitors contractors assisting with environmental compliance activities (such as leak detection monitoring and spill cleanup)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists refinery personnel with governmental regulations compliance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees LDAR, BWON, and QQQ programs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manage contractors executing compliance in the field<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Experience in oil refining processes and five year's environmental compliance experience.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in an environmental sciences or related field is required. In lieu of a degree equivalent years of experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Certification or the ability to obtain certification for DOT Hazmat Shipping, OSHA Hazmat, and Method 9 Opacity is required. Ability to understand and interpret environmental regulations. Understanding or capability to understand oil refining processes (process flow diagrams\u002Fmechanical flow sheets, chemical phase separations, and reactions). Ability to perform complex mathematical calculations advanced reading and writing skills, ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with frequent refinery visits, and with up to 30% travel by land or air required. Required to work in petroleum refinery environment, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, and out of doors environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressures vessels, tanks. Required to work in all temperatures including outdoors. Subject to varying road and weather conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, reaching or grasping, wearing personal protective equipment (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Artesia, NM is seeking an Instrument SIS Engineer. This role conducts SIS engineering duties for a Controls Engineering discipline and functions as a technical specialist, formulating and developing advanced engineering concepts, to support the requirements of the plant’s Instrumented safety systems, and PLCS<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Technical resource for the control systems and process automation field specifically related to SIS (Safety Instrumented Systems) Functional Safety (ANSI\u002FISA-84 and IEC 61511)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Set and maintain plant policy on safety instrumented system design standards (aligned with corporate standards) and documentation standards, including burner management systems (BMS) and unit safety systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Review existing and new SIS to ensure compliance with company and industry standards<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responsibility for the development and coordination of instrument and shutdown system reliability improvement efforts (Lifecycle Management), processes and systems, such as: Defect elimination, Event Code Metrics, Predictive\u002FPreventive Maintenance Plans, Criticality Analysis, SIS and associated metrics<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop and maintain criticality ranking for new\u002Fupgraded SIS deployment for the site.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide review assistance of SIS Functional Safety scope of work documents – Description of Operation, Cause and Effect Diagram, and Testing procedures<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Collect and review key performance indicator (KPI) on SIS\u002FBMS performance.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participation and facilitation of Functional Safety Assessment, SIL Assignment Review Meeting Participate in Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), and participate in incident investigations. Provide training on PHA and Incident Investigation facilitation and general training on Management Of Change (MOC), incident investigations, PHA’s and Pre-start up Safety Reviews (PSSR)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Required to write or modify qualification\u002Ftesting documents for SIS systems and oversee testing during outages to verify correct functionality<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides discipline specific engineering assistance, direction and development assistance to colleagues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Solves technical problems related to projects and troubleshoots and updates report data for business unit(s)Upgrades, designs, configures, maintains and monitors related equipment and performance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops project scopes, budgets and AFE’s for approval and ensures projects meet budget as well as refinery and OSHA standards<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures the maintenance and integrity of business unit(s) data. Optimizes business unit(s) and analyzes data to aid operations with decisions.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Researches and stays abreast of assigned discipline subjects, innovations and leading edge developments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops systems to document and track the testing and assist in the maintenance of the various systems.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design plant instrument and devise processes.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conduct research to develop new and improved product manufacturing processes<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Determine most effective arrangement of operations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Implement processing methods and controls to meet quality standards in the most cost efficient manner<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Investigate and resolve work-in-process problems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Recommend and implement improvements and\u002For modification in sequence of operations, equipment utilization, and related matters<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Review proposals of outside vendors regarding the purchase of new or modernization of existing processing equipment<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of 5-10 years of progressive work experience in controls system (PLC, DCS, Industrial Networks) required in this position. A strong understanding of basic refinery processes and the elements of process safety is required in this position. Emphasis on controls engineering \u002F SIS is required in this position. Career level will be determined based on the candidate's knowledge, skills, and abilities.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Refinery or petrochemical industry experience preferred.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Experience in programming PLC’s<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Proficient with the development of all SIS Functional Safety and SIS related deliverables; including Functional Safety Plans, SIF Lists, SIF response time calculations, SIL verification calculations, test plans, Safety Requirements Specifications, I\u002FO Lists, Range\u002FAlarm\u002FTrip\u002FShutdown schedules, system block diagrams, cause\u002Feffect logic matrix, function block (Boolean) diagrams, logic narratives, SIS hardware\u002Fsoftware\u002Fconfiguration specs, etc.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Burner Management Systems Integration<\u002Fli>\n    <li> SIS hardware inspection, FAT, SAT, loop checks, start-up and commissioning<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Honeywell Experion<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Honeywell Saftey manager<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Honeywell TDC<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Allen Bradley Studio 5000 and Logix 500<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Modicon Unity<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Bejier HMI Programming<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or equivalent experience and technical training<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Advanced knowledge of commonly used DCS and Controls system engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge. Ability to coordinate all phases of a project<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<br> Working knowledge of Microsoft products and experience with engineering software is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Familiarity with sequential programming and ladder logic design<\u002Fp>\n   <p> TUV certified<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May be responsible for supervising contractors depending on assignment.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and plant based with up to 10% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair <\u002Fb>is seeking a Maintenance Practices Leader to be based out of multiple locations. Supports all refinery locations in Maintenance Excellence by implementing and enhancing risk-based and lean management practices: including planning, scheduling, execution, reliability-based maintenance activities, and effective work practices and procedures.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Leads the Maintenance network consisting of maintenance managers from the entire fleet. Facilitate regular network meetings which promote information sharing and networking across sites and adoption of best practices.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops a vision for maintenance network and function that supports overall refining vision of safe, clean, reliable and competitive operation. Lead maintenance network to aspire to that vision and share learnings.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops and continuously improve key performance metrics that show the health of each sites maintenance system<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Acts as resource of industry best practices and developments in the maintenance fields.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Leads innovation and technology development that supports improvements towards maintenance excellence.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Identifies and documents the best practices in place today if not already in place, including SAP EAM Maintenance workflow.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Takes learnings from Lean initiatives at various sites and develop the HF Sinclair Lean Maintenance model. Support continuous improvement at sites that have implemented, and drive the implementation for those who have not yet started.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Leads needs analysis for various corporate maintenance practices that do not currently exist. Steward the development and implementation of work practices across the fleet.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Stewards super user network for SAP EAM to innovate and improve the system to support the maintenance vision.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops and continuously improve metrics that show the health of each sites maintenance system<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Stewards the development of tools to make metrics visible and easily obtainable. Regularly communicate metrics and insight into them.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Leads benchmarking of site maintenance performance vs. industry for competiveness and effectiveness; identify opportunities for improvement; support improvement efforts.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Evaluates and recommends training and career development opportunities for maintenance professionals throughout the organization.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their manager, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of 10 years of experience related to refinery routine maintenance and reliability are required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience, is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to lead and direct senior level managers in the improvement of reliability and maintenance. Strong interpersonal and decision making skills and ability to build technical and operational capability. Good spreadsheet, database and word processing applications knowledge; strong written and verbal communication, negotiating, time-management and organizational skills. Ability to communicate effectively with others and influence multiple operations. Advanced reading and writing skills and the ability to perform basic mathematical calculations.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A significant amount of experience in the energy industry and special training in project management is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> No direct supervision of personnel.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office-based with warehouse and refinery environment exposure with travel up to 50% of the time by land or air. Up to 60% of time will be required to work in petroleum refinery environment. Subject to all weather and varying road conditions<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise finger and hand movements, reaching or grasping, climbing up to 250 ft, ability to wear personal protective equipment (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Assistant. communicates department project information or any other requests<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develops administrative policies and procedures as required; may research technical and policy issues and assist in the implementation of recommendations<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Researches, designs, and\u002For edits presentations such as brochures, newsletters, forms, manuals, reports and charts<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Responds to complex inquiries concerning the company or department and screens calls for department management<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Prepares, interprets and distributes information<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Performs duties as department document and record control coordinator including coordinating and maintaining record keeping and filing systems<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Acts as backup for other administrative staff<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p> Other duties may include some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Participates in the development, monitoring and justification of the budget<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Administers collection of company fuel registration and customer certificates<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Verifies and processes expense statements<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Tracks absenteeism, vacation time, overtime, call out opportunity and other related personnel scheduling and may process Payroll timesheets. like<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitors assets as assigned by manager\u002Fsupervisor<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides IT training logistics and administer department on-boarding process<\u002Fli>\n     <li> printing and distributing bi-weekly schedules, and auditing vacation and sick time<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Strong word processing, database, spreadsheet and other applications skills including Access, Payroll and Purchasing Systems depending on assignment. Ability to write programs within Access required at some locations. Knowledge of office management principles and practices and administrative procedures. Advanced organization skills required. Ability to implement new systems and procedures and to evaluate their effectiveness; supervise others; and effectively interpret plans and procedures. Team player, self starter, independent worker, good time management and analytical skills and priority setting ability. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both in written and verbal communication; to work independently and perform basic mathematical calculations. Basic reading and writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Preferred Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Working knowledge of SAP and EMPAC.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office based with up to 5% travel by land required. Subject to varying road and weather conditions<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
