<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair in Anacortes, WA is seeking a Process Engineer. The Process Engineer conducts engineering duties for the Process Engineering department in direct support to operations and long term site strategies. This position identifies problems and solutions utilizing company work processes and with fellow production team members. The Process engineer functions as a technologist providing H&amp;MB, Hydraulics, Catalyst, and other process technology specific insights.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> The successful candidate will join the Puget Sound Refinery Process Engineering Team and will be assigned to either operations support area, or a role focused on advancing Energy, CO2, and Water strategies basis candidate experience and site need.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Provide process engineering support to ensure safe, environmentally sound, reliable and profitable operation of the units to which they are assigned.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Be a proactive participant in the Field Support Team (FST), working closely with Operations, Maintenance, Inspection, and the other Engineering disciplines to ensure thorough and complete communication of process issues to the team.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Play an integral role in unit troubleshooting, taking the lead when necessary to facilitate problem resolution when the problem encountered is technical in nature and requires a Process Engineer's knowledge and expertise.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identify opportunities to improve unit safety, environmental performance, reliability, and profitability and prioritize and develop these opportunities through site work process including project idea submittals.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate as necessary in unit PHAs, Bow Ties, and Corrosion Control Document Reviews and lead discipline specific Management of Change (MOC) reviews.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Keep Tech and Ops Management apprised of problematic unit conditions and issues as they arise.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Utilize Risk-Based Decision-Making skills in prioritizing work and communicating incentives and constraints to Management and to the FST.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work closely and effectively with technology licensors and various discipline subject matter experts.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain a Process Engineering Proactive Monitoring Workbook for each process area of responsibility.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain proactive monitoring variables, trends, tools, and overall unit proactive monitoring plan to facilitate the performance of the Ensure Safe Production (ESP) process.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Spend appropriate time in the field in order to maintain a good awareness of operating issues and concerns.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support training of operations on heat and material balances, control of separation processes, and other unit operations.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Be an active member in company technical networks for best practice sharing and implementation.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate in and\u002For Facilitate root cause investigations.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Expected to support abnormal situations and turnarounds which may require nights and extended durations within fatigue management plans for a 24x7 facility.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Take an active role in their own development plan and work towards continuous improvement both technically and professionally.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Two to nine years of progressive work experience in a process engineering field. An understanding of basic refinery processes, utility systems and the elements of process safety.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n    <p><b>Preferred Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Refinery or petrochemical industry experience with direct support to operations. Some or all of Alky, Sulfur, FCC, CCR, Delayed Coking, hydrotreating, Utilities and Waste Water experience. Experience with Energy, CO2, and Water reduction initiatives is also desireable.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in an Engineering discipline is required (Chemical Engineering Preferred.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Working knowledge of engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge analytically. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Ability to communicate effectively with others, strong verbal communication skills, and ability to simplify large amounts of data into compelling recommendations and visuals. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Ability to work effectively with diverse groups throughout the refinery.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong interpersonal, time-management and organizational skills. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Strong spreadsheet and word processing applications knowledge.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to teach and mentor to diverse groups on a variety of discipline topics. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Knowledge of various process hazard analysis and root cause analysis methodologies.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Preferred Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Working knowledge of and experience with engineering software is preferred. Data historian browsers (e.g. PI Process-Book\u002FVision\u002FDatalink\u002FAsset Framework), and simulation tools (e.g. Aspen Hysys, UNISIM, ChemPro, ProMax). <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Knowledge of utility systems (Water treatment, steam generation, and waste water treatment).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Awareness of Energy and CO2 reporting in a manufacturing facility.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Awareness of process control systems and theory.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Awareness of corrosion mechanisms as they apply to the processes being supported and of the materials, process controls and methods to mitigate those mechanisms.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> No direct supervision expected with this role. Ability to lead and influence others without formal authority is desired.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office and plant based with up to 10% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p> Salary Range: The salary range includes the minimum, midpoint, and maximum base salary values. A candidate's offer can vary depending on differentiating factors, including but not limited to education, training, or experience.<br> <br> This position has a salary minimum of $89,200.00 and maximum of <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Dallas TX, is seeking an ERP Business IT Systems Analyst-Logistics, for its Information Technology Department. The ERP Business IT Systems Analyst will be responsible for supporting the company's routine application systems and reporting environments while working with key users to improve business processes. The ERP Business IT Systems Analyst will focus on logistics functions and supply chain processes in order to improve the company's marine management capabilities as well as other ground transportation.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides support and resolution for various SAP modules including configuration and enhancement requests from the user community and company management<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports integration points between modules<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports various interfaces between SAP and other systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes process and configuration issues as they occur in the SAP Production system<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides support role to subsequent phases of SAP implementation<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Designs interfaces, reports, enhancements (including custom programs), and conversions to meet business requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Designs and perform quality assurance testing, perform unit testing and integration testing<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports the development of end-user security authorizations by the end-user security authorization administration group<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Facilitates meetings, conduct and lead presentations and\u002For training sessions with end-users<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Communicates with colleagues, management, and business team members on requirements, problems, project status, and issues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Delivers system solutions to business problems in a timely manner<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Understands and work within corporate IT governance practices<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Leads a team on special projects or play a lead technical role from time to time<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their manager, as determined from time to time are their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Responsible for supporting one or more of the following modules: FI\u002FCO (Finance &amp; Controlling), SD (Sales &amp; Distribution), MM (Materials Management), TSW (Traders Schedulers Workbench), PM (Plant Maintenance), HR (Human Resources), and EC (Environmental Compliance).<\u002Fp>\n   <p> The following listed duties are essential job duties and responsibilities to the specified concentration:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Materials Management\u002FSales &amp; Distribution Concentration:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides coordination support between all Maintenance, Repairs &amp; Operation (MRO) systems, or all functions of the logistics systems, and functions of IT departments to assure effective use of the systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports various interfaces between SAP and other systems, including plant maintenance and procurement system, and Refinery Yield &amp; Consumption<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Implements configuration changes, new releases and updates to the back office environment, including SAP and associated applications, in an effort to optimize the use of Information Technology within supply chain operations<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Traders Schedulers Workbench Concentration:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides support to operations and logistics functions in the scheduling and actualization of bulk movements in SAP utilizing the Traders and Schedulers Workbench (Modules)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Implements configuration changes, new releases and updates to SAP TSW as required for the effective support of supply chain operations<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Finance and Controlling Concentration:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Supports configuration, enhancement, and troubleshooting for general ledger, tax, A\u002FP, A\u002FR, profitability analysis, fixed assets, and other facets of FI and CO<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Designs, maintains and adheres to IT standards for system development, change management, regulatory and Sarbanes-Oxley compliance<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Human Resources Concentration:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Translates requirements and provides design solutions on the PA info types and OM reporting structures<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Configures Info groups, Actions, PA30 Menu and Pay structures<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Acts as functional and technical support for SAP HR IT applications which may include Time Management, Payroll, Personnel Administration, ESS\u002FMSS, Organization Management, and Recruiting<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five years of ERP job specific experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Preferred Experience:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> SAP IS-OIL and Oil and Gas industry experience is preferred (Midstream\u002FPipeline &amp; Downstream\u002FRefining areas). Experience with Ariba and Fieldglass is also preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor of Science Degree in Business, Computer Science, or a related field or equivalent work experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Highly versatile with strong team skills. Self-starter with the drive and ability to achieve planned objectives. Strong ability to work in a fast paced, multi-tasking environment as a team player. Creative, organized, good time-management and excellent communication skills, reading and writing, and highly responsive to customer needs. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and a high attention to detail and accuracy. Presence and confidence to generate credibility both within and outside the Company. Well-developed interpersonal skills to create a positive interaction with people at all levels within and outside the organization. Ability to communicate effectively with others, both written and verbal communication; intermediate reading and writing skills at an intermediate , and the ability to perform intermediate level mathematical calculations.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May act as team lead on large projects.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with travel up to 25% of time by land or air is required. Work conditions may require working petroleum refinery environment, warehouse and plant environments occasionally. Subject to varying road and weather conditions. Occasional long hours, as well as nights and weekends as needed.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require sitting, talking, hearing, making visual inspections, and making precise hand and finger movements. Job conditions may require standing, walking, and wearing personal protective equipment (beards not permitted)<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><b>Title:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><b>Maintenance Planner I<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Date: January, 13 2023<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Location: El Dorado, KS. 67042<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> BASIC FUNCTION: <\u002Fp>\n <p>Conducts maintenance assignments and duties for the Maintenance Department under minimal supervision. Increases the efficiency of the maintenance process through the creation of safe and cost effective job plans and schedules. May direct or lead the work of others depending on location. All planning responsibilities may pertain to Instrumentation, Electrical and Mechanic work depending on assignment.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Manages maintenance planning, and scheduling process depending on assignment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensures DataStream system integrity, maintains PM’s and system cleanup<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Acts as liaison with other departments for scope and procedure procurement and\u002For purchasing department on all purchases and bid items depending on location<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identifies resources and cost estimates to specific job tasks<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Other duties may include some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Review and assign crafts\u002Fresources to daily work authorization in DataStream D7i<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Identify, procure, and supervise contract services as required and monitor and enforce contractor compliance to all refinery safety and environmental regulations depending on location<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Create bid packages, award bids, and execute jobs from start to finish<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Plan Turnaround work-steps and procedures including material, labor resources and equipment\u002Ftools<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform Supervisory Relief functions as needed as well as on-call duties depending on location<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform as Supervisor and liaison during actual Turnarounds<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage change execution<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Oversee Environmental issues and lead safety discussions and demonstrate leadership behavior that reinforces safety policies and culture depending on location<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Assist engineering as needed<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Coordinate with operations in scheduling equipment for repairs, construction and developing work plans<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Oversee quality of work, safety, and overall performance of assigned staff and track head count and verify timesheets to ensure cost and schedule compliance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assemble weekly and daily work schedules for assigned employees and understand and follow protocol for the maintenance overtime policy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide training, mentoring and coaching for subordinates and peers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Order materials and other special items as required including all procedures, drawings, special tool requirements, and available warehouse stock items on work authorizations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Create sketches, drawings, and bills of material for miscellaneous work and verify drawings and approval sign offs for in-kind equipment replacement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in contract negotiations<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Confirm field verification and dimensional checks on in-kind equipment replacements to verify conformance to specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure all expenditures are maintained to the approved budget limits and invoices are processed with correct charge codes<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ensure management is fully informed of any potential shortfalls\u002Fproblems in daily assignments as needed<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Experience:<\u002Fp>\n <p> A minimum of 3 years of job-related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Construction management experience is a preferred.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or GED equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>PREFERRED EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Trade school or journeyman\u002Fcraftsman training is preferred. A Bachelor’s Degree depending on location is also preferred.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> REQUIRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Knowledge of refinery operations and craft knowledge. Depending on location, extensive knowledge of refinery instrumentation, electrical and rotating equipment. Knowledge of safe work practices related to the specified fields. Intermediate leadership, interpersonal, organization oral, basic reading and writing skills with the ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Computer skills necessary to operate DataStream D7i, Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and Internet Explorer. Ability to lead and train a small group of employees. Multi-tasking and team orientation skills. Self-starter and safety sensitive. Troubleshooting skills and ability to function effectively in a team atmosphere. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> SUPERVISORY\u002FMANAGERIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Depending on location, may provide occasional relief supervisor responsibilities of hourly maintenance employees for various foremen, or direct supervision of five salaried employees and leadership and indirect supervision to other salaried employees of the maintenance department and hourly employees as needed.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>WORK CONDITIONS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Office and field based with up to 5% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver based environment, including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment and working in confined spaces. Subject to varying road and weather conditions. Periodic overtime required. Required to respond to plant related emergencies and be available after hours during critical business situations depending on location.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise finger and hand movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 30lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 200ft, and ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates, perceiving color differences, ability to wear personal protective equipment (beards not permitted), and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Conducts maintenance assignments and duties for the Maintenance Department under limited supervision. Increases the efficiency of the maintenance process through the creation of safe and cost effective job plans, and schedules depending on location.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Reviews, coordinates and assigns crafts\u002Fresources to daily work authorization in the assigned maintenance system, collaborates with additional craft resources and supervisors for scheduling work<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Creates sketches, drawings, and bill of material for miscellaneous work<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Acts as liaison with other departments, regional supervisors, planners and schedulers for scope &amp; procedure procurement<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensures proficient operations of some or all of the following software (depending on location): Primavera P-3, AutoCAD, Excel, Word, Outlook, Microsoft Project, assigned maintenance system, and MicroStation<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identifies resources and cost estimates to specific job tasks<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Orders MTL and\u002For other special materials when required<\u002Fli>\n     <li> procedures<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Confirms field verification and dimensional checks on in-kind equipment replacements to verify conformance to specifications<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p> Other Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. HollyFrontier operates through its subsidiaries a 135,000 barrels per stream day (\"bpsd\") refinery located in El Dorado, Kansas, a 125,000 bpsd refinery in Tulsa, Oklahoma, a 100,000 bpsd refinery located in Artesia, New Mexico, a 52,000 bpsd refinery located in Cheyenne, Wyoming and a 45,000 bpsd refinery in Woods Cross, Utah. HollyFrontier markets its refined products principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. In addition, HollyFrontier, through its subsidiary, owns Petro-Canada Lubricants Inc. whose Mississauga, Ontario facility produces 15,600 barrels per day of base oils and other specialized lubricant products, and also owns a 57% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><i><br> Join HollyFrontier where you have the opportunity to develop and own your career!<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> HollyFrontier Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair in Anacortes, WA is seeking a SIS Instrument Engineer. This position is responsible for instrument engineering and SIS system engineering support to the refinery. Assures and certifies the site’s compliance with SIS design, application, maintenance, testing, and operation requirements in accordance with industry practices and standards and legal requirements.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Interprets industry standards and legal requirements related to instrumentation and SIS systems.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides technical assurance for all work within their scope, assuring delivery of department technical strategy and compliance with company and industry engineering standards and best practices.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Contributes to site and corporate strategy development in Instrumentation and SIS systems.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identifies and pursues tactics to keep site aligned with instrumentation and SIS system strategy and goals. Participates in ongoing project and turnaround planning to assure continuous progress against these goals.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides direct support to maintenance and production departments.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Applies Management of Change work process for all aspects of instrumentation\u002Fcontrol and SIS systems in the refinery, assuring that all such work is sufficiently evaluated and correctly executed.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identifies and helps realize work process improvement opportunities<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Directly supports all work within the Instrument Engineering group, including work outside of their own normal scope, as required to accommodate team resource needs. Participates in shared off-hours response as such need may arise, either directly or at the request of another team member. (Note, off-hours requests are not excessive but do occur periodically and can be urgent).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> As a senior team member, mentors and provides guidance to team members, maintenance and operations personnel, and others<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Fifteen (15) or more years refinery or chemical plant experience in instrument and SIS engineering. <\u002Fp>\n    <p>Extensive experience with DCS systems and PLCs is required; Honeywell DCS preferred.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Extensive experience with management of change as applied to control systems discipline.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> TUV or ISA certification in Safety Instrumented Systems, or equivalent experience and readily able to become certified.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of bachelor of science degree in an engineering discipline. <\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Advanced SIS technical skill, including specification, design, demonstration of availability, obsolescence planning, maintenance practices, etc.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Excellent interpersonal skills, and ability to lead and direct the work of others including: maintenance, operations, engineers, contractors, etc.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Strong, audience-appropriate verbal and written communication skills; comfortable taking a persuasive stance to establish and defend technical strategy. <\u002Fp>\n    <p>Strong problem solving skills required.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Demonstrated history of establishing and achieving personal and site goals, and inspiring of others to do the same.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Extensive knowledge of DCS, PLC, and field instrumentation including, but not limited to; pressure, temperature, flow, level and equipment monitoring and controls; DCS systems; PLC implementation and use including safety PLCs.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Must be able to work effectively with all levels of the organization as well as external parties such as vendors and contractors.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Expected to act as leader of informal teams and ad hoc formal teams; and to guide team members in accordance with HFSinclair values and site strategy during challenging circumstances such as incident investigations or abnormal operational situations.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office and field based with up to 10% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, exposure to the risk of electrical shock, and working in confined spaces. Subject to all temperatures, weather, and varying road conditions. Extensive use of computers with business and engineering applications (Email, spreadsheet, CAD, engineering design programs, etc).<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p> Salary Range: The salary range includes the minimum, midpoint, and maximum base salary values. A candidate's offer can vary depending on differentiating factors, including but not limited to education, training, or experience.<br> <br> This position has a salary minimum of $111,500.00 and maximum of <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is seeking a Server Administrator who will be responsible for providing Information Technology (IT) technical support at the local operational level. This person resolves mid-level to advanced technical issues to the Company's IT equipment and conducts technical assignments and projects for the IT Department under minimal supervision, addresses and support issues related to the local operational IT systems, servers, network, printers and client support, coordinates hardware and software upgrades at the local operational level.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides Tier 2 and Tier 3 IT support and after-hours support<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides advanced desktop, telecom, application, and infrastructure support<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manages small to medium projects on an local operational level<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides support for local operational level application support (troubleshooting, testing and upgrades)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides server administration duties including configuration and maintenance of Windows Server, and VMware<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides preventative maintenance, including server monitoring, applying and testing patches, and checking for space limitations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitoring and maintaining request and incident queues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees server issue resolution, analyzing and providing solutions for Operating System and Database Hardware issues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes and evaluates current interface configuration, user requirements, and optimizes server topologies<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Recommends add-on technologies and customizations to Company software systems to provide efficiencies to business operations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Collaborate with other IT teams to identify and implement process improvement<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Writes clear, concise, and accurate documentation and provides training (i.e., work procedures, how to guides)<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of six years of job-related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems or related field is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Intermediate knowledge of applications systems and ability to apply this knowledge. Intermediate working knowledge of information systems concepts\u002Fdesign\u002Fdevelopment, systems development life cycle, recovery techniques, performance monitoring and tuning; decision-making, analytical, and problem solving skills. Conceptual and data analysis skills, advanced reading skills, the ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations, intermediate reading and writing skills, and excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication. Ability to lead to lead projects as required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Certifications: Microsoft and Cisco certifications (MCDST, MCSA, MCSE, MCP); Network, and software certifications (A+, N+, NET+) are preferred. ITIL Foundation<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with up to 30% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery and driver based environment including but not limited to chemical, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, working in confined spaces, and exposure to risk of electrical shock. Subject to all weather and varying road conditions. Occasionally required to work long hours which may include nights, weekends, holidays for regularly scheduled maintenance and emergency work and support as well as on-call availability.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 15 ft, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, perceiving color differences, ability to wear personal protective equipment and a respirator during emergency situations as needed (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair in Anacortes, WA is seeking a Site Heat Transfer &amp; Energy Specialist. The primary purpose of this role is to provide technical support and leadership to drive the safe, reliable, and efficient performance of the Refinery Fired Equipment. The Specialist will consult with others on matters involving operations, control, and integrity of Fired Equipment. The Specialist is expected to provide Operators with training as needed on furnace operation as well as work with Production, Engineering, Process, Control Systems and Pressure Equipment Integrity (PEI) Staff to ensure safe, reliable operations. The selected individual will also coordinate and obtain the necessary thermal imaging information.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Be the Focal Point for Fired Heater \u002F Boiler combustion issues.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Conduct audits of the process heater operation (both independent and cross functional).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work proactively with Production, Maintenance, Technical, Environmental and Inspection personnel to assure combustion issues are being properly addressed.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Perform Thermography Inspections, as needed, using the site IR camera. Complete data analysis and create informative reports to PEI, Operations, and Process Engineering.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide technical support to operators for Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) monitoring rounds on fired heaters.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identify fouled or plugged burner tips, flame impingement, heater refractory condition, burner tile condition, burner mechanical condition, and flame condition (excess or insufficient O2 and flame distribution). Notify Production of any unusual findings.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain a Proactive Technical Monitoring (PTM) Workbook for each area of responsibility.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain proactive monitoring variables, trends, tools, and the overall proactive monitoring plan for fired heaters \u002F flares to facilitate the performance of the Ensure Safe Production (ESP) process.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Recommend instrumentation\u002Fanalyzer upgrades basis, current Best Practices, and specific heat transfer threats.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide oversight on new projects to assure appropriate combustion equipment is selected.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop Turnaround scope for Boilers \u002F Fired Equipment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop training program and conduct training for Production on efficient and safe fired heater operations. Consult on and teach combustion issues \u002F troubleshooting within the Production organization and Technical community.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Be an active member of the HF Sinclair Fired Equipment Technical Network Team.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist Site Energy Focal Point in performing monthly EII calculation.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Help identify new energy tactics &amp; in some cases be the lead for Tactic(s).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide training to operations as needed on various KPI’s associated with the Energy Management System to help drive sustainability and accountability.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support abnormal \u002F upset situations and turnarounds which may require nights and extended durations within fatigue management plans for a 24x7 facility.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate in and\u002For Facilitate root cause investigations.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Communicate applicable HF Sinclair Heater Incident Investigation Learnings with Site and develop implementation plan to close gaps.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Lead discipline specific Management of Change (MOC) reviews.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate as necessary in Unit PHAs, Bowtie Analysis Reviews, and Corrosion Control Document (CCD) Reviews.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time, are at the supervisor’s sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of three years of engineering work experience or five year minimum of relevant industry experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n    <p><b>Preferred Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Experience operating, troubleshooting, and\u002For optimizing fired equipment is desired.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> High School Diploma or equivalent<i> <\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Working knowledge of fired heater \u002F boiler \u002F combustion concepts and the ability to apply this knowledge analytically.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to communicate effectively with others, strong verbal communication skills, and ability to simplify large amounts of data into compelling recommendations.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to work effectively with diverse groups throughout the refinery.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong interpersonal, time-management and organizational skills.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong spreadsheet and word processing applications knowledge.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to teach and mentor to diverse groups on a variety of discipline topics.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of various process hazard analysis and root cause analysis methodologies.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> No direct supervision expected with this role. Ability to lead and influence others without formal authority is desired.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office and plant based with up to 10% travel required. Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in some situations. Job conditions may require twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping. Work outside of traditional daytime\u002Fweekday schedule will be required during some periods. Off-hours on-call support will be required, and this may require reporting to the facility off hours.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in El Dorado, KS is seeking an Environmental Associate. The Environmental Associate will conduct administrative and clerical assignments for the environmental department under limited supervision.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Acts as document and record control coordinator for the assigned Department, managing and maintaining compliance with facility policy and document integrity including procedures, forms and plans<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Audits departmental records and files to ensure compliance in regulations as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains departmental files, correspondence preparation and coordination, and all other administrative duties for the department on an as needed basis<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates and liaises with outside contractors, engineering and operations as needed to gather data for compliance reporting<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Examines data for precision, accuracy, consistency, comparability, and correctness.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Using the electronic Environmental management information system (EMIS) analyzes Environmental data and prepares statistical analyses, tabular summaries, charts, graphs, and reports to present incident findings.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Tracks Environmental action items and checklists in the EMIS<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assures that all required environmental data is stored and retrieved by approved personnel only.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Processes, indexes, and tracks all incoming and outgoing environmental correspondence in both hard copy and electronic format<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Archives and maintains archived records<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Processes work requests ensuring appropriate cost coding is utilized and orders work materials through SAP<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs everyday office responsibilities (i.e., phones, scanning, faxes, copying, filing, mail, typing, data entry, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Orders and manages office supply inventory, and Nomex uniforms, checking tracking and delivery for assigned department or facility<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Enters and maintains exception time reporting records for the assigned Department<\u002Fli>\n    <li> At times, relocates boxed files and document from one location to another as needed<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of three years EHS-related work experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<br> Experience in EHS-related work in petroleum refining, petrochemical, or oil and gas pipeline industries is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of an Associate Degree in Accounting, Computer Science, or related field is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EDUCATION:<br> A Bachelor's Degree in a related technical field is preffered.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication. Ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Intermediate reading and writing skills. Ability to apply basic clerical and data entry assignments based on pre-established guidelines. Working knowledge of basic office software applications and other local and corporate system interfacing. Good time management, priority setting, planning, organizational, analytical and interpersonal skills. Ability to handle multi-task situations with heavy volume of a variety of duties; adjust to changing priorities and maintain several projects at one time and be aware of timing deadlines. Ability to write clearly and compose a variety of documents. Ability to use sound judgment and decision-making skills. Knowledge of company policies and procedures. Ability to use customer service and interpersonal skills to solve problems. Detail oriented self-starter, team player and independent worker.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Must be experienced with Microsoft Office applications. Ability to use computer programs and effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with up to 3% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors, and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, and rotating equipment, loud noises, vibrations, fumes or airborne particles. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require walking, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, and perceiving color differences. Job conditions may require standing, walking, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 25 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 25 lbs, and climbing up to 6 ft, and wearing personal protective equipment (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair <\u002Fb>is seeking a Senior Auditor to be based at our Dallas corporate office. Conduct routine auditing assignments for the Internal Audit department under a moderate level of supervision..<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Conducts financial and operational risk-based audits and review of internal controls of the Company’s operations; projects cover a wide variety of business risks across financial, operational, technological and strategic areas.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops recommendations for audit findings, focusing on strengthening internal controls, quality and efficiency<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists in annual Sarbanes-Oxley (“SOX”) 404 testing including planning, process documentation, testing execution, issue follow-up, and External Audit assistance. Reviews and interprets organizational data, processes, policies and procedures to assess their effectiveness and compliance with management expectations, regulatory requirements, and leading practices<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Executes audit program steps and documents results in compliance with Internal Audit Department policies and procedures and professional standards<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors testing results of process controls, and provides feedback to management<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May assist with development of audit plans and report drafts<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides informal guidance to junior team members within the department<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of three to seven years of related experience in internal auditing, public accounting, or general accounting are required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in business, accounting, finance, or a related field is required. CPA or CIA designation preferred.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Concentration in accounting or finance preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to perform moderate-to-complex financial analysis. Working knowledge of Microsoft products and experience with ERP and auditing software required. In-depth conceptual and practical knowledge of The International Professional Practices Framework of The Institute of Internal Auditors, generally accepted accounting principles, and finance concepts and procedures. The ability to effectively communicate \u002F explain difficult or sensitive information (both written and verbal); strong reading skills; the ability to perform moderate-to-complex level mathematical calculations; and strong interpersonal skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with travel up to 25% is required by land or air. From time to time, required to work long hours which may include nights, weekends, and holidays. At times, required to work in warehouse\u002Fplant environment and refinery\u002Findustrial environment, includes but is not limited to working near moving mechanical parts and\u002For rotating equipment, loud noise and vibrations, and varying road conditions, At times, required to work out of doors and subject to all weather conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, ability to perceive colors differences, climbing up to 40 feet, working in high precarious places. Job conditions may require the ability to wear PPE in emergency situations (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
