<div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in El Dorado, KS is seeking an Inspector who conducts moderately complex inspection duties and assignments for the Inspection Department under minimal supervision. The Inspector acts as liaison with other departments within the refinery and may direct or lead the work of others from time-to-time.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Ensures and certifies integrity of equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures company records comply with regulatory requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides suggestions and\u002For support to help the plant run more efficiently<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Inspects equipment, which may include atmospheric storage tanks, pressure vessels, piping, boilers, heaters, and relief valves<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generates inspection memos, and may issue equipment deficiency reports and repair recommendations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Interprets inspection results; analyzes for trending; writes and prioritizes work for corrective action based on inspection results<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains a complete and historical database for equipment used, to determine corrosion rates, scope of inspections, and frequency modification<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Approves work of Contracted Inspections and NDE services providers and hydrostatic testing<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Acts as coordinator of contract labor and projects including turnaround support activities which may be specifically for tank work<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides guidance to less experienced Inspectors<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains department equipment and instruments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs testing depending on location and level of training including NDE; formal testing such as UT, PT, MT, VT (as recognized by ASNT); hardness, PMI, and infrared thermography; under minimal supervision<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works on special emphasis projects as assigned, level of participation may vary<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures tank seal inspections and records as required by the EPA<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs weld inspections<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs infrared thermography of heaters and boilers<\u002Fli>\n    <li> RBI - Establishes and updates inspection plans and runs criticalities for piping and equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Utilizes RBI to run reports to plan and prioritize work<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five years of inspection experience in a related industry is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor's Degree, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience, is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to lead and direct the work of other associates. Working knowledge of inspection methods and ability to apply this knowledge as it pertains to the company. A minimum of two of the following certifications: API 510, API 653, or API 570. AWS CWI; or special training in infrared camera operation and image evaluation, or certifications in API-653 Atmospheric Storage Tanks, and (Level 1 Infrared Thermography), Level II NDE certification, along with other specialty training may be required, depending on location. Computer program familiarity with MS Office suite and data management programs in use within Inspection Department. Ability to effectively communicate with others, advanced reading and writing skills, with the ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May lead the work of contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and field based, with up to 5% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, exposure to the risk of electrical shock, and working in confined spaces. Subject to all temperatures, weather, and road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 40lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 40lbs, climbing up to 180ft, perceiving color difference, ability to wear personal protective equipment (beards not permitted), and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HollyFrontier, we are united through our One HFC Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HollyFrontier Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair is seeking an <b>IT Finance Analyst<\u002Fb> to be based in our headquarters in Dallas, TX. This position will be primarily responsible for the IT monthly closing process to accurately reflect operational performance. This role will complete necessary financial and management reporting requirements that communicates results, identifies key issues, and drives continuous improvement across IT spend (i.e. software, hardware, labor, consulting, general services, etc). The IT Finance Analyst will also be instrumental in leading the Annual Operating Plan for the IT organization; adding additional rigor into the strategic plan, developing KPI’s, and providing communication and updates across the IT organization.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Facilitates the IT Financial Management OpEx forecasting, planning, and operations activities with budget owners and senior leadership.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Leads IT financial reporting and reviews with budget owners on actuals vs. forecasted spending to develop actionable narratives and reports with IT leaders.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops trend reports and proactively signals impact with recommendations for adjustments.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops IT Annual Operating Plan through collaboration with IT budget owners and IT leadership (including collaboration and rollup of Project Financials).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conducts regular IT finance reviews with IT Leadership to improve finance related visibility and agility.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Partner with Accounting and FP&amp;A to ensure deadlines are communicated across the IT organization and updates to policy changes are communicated in an efficient manner.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide optimization opportunities from the creation of financial models as well as trend and comparative analysis.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Continuously assess policies, procedures, and controls to identify areas for hardening and opportunities for automation capabilities between systems related to financials (i.e. software assets).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Train budget owners in the monthly and annual process to ensure understanding\u002Fimpact, enhance performance targets, and drive a financially sound mindset.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Preparing business cases to support new investments and acquisitions, strategic and other business decision (such as exploring third party management options for Telecom).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Create guardrails and explore opportunities to streamline areas of financial handoff between teams an\u002For systems (such as PO creation, invoice receipts, and\u002For approvals of shopping carts).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Perform pricing analysis to determine potential cost to organization and seek out opportunities for optimizing spend (IT Assets, Third Party Telecom Management, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports the execution of tracking IT purchase orders to increase IT Finance Management compliance and reporting accuracy.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Writes clear, concise, and accurate documentation\u002Fknowledge articles, and trains users on financial management processes, policies and technologies.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> A minimum of two years of business finance or other related experience<\u002Fli>\n    <li> High proficiency in financial modeling techniques<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b><br> Preferred Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> 3-5+ years of business finance or other relevant experience<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Working knowledge of SAP or ERP systems (SAP BPC preferred)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Advance degree or certifications (MBA, CPA)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Proven work experience in a quantitatively-heavy role<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Experience with Reporting Tools (PowerBi\u002FTableau)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Tech\u002FFinTech background<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree (BS, or B.Com), (Finance, Economics, Accounting, Statistics, or Information Technology) of work experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Advanced understanding of IT Financial Management processes and technologies; strong knowledge of finance planning and budget activities; understanding of information systems concepts\u002Fdesign\u002Fdevelopment, systems development life cycle; working knowledge of financial reporting and analysis; good communication, decision-making, analytical, time-management, problem solving and interpersonal skills. Strong cross-team communication and collaboration skills, both verbal and written. Strong fluency with Excel formulas and functions. Strong analytical and data gathering skills. Highly motivated, quick learner with a positive attitude and strong work ethic. Ability to interface at all levels of the organization, both internally and externally detailed-oriented, with the ability to shift to a big picture mindset to drive impact. Good business acumen.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May provide oversight of managed service provider tasks and performance<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with US, and potentially international, travel up to 10% by land and air. Occasionally required to work long hours which may include nights, weekends, holidays for regularly scheduled maintenance and emergency work and support as well as on-call availability. At times, required to work in warehouse\u002Fplant environment and refinery\u002Findustrial environment, includes but not limited to, work near moving mechanical parts and\u002For rotating equipment, loud noise or vibrations and varying road conditions. May be required to work outdoors and subject to all types of weather conditions including inclement weather. At times may be exposed to risk of electrical shock.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Parco Refining LLC in Sinclair, WY is seeking a PSM Supervisor to lead continuous improvement of Process Safety for the Sinclair Wyoming Refining Company. Focus is on effectiveness and sustainability of Process Safety programs throughout the organization in accordance with Sinclair Oil Corporation’s policies and procedures as well as regulatory requirements and industry standards and practices.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Develop and maintain a staffing plan for the Process Safety and Investigations Department.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop and manage an operating budget for Process Safety and Investigations functions.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assure compliance with regulatory requirements such as Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA 1910.119)- Process Safety Management regulations and EPA Risk Management Plan Rule.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Interface with Sinclair Oil Corporation to align with corporate process safety goals and to offer experience from SWRC<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assure Process Safety Program is current with industry practices.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop reporting systems to track process safety leading and lagging indicators for use within SWRC.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Identify areas that offer the most opportunity for process safety improvement, and develop\u002Fimplement plans with input from all Refinery disciplines<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide metrics and reporting to refinery and corporate management.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop Process Safety Management competencies across the Refinery departments.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Identify key contributor personnel for leadership roles in process safety.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Plan for professional development of Process Safety staff.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Chair and coordinate activities of the site Risk Management Committee.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensure that Process Safety Management policies and procedures are implemented and documented.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Other duties as assigned by supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education\u002FExperience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Bachelor’s Degree and 10 years’ experience working in Process Safety or equivalent, with preference in oil and gas industry. Experience in supervising or leading teams<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Parco Refining LLC in Sinclair, WY is seeking an Account Analyst III to conduct complex yields accounting assignments with general supervision and acts as resource and lead position for less experienced personnel.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Analyzes and maintains accurate daily refinery yields, determining profit and loss for the refinery<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains General Ledger Accounts<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs inventory reconciliations and account reconciliations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs crude oil and natural gas reconciliations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Calculates and approves 3rd party terminalling fees<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manipulates and analyzes financial reports and records at a high level<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors timely completion of routine to complex yields accounting duties<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees day-to-day accounting operations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supervises and completes special projects as required<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides training and guidance to less experienced accounting personnel<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Other duties may include some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> May perform lease crude duties consisting of severance tax reporting, royalty payments and reporting, netout payments, and reconciliation of vendor accounts<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May prepare and assist with EIA reporting as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May supervise taking of water cut and gauging of plant inventory<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May review invoices to marketers<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May measure volumes and track actual vs. budgeted volumes by site<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May track and analyze all branding master file additions, changes, and de-branding<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May assist lower level associates in processing diesel and jet fuel entries and other reports as necessary<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their superior, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of nine years of related job experience are required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma is required. Bachelor’s Degree in business, accounting, finance or related field is preferred. Masters or CPA is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to perform complex accounting analysis. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft products, experience with accounting and maintenance software. A broad understanding of accounting practices and procedures is required. Ability to manage projects and assignments with extreme accuracy and efficiency. May require ability to manage and analyze detailed inventory movements for multiple locations, depending on location. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication, ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations, intermediate reading and writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Acts as resource and lead position for less experienced personnel.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with occasional refinery visits from time to time. Sometime will be required to work in petroleum refinery environment. Subject to all weather, including out-of-doors and varying road conditions. May be required to work flexible hours.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, and the ability to perceive color differences, reaching or grasping, and ability to wear personal protective equipment (beards not permitted). Job conditions may require standing, walking, and lifting and\u002For carrying up to 25lbs.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Sinclair, WY is seeking an Equipment Operator that would operate a wide variety of equipment within the refinery and on public roadways. Equipment is used for maintenance and up-keep on road ways, sewer systems, water systems, and up-keep of landfills.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Safely perform required excavating operations to support maintenance activity and projects.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Perform routine maintenance and inspection on vehicles and equipment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Maintain industrial landfill in accordance with environmental regulations.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Maintain catalyst landfill in accordance with environmental regulations.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Maintain pivots and disposable water system.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Maintain asbestos landfill in accordance with environmental regulations.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Repair and maintain potable water system and fire water system.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Maintain roadways by plowing snow and sanding as necessary.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Maintain storm sewer system and oily water sewer system.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Follow-through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Create and maintain a neat, clean and well-organized and professional-looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Other duties as assigned by supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education\u002FExperience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> High school diploma or general education development certificate (GED). Possession of a valid driver’s license. Must pass or show proof of passing practical test on operation of heavy equipment. Two years of experience as an equipment operator in the oil, gas, or construction industry.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Parco Refining LLC in Sinclair ,WY is seeking an Emergency Response Specialist to coordinate refinery-wide emergency response during site emergencies by acting as the On-Scene Emergency Coordinator utilizing the Emergency Response Plan and Emergency Response Team. Conduct the processes for the inspection, testing and maintenance of fixed, mobile and portable fire equipment to ensure resources are available at all times.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Coordinate all site emergencies with on-shift operations staff and Emergency Response Team.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide emergency medical assistance.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide Safety Specialist Coverage for off-shift and weekends. (e.g. Work Permitting, Job Safety Analysis).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensure emergency response mobile and fixed equipment is operational and available for emergency response.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop and train Emergency Response Team.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate in Management-of-Change process for fire prevention and mitigation\u002FPre-Startup Safety Review.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Communicate fire water impairments to site management.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide training on fire-related subjects during New Employee Safety Training.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to work complex emergency response issues during emergency conditions.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Follow-through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Create and maintain a well-organized and professional-looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Other duties as assigned by supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education\u002FExperience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Requirements are: two (2) years of Petroleum Refining Experience and NIMS ICS 100, 200 and 700 Certifications, Wyoming State EMR Certification, High Angle\u002FConfined Space Rescue Tech, NFPA 1081 Certification will be required within 1 year of hire date.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Preferred applicants will have: Emergency Service Experience, Hazardous Materials Awareness, Operations or Technician Certifications. Firefighter 1, 2 or above Certifications. Emergency Medical Responder or Higher EMT Certification. Degree in Fire Science or Emergency Management. Technical Rope Rescue Certifications or experience. Technical knowledge of Refinery Operations. Skillful in Microsoft Office Programs. Refinery Emergency Response Experience. Knowledge or related experience on Water Delivery Systems, Firetruck and fixed Fire Pump Operations. Effective written and oral communication skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Resources Business Partner. This position requires minimal supervision and a high level of accountability for results, leads complex and high level Human Resources projects and process for a site or large client group, and identifies and resolves conflicts between business and HR demands.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Ensures HF Sinclair’s policies and procedures are followed. Provides interpretation and appropriate communications within the Company and promotes employee understanding of programs, policies, and objectives<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides support of employee and labor relations issues under general oversight of more experienced staff in a union or non-union environment (i.e. dispute resolution, bargaining, grievance administration and Union Committee action items)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Conducts investigation into employee issues, formulates conclusions, and drives to resolution consistent with legal guidance, CBA provisions and\u002For company policy<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reviews and updates Human Resources Policies and Procedures as needed to ensure they remain current<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Leadership of the site Community Relations Program and\u002For Community Advisory Panel and leverages the opportunity improve company image within the community. (depending upon assignment)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Proposes, secures approval and implements HR systems that resolve complex business or human resources challenges<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Independently leads cross functional teams (internal or external to HR) in areas that are not the incumbent's area of expertise<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coaches and mentors managers on the proper ways to navigate employment issues<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Credibly and constructively challenges and lead the business and internal HR processes<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Will be responsible for administrating and coordinating HR policies and procedures as needed by the business<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of eight years of related Human Resources experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Preferred Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Human Resources Business Partner experience in a unionized industrial and\u002For manufacturing environment.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <p> Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business, or a Technical field related discipline is required or related work experience in lieu of the degree (four years of related work experience) is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Understands the business from a technical and commercial perspective. Leverages knowledge of the business (refining, lubricants, etc.) to make effective HR decisions. Achieves results despite setbacks and challenges. Creates systems that ensure a focus on delivering results. Ability to communicate opposing views in a way that wins others over. Can balance “being right” with “maintaining the relationship.” Takes on difficult, ambiguous assignments with a “can do” attitude. Challenges the status quo when appropriate. Driven to research and experiment when facing unfamiliar challenges. Extracts lessons learned from setbacks. Advanced level of knowledge in Human Resources principles and ability to apply this knowledge as it pertains to the company. Advanced with spreadsheet, presentation and word processing applications. Ability to handle confidential information including Protected Health Information (PHI) and all applicable compliance issues in relation to relevant HIPAA regulations. Advanced level of knowledge in Human Resources principles and ability to apply this knowledge as it pertains to the company. Ability to read and appropriately interpret information from multiple sources.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Preferred Skills:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Professional certifications such as SHRM – SCP, SPHR, GPHR, CCP, GRP, CEBS or other similar external certifications.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Leads project teams. Informal or formal leadership of other Human Resources professionals.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office based with occasional refinery visits, and with up to 10% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, and out-of-doors environment (depending upon assignment). Subject to all weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HollyFrontier Corporation in El Dorado, KS is seeking a Process Engineer who will conduct engineering duties and function as a technical specialist, supporting the refinery units, while formulating and developing advanced engineering concepts.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides discipline specific engineering assistance, direction and development assistance to colleagues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Solves technical problems related to projects and troubleshoots and updates report data for business unit(s)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Upgrades, designs, configures, maintains and monitors related equipment and performance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes related components and systems, processes and methods, and refinery processes and economics<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops project scopes, budgets and AFEs for approval and ensures projects meet budget as well as refinery and OSHA standards<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures the maintenance and integrity of business unit(s) data<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Optimizes business unit(s) and analyzes data to aid operations with decisions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Researches and stays abreast of assigned discipline subjects, innovations and leading edge developments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops systems to document and track the testing and assist in the maintenance of the various systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinate, facilitate and document Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), and participate in and facilitate incident investigations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide training on PHA and Incident Investigation facilitation and general training on Management Of Change (MOC), incident investigations, PHAs and Pre-start up Safety Reviews (PSSR)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate in, facilitate and support Process Safety related audits and Layers Of Protection Analysis (LOPA) reviews and assist in Process Safety action items solution development<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Update the Refinery Risk Management Program (RMP) as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design plant equipment and devise processes for manufacturing chemicals and products<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conduct research to develop new and improved product manufacturing processes<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design and plan layout for product processes on a commercial scale<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Determine most effective arrangement of operations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Implement processing methods and controls to meet quality standards in the most cost efficient manner<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Investigate and resolve work-in-process problems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Recommend and implement improvements and\u002For modification in sequence of operations, equipment utilization, and related matters<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Review proposals of outside vendors regarding the purchase of new or modernization of existing processing equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assist with clean fuel projects<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Improve profitability of the refinery<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design and build plant additions and modifications<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Act as a liaison between the company and county and state and\u002For other agencies<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five years of progressive work experience in a specific engineering discipline. A strong understanding of basic refinery processes and the elements.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Professional Engineer registration is preferred. Refinery or petrochemical industry experience preferred. FCC and HF Alky units experience is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in an Engineering discipline is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to manage a project is essential. Working knowledge of commonly used engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge analytically. Ability to stay abreast of new technology developments and processes is essential. Ability to communicate effectively with others, strong verbal communication skills, advanced level of reading and writing, ability to perform advanced mathematical calculations. Advanced ability to work effectively with multiple groups throughout the refinery. Strong spreadsheet and word processing applications knowledge; strong interpersonal, time-management and organizational skills; ability to provide training to multiple groups on a variety of applicable assigned discipline topics. Knowledge of various process hazard analysis and root cause analysis methodologies is required for Process Safety Engineering discipline.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Working knowledge of and experience with engineering software is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May be responsible for the supervision of personnel as well as contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and plant based with up to 10% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards are not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid State driver's license and proof of insurance required. Job conditions may require making precise hand and finger movements, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, and working in confined spaces as permitted.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HollyFrontier Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HollyFrontier Corporation, headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent petroleum refiner and marketer that produces high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel and other specialty products. HollyFrontier owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, and Utah and markets its refined products principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. In addition, HollyFrontier produces base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and Netherlands, and exports products to more than 80 countries. HollyFrontier also owns a 57% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminal line, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HollyFrontier Corporation subsidiaries. <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HollyFrontier Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Sinclair WY is seeking a Rotating Equipment Reliability Engineer who will serve as a subject matter expert for all issues pertaining to rotating machinery in the refinery including pumps, compressors, turbines, fans, blowers, gearboxes and large motors. Provide input on the maintenance, design, and recommendations for all types of rotating equipment, systems and parts. This role requires a detail-oriented, results-driven individual with a commitment to quality, accuracy, and the ability to organize and prioritize workloads to meet deadlines.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Serve as a knowledgeable technology source of all rotating machinery in the refinery including pumps, compressors, turbines, fans, blowers, gearboxes and large motors.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Work closely with Maintenance Department, Operations Department, and Process Engineering personnel to provide technical input on rotating equipment repairs, improvements, and troubleshooting efforts.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provide technical direction for machinery selection including review of engineering specifications, technical bid evaluations, purchase recommendations, and review of supplier data to assure compliance to specifications.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provide rotating machinery expertise to projects, studies, and plant issues.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Participate in investigations involving rotating equipment as complete action items and recommendations that result from incident investigations.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provide input for scopes of work related to process unit turnarounds and shutdowns.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Coordinate with industry technical experts and contract personnel on rotating equipment reliability-related improvement efforts.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Mentor\u002Feducate engineers, plant operations, and maintenance personnel in best practices for machinery reliability.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provide oversight over reliability-related programs such as the lubrication program, compressor analysis, and vibration program.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provide oversight to machinery installation, troubleshooting, repair, and startup activities.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Follow-through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Create and maintain a well-organized and professional-looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Other duties as assigned by supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education\u002FExperience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> ABET accredited bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering. Five years relevant industry experience preferred. Knowledge of industry standards and other applicable codes. Knowledge of SAP, or other computerized maintenance management systems. Good analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent interpersonal, motivational, and coordination skills with the ability to work in both a team environment and on self-directed tasks. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Strong computer skills with MS Office applications.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Sinclair, WY is seeking an Executive Administrative Assistant who would be responsible for performing a variety of administrative tasks and providing personalized and timely support to executive team members.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> The skills required include strong written and verbal communications, respond professionally in a variety of situations, high level administrative and organizational skills and the ability to balance multiple priorities<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Assists in coordinating the agenda for meetings.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists in the planning and execution of office and refinery-wide events and duties.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works closely and effectively with the VP &amp; Refinery Manager to keep them well informed of upcoming commitments and responsibilities.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Effectively maintains and encourages communication between the executive team and external contacts.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prioritizes conflicting needs; handles tasks expeditiously and proactively; and follows through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Strong organizational skills that reflect the ability to perform multiple tasks seamlessly without losing attention to detail.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to maintain confidentiality at all times.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build trusting relationships with coworkers and external contacts.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Highly resourceful team-player with the ability to be effective independently.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Demonstrated problem-solving and decisions making abilities.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Forward thinker who actively seeks opportunities and proposes solutions.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Follow through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Create and maintain well organized and profession looking work areas.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Complete other duties as assigned by supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education\u002FExperience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> AA\u002FAS degree and three years’ experience or six years of experience in an executive or high level assistant role. BA\u002FBS degree a plus. Excellent MS Office knowledge and experience. Familiar with office equipment (computer, copy machines, cell phones, laptops, laminator, etc.)<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
