<div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Provides oversight and management of all laboratory activities, projects and research both internal and external for the organization and\u002For site assigned. Responsible for ensuring all resources are allocated and are aligned with key priorities and overall business initiatives, and to encourage innovation and exploration of next generation product opportunities.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: <\u002Fb>(functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Mentor and develop Chemist team to ensure future resources within the laboratory team<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Lead research and development projects for the lab<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Work with outside labs to ensure compliance with our quality standards and practices<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide technical guidance to the organization on all past, current and future products<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensure that the best methods and instrumentation are researched and investigated for use in the plant processes<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Investigate and analyze statistical data for emerging trends in product lines and feedstock<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Direct supervision of the Product Specialist Manager, Manufacturing Technology Manager and Quality Control Supervisor<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Report regularly on the progress of research and product development programs and keep stakeholders informed on significant issues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintain contacts with major customers, suppliers or industries to identify product needs or influence future product specifications and standards<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manage budgets<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responsible for compliance to established Quality Systems and Quality Improvement as well as departmental safety standards. Document and maintain records.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generate, handle, and\u002For otherwise manage hazardous and non-hazardous waste<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their superior or other local VP’s or managers, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> 8+ years and Exceptional Success in a variety positions in the lab or a related industry or facility<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Leadership and Supervisory training and experience<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><i><br> Preferred Experience:<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n   <p> A minimum of 15 years of Lab supervision, management and technical expertise and\u002For experience in the oil and gas industry is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a bachelor’s Degree in a Chemistry or closely related scientific degree is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><i><br> Preferred Education Level:<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Master’s Degree or MBA is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Demonstrated leadership skills with the ability to manage staff on key priorities and reallocate resources as required. Innovative and technically savvy. Results and customer focused. Strong organizational skills including multi-tasking, decision making, deadline focus, and prioritizing. Excellent demonstrated problem solving skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills and presentation skills. Strong attention to detail. Knowledge of statistics and the ability to utilize this knowledge to explain findings. Solid foundation in analytical chemistry. Experience with or working knowledge of the following analytical instrumentation\u002F methods: Wet chemistry analysis, automatic titrator, HPLC, NMR, FTIR, AA, GC, GC\u002FMS, UV-VIS.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Responsible for the direct supervision of 3 supervisory level employees as well as indirect supervision of chemists and technical associates.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with up to 25% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver-based environment. Including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, fumes and airborne particles. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions. May be required to work extended hours and regularly exposed to outside weather conditions and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50lbs, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid state driver’s license and proof of insurance required, perceiving color differences, and wearing personal protective equipment (beards not permitted). Job conditions may require standing, walking, and twisting, stooping, crouching, and kneeling.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Holly Energy Partners is seeking a Pipeline Technician. The location is open to Kansas City, KS, Carrolton, MO or Montrose, IA. The Pipeline Technician conducts assignments and duties for the Pipeline Department under general supervision. Leads the work of others from time to time as required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Works primarily on pipeline electrical\u002Finstrumentation equipment and ensures equipment is operating properly<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Troubleshoots, tests, maintains, repairs, and installs low voltage (480 volts or less) electrical\u002Finstrumentation equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains pipeline integrity and instrumentation operators use to obtain information<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Installs and calibrates instruments and safety equipment and ensures that all calibration reports are current<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures that all test equipment, gauges and relief valves are certified<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs minor pump repairs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Programs SCADA controls and equipment required to safely operate and maintain pipelines and terminals as necessary<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Balances the terminal (i.e., Barrels in\u002FBarrels out)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs quality control checks on the product<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responds to upsets and abnormal operating instances<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generates various reports for daily distribution<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Verifies compliance with DOT requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures operations and safety procedures are followed at all times<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May be responsible for “dig test” one call system, monitoring one calls, and dispatching to the location as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May be responsible for training less experienced technicians<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five years of job-related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED EDUCATION:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Working knowledge of the pipeline industry or related industry. Working knowledge of instrumentation methods and the ability to apply this knowledge as it pertains to the company. Basic reading and writing skills required with the ability to read and interpret wiring diagrams\u002Fschematics. Ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Familiarity with programmable logic controller (PLC), a general familiarization with DOT safety rules and regulations, and special training in Instrumentation and the SCADA system are all preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and field based with up 10% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse and plant environment, out-of-doors, and driver environments, including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, and exposure to the risk of electrical shock. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 48 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards are not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid State driver’s license and proof of insurance required, and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Sinclair, WY is seeking a Process Safety Engineer will serve as the technical lead for the Process Safety Department and the primary hub of process safety knowledge and mentorship for the refinery. The Process Safety Engineer will be the primary designee to lead the Process Safety and Investigations Group in the manager’s absence, and may be designated as the lead\u002Fmanager for projects and initiatives by engineering, operations, or EHS management as appropriate.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Advise in the development of SIFs according to ISA 61511.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Advise in the development of pressure relief device (PSV, PRV, PSE) sizing, selection, and management according to ASME Section VIII BPVC, API 520, API 521, API 2000.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Review and approve\u002Freject facility siting requests.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Advise in the development of inspection, testing, and preventative maintenance (ITPM) plans for safeguards and IPLs.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Lead hazard reviews during design phases of smaller projects.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate in applicable Pre-Startup Safety Reviews (PSSRs).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide support for PHA and LOPA studies.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Establish performance criteria for outside-led PHAs.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Perform Quality Reviews and approval of PHA reports.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assist in the development, implementation, and training on safety critical equipment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate in development, implementation, and training on other Process Safety activities including MOC, PHA, Facility Siting Studies (FSS), and any enhancements to existing Process Safety programs.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate in investigations of Process Safety Events.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinate with other departments to assure accuracy of Process Safety Information (PSI).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop, review, and improve Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for Process Safety.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop and provide training on technical subject matters as necessary.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Create and maintain a well-organized and professional looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Follow through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Other duties as assigned by supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education\u002FExperience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A Bachelor’s degree in Engineering. Five years of process safety experience in petroleum. Professional Engineer (PE) license desired.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides discipline specific engineering assistance, direction and development assistance to colleagues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Solves technical problems related to projects and troubleshoots and updates report data for business unit(s)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Upgrades, designs, configures, maintains and monitors related equipment and performance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes related components and systems, processes and methods, and refinery processes and economics<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops project scopes, budgets and AFE’s for approval and ensures projects meet budget as well as refinery and OSHA standards<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures the maintenance and integrity of business unit(s) data<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Optimizes business unit(s) and analyzes data to aid operations with decisions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Researches and stays abreast of assigned discipline subjects, innovations and leading edge developments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops systems to document and track the testing and assist in the maintenance of the various systems<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> May be required to do some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Coordinate, facilitate and document Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), and participate in and facilitate incident investigations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide training on PHA and Incident Investigation facilitation and general training on Management Of Change (MOC), incident investigations, PHA’s and Pre-start up Safety Reviews (PSSR)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate in, facilitate and support Process Safety related audits and Layers Of Protection Analysis (LOPA) reviews and assist in Process Safety action items solution development<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Update the Refinery Risk Management Program (RMP) as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design plant equipment and devise processes for manufacturing chemicals and products<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conduct research to develop new and improved product manufacturing processes<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design and plan layout for product processes on a commercial scale<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Determine most effective arrangement of operations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Implement processing methods and controls to meet quality standards in the most cost efficient manner<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Investigate and resolve work-in-process problems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Recommend and implement improvements and\u002For modification in sequence of operations, equipment utilization, and related matters<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Review proposals of outside vendors regarding the purchase of new or modernization of existing processing equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assist with clean fuel projects<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Improve profitability of the refinery<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design and build plant additions and modifications<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Act as a liaison between the company and county and state and\u002For other agencies<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five to eight years of progressive work experience in a specific engineering discipline with a strong understanding of basic refinery processes. Career level will be determined based on the candidate's knowledge, skills, and abilities.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <p> Professional Engineer registration, refinery or petrochemical industry experience, some or all of FCC, CCR, Alky<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in engineering discipline is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> The ability to manage a project is essential. Working knowledge of commonly used engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge analytically. Ability to stay abreast of new technology developments and processes is essential. Ability to communicate effectively with others, strong verbal communication skills, advanced level of reading and writing, ability to perform advanced mathematical calculations. Advanced ability to work effectively with multiple groups throughout the refinery. Strong spreadsheet and word processing applications knowledge; strong interpersonal, time-management and organizational skills; ability to provide training to multiple groups on a variety of applicable assigned discipline topics.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <p> Working knowledge of and experience with engineering software is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May be responsible for the supervision of personnel as well as contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and plant based with up to 10% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Holly Energy Partners located in Tulsa, OK is seeking a Pipeline Technician I&amp;E. The Pipeline Technician I&amp;E conducts assignments and duties for the Pipeline Department under general supervision. Leads the work of others from time to time as required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Works primarily on pipeline electrical\u002Finstrumentation equipment and ensures equipment is operating properly<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Troubleshoots, tests, maintains, repairs, and installs low voltage (480 volts or less) electrical\u002Finstrumentation equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains pipeline integrity and instrumentation operators use to obtain information<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Installs and calibrates instruments and safety equipment and ensures that all calibration reports are current<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures that all test equipment, gauges and relief valves are certified<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs minor pump repairs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Programs SCADA controls and equipment required to safely operate and maintain pipelines and terminals as necessary<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Balances the terminal (i.e., Barrels in\u002FBarrels out)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs quality control checks on the product<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responds to upsets and abnormal operating instances<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generates various reports for daily distribution<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Verifies compliance with DOT requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures operations and safety procedures are followed at all times<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May be responsible for “dig test” one call system, monitoring one calls, and dispatching to the location as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May be responsible for training less experienced technicians<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five years of job-related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED EDUCATION:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Working knowledge of the pipeline industry or related industry. Working knowledge of instrumentation methods and the ability to apply this knowledge as it pertains to the company. Basic reading and writing skills required with the ability to read and interpret wiring diagrams\u002Fschematics. Ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Familiarity with programmable logic controller (PLC), a general familiarization with DOT safety rules and regulations, and special training in Instrumentation and the SCADA system are all preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and field based with up 10% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse and plant environment, out-of-doors, and driver environments, including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, and exposure to the risk of electrical shock. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 48 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards are not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid State driver’s license and proof of insurance required, and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair is seeking a Senior Manager, Fixed Equipment Reliability who will be responsible for overseeing multiple aspects and activities of the corporation’s fixed equipment mechanical integrity programs and policies.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> This position will report to the Director, Asset Reliability.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Manages staff and activities and responsible for fixed equipment asset integrity, regulatory compliance, environmental compliance, employee safety, and change management <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Oversees mechanical integrity program for the organization: implement plans and procedures required to prove and improve the integrity of fixed equipment assets <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provides strategic direction for programs and policies to improve reliability of fixed equipment, including Risk-Based Inspection (RBI), Corrosion Control Documents (CCDs), Integrity Operating Windows (IOWs), Engineering Standards and Inspection Practices, and other special focus programs and initiatives<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors fixed equipment integrity performance metrics and identifies areas of improvement<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides technical support to the organization for specific types of fixed equipment (Fired Heaters, Heat Exchangers, Piping, Pressure Vessels, etc.) <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Evaluates key fixed equipment repair\u002Freplace decisions and capital project opportunities<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participates in investigations for major fixed equipment incidents and ensures effective determination of causes and corrective actions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides guidance, leadership and support for the company to maintain compliance with all federal and state requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their superior, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of 10 years of on-the-job experience with five years of experience in the refining industry is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in a science or engineering related field, is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Proven leadership ability. Good spreadsheet, database and word processing applications knowledge; advanced interpersonal, time-management, organizational, project planning and management skills; demonstrated competency in the execution of multiple projects. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication. Advanced reading and writing skills, with the ability to perform complex mathematical calculations.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Responsible for the supervision of a team of employees.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with up to 30% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, and rotating equipment. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n position.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> This is the entry-level position within the Refinery. Progression to other positions are dependent on seniority and qualifications. It is a requirement of this position to be a member of the Fire Brigade Team.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Must have an intermediate mechanical and chemical skill level, knowledge, and understanding. Experience in the petroleum or petrochemical industry is preferred. Basic mathematical skills are required. Must have a high school diploma or GED and be at least 18 years of age. A valid state driver’s license and the ability to be contacted by telephone are necessary.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Must be able to work safely in a hazardous environment. Able to solve problems quickly and efficiently. Be able to make decisions, take responsibility, and work with minimal supervision. A detailed examination will be administered to interested candidates to assess aptitude and basic knowledge required for the position.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Individual must be able to climb to heights more than 150’ and work in close confined spaces. Must be able to wear respiratory protection equipment and have minimal and manicured facial hair. Beards are prohibited for this position. A comprehensive physical examination must be satisfactorily completed. <b>A DRUG\u002FALCOHOL SCREEN IS PART OF THE PHYSICAL.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Plans, schedules, and coordinates the movement of assigned refined products and\u002For intermediates from the source of supply to the bulk point of sale to ensure continuity of marketing supply under limited supervision.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Crisis management for situations that involve conflicts that arise out of products being off specification, short\u002Flong term refinery\u002Flogistical problems that cause product outages, customer complaints, human error that causes product outages, etc.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Plans, schedules, and coordinates oil movements and\u002For various light oil and\u002For heavy fuel oil products associated with the appropriate refinery by pipeline, rail car, and\u002For truck<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides constant monitoring of assigned lubricant, light oil and\u002For heavy fuel oil product inventories which may include daily monitoring of oil movements, inventory positions and communicating with appropriate departments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Schedules Common Carrier Pipelines, rail and\u002For truck movements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Nominates product movements or tendering loads with appropriate pipeline companies and terminals or truck or railcar carrier and enters nomination in TSW\u002FTMW<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generates Bills of Ladings and Certificate of Analysis for railcar or truck shipments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews and processes freight invoices in invoice management systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains good working relationships with transportation carriers, pipeline customers, exchange partners, suppliers and\u002For third-party terminals or pipeline personnel. Work with blenders, traders, schedulers to maximize product movements and values for HF Sinclair<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> May include some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Works closely with Supply, Sales, and Lubricant or Light Oils management to capture market values<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors and coordinate feedstock inventories and deliveries that are moved on pipelines, trucks, and\u002For railcar<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works with Customs Brokers when exports to foreign countries occur<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Identifies areas that would benefit product movements or product sales of HF Sinclair’s lubricant or light oil products and improves purchased prices for pipelined feed stocks. Take ownership in sale\u002Fpurchase\u002Fmovements of mentioned products to help improve refinery profits<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains close communication with Manager and other key personnel informed of conditions, activities and trends in area of responsibility which may have an impact on the business<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Represents the company at industry functions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works closely with sales or traders to manage product exchanges with other refiners or third-party terminals.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Produces daily inventory position report for third party terminals or refineries<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Enters data into the rail track, tracing and billing system for existing railcars or 3rd party customer railcars and related research as needed and new railcar set up (tracking system that tracks rail cars – rail car numbers, tagging 3rd customer railcars)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes and researches demurrage bills by using rail track, tracing and billing system (for accurate billing)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Updates ethanol sales and receipts into spreadsheet<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides back up support to railcar, truck, and pipeline scheduling<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Helps determine alternate routings for oil movements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Prepares, generates and distributes tariffs information internally and externally<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of three years of job related and industry experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Associate’s degree, in a technical or related field, or two years of related work experience in lieu of a degree, is required. A Bachelor’s degree in business or related field is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Advanced analytical and research skills required to analyze various data. Intermediate knowledge of the Company’s business process including but not limited to tank farm blending, loading, transfer, inspection and shipping procedures, product marketing, refining procedures, invoicing, and cash to order business process. Intermediate to advanced computer skills particularly in MS Excel to provide written reports and spreadsheets as well as the ability to learn new programs such as internet rail programs. Interpersonal, customer service, and communication skills are necessary to create mutual respect with peers and a positive work environment. Knowledge of safety, environmental and transportation regulations and procedures, reading blueprints, capable of writing effective instructions. Ability to maintain positive and productive working relationship within department and with other departments. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication, ability to perform intermdiate mathematical calculations, advanced of reading and writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> SAP TSW, BI, ECC functional\u002Fend user experience preferred. Rail track, tracing and billing system experience preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with occasional refinery visits from time to time and with travel typically 5-10% or by land and air required. Petroleum refinery\u002Findustrial environment, including but not limited to, working near moving mechanical parts and\u002For rotating equipment, petroleum products, chemicals, pressure vessels, and\u002For tanks. Subject to varying road and weather conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise finger and hand movements, reaching or grasping. Job conditions may require standing, walking, and wearing personal protective equipment (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in El Dorado is seeking a Supervisor of Safety and Health. Who supervises safety and health personnel and provides program oversight within assigned areas of responsibility while conducting complex health and safety assignments.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Works to minimize the number of incidents and injuries.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Mitigates hazardous conditions and reduces unsafe actions.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains compliance regulations and SDS sheets if needed, issues hot work and confined space permits and assists management with regulatory issues.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees the maintainenance of health and safety equipment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manages and supervises training programs for employees and contractors.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops and implements assigned facilities health and safety policies and procedures.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides consultations and recommendations for safety and security issues.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports maintaining required OSHA records.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides general Plant Safety support for assigned facility, units, areas, shops and groups as assigned.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures safety training occurs timely and to the standard of the organization as well as assists management with overall training needs.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees and surveys compliance to Policy and Procedures relating to safety.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops and implements policies and procedures for compliance with OSHA regulations.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists field management with loss control efforts including hazard assessment and control, compliance assessments and establishment of behavioral safety systems.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports, mentors, and leads safety professionals and represented safety representatives regarding their assigned areas at the facility resolving safety sensitive issues.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops technical skills and certification in an area of safety (e.g.. respiratory protection, asbestos, lead abatement, radiation safety).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides Safety Hazard input to HAZOP studies, MOCs, PSSRs and supports PSM program as required.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports safety coverage for Turnarounds and other special projects.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Particiaptes in a leadership capacity on the emergency response team.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Acts as Interim Safety Manager as needed and applicable.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports site VPP and employee engagement efforts<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of six years of on the job experience with 10 years of work experience in a refinery is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent years of experience in lieu of a degree, is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Working knowledge of occupational safety and industrial hygiene, and ability to apply this knowledge. Special training\u002FCertifications in Industrial Safety, Hazard Assessment, Air Monitoring, Radiation Safety, HAZWOPER, and similar occupational industrial safety training. Satisfactory completion of a comprehensive medical physical examination. Understanding of Safety Practices basics and application of Safety Policies, and Procedures for field activities. Demonstrated ability to stand firm on doing the job Safe if challenged, but act in a diplomatic manner. Advanced reading and writing skills, advanced interpersonal skills, the ability to effectively communicate with others, and the ability to perform advanced mathmatical calculations are required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Responsible for the supervision of approximately three (3) personnel including safety professionals and represented employees.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and refinery based with travel up to 15% required. Outdoor duties subject to all weather conditions and\u002For oil contaminated conditions, at both below grade and elevated positions, and at times work in high precarious places. Industrial environment, including, but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, and electrical shock.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, working in confined spaces (with a permit if applicable), talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making précise hand and finer movements, reaching or grasping, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, pushing or pulling up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential (inability to maintain standard insurance rates is grounds for dismissal), valid State driver’s license and proof of insurance required, perceiving color differences, ability to wear personal protective equipment (ppe) (beards not permitted), and strenuous physical activity. In some locations, must be available for weekend and after hour call-outs.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
