<div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation in El Dorado, KS is seeking a Project Manager who conducts engineering assignments for the Capital Projects Department, working independently and acting as resource and lead position for less experienced personnel. Manages all aspects of assigned projects including project scope, estimate, schedule, engineering design, equipment and material selection, project bidding, contractor selection, construction oversight, management of change, safety and environmental oversight and all other project tasks to successfully accomplish project goals of refinery capital projects in a safe, profitable, timely and efficient manner. Supports multiple capital projects simultaneously within a managed budget and execution schedule.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Uses common engineering concepts in a particular field to perform projects, and assignments for the engineering department with direct supervision and exercises judgment in the independent evaluation, selection and substantial adaptation and modification of standard techniques, procedures, and criteria.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Estimates the cost and feasibility of a given project, supervises contractors and field activities and provides discipline specific engineering assistance, direction and development assistance to colleagues, depending on assignment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Resolves a variety of complex problems, (i.e. conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials, difficult coordination requirements), and solves technical problems related to projects, troubleshoots and updates report data for business unit(s) depending on assignment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop project scopes, budgets and AFE’s for approval and ensure projects meet budget as well as refinery and OSHA standards<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Review plans and prepare or review technical specifications, contract documents and estimates<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Procure equipment\u002Fmaterial; Review proposals of outside vendors regarding the purchase of new or modernization of existing processing equipment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Track schedule and costs and provide regular reports and forecasts<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assist other project managers with estimates, designs, and construction packages as well as providing quality assurance support during construction.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design and build plant additions and modifications<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Upgrade, design, configure, maintain and monitor related equipment and performance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyze related components and systems, processes and methods, and refinery processes and economics<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Designs chemical or other plant equipment and devise processes for manufacturing chemicals<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Designs, plans layout, and oversees personnel engaged in constructing, controlling, and improving equipment for carrying out chemical processes on a commercial scale<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides mechanical, civil, and structural review for all new, existing, and revamped equipment and facilities to ensure consistency with applicable design standards such as API, ASME, NFPA, ANSI, OSHA, etc.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides start up assistance for existing as well as new equipment within the refinery<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs economic analyses and prepares ROI and AFE reports for capital upgrades<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Investigates and resolve work-in-process problems.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Reviews proposals of outside vendors regarding the purchase of new or modernization of existing processing equipment<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five years of progressive work experience in a project engineering discipline.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Refinery or petrochemical industry experience preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in engineering discipline is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EDUCATION:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to manage a project is essential. Working knowledge of commonly used engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge analytically. Ability to stay abreast of new technology developments and processes is essential. Ability to communicate effectively with others, strong verbal communication skills, advanced level of reading and writing, ability to perform advanced mathematical calculations. Advanced ability to work effectively with multiple groups throughout the refinery. Strong spreadsheet and word processing applications knowledge; strong interpersonal, time-management and organizational skills; ability to provide training to multiple groups on a variety of applicable assigned discipline topics. Knowledge of various process hazard analysis and root cause analysis methodologies is required for Process Safety Engineering discipline.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Working knowledge of and experience with engineering software is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Oversee engineering and design contractors for assigned projects, but no direct employee supervision.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and plant based with up to 5% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards are not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid state driverÃ¢Â€Â™s license and proof of insurance required. Job conditions may require making precise hand and finger movements, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, and working in confined spaces as permitted.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair is seeking a <b>Senior Turnaround Event Manager <\u002Fb>to be based in either Artesa, NM, Woods Cross, UT, Salt Lake City, UT or Dallas, TX. This role is responsible for overseeing and directing all Turnaround activities for high complexity turnaround events. This role will work in collaboration with key stake holders including Operations, Capital Projects, Inspection, Health and Safety, Environmental, Maintenance, and Process Engineering to plan and accomplish all Turnaround Activities. <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Supports the VP, Global Turnarounds in the identification and implementation of best practices across HollyFrontier.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Fully accountable for overall event including shutdown and startup.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manages and coordinates all preparation activities associated with shutdown, startup and decommissioning consistent with turnaround milestone schedule.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Final decision rights for operational issues associated with Turnaround Event Command.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates refinery-wide issues as they relate to shut down and startup activities to support turnaround objectives.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Updates the turnaround plan as necessary during the execution of the turnaround.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Accountable for compliance of the Navi track milestones in the turnaround phase schedule.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Leads the facilitation of a detailed oil-flow plan that integrates with execution schedule. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Owns the Oil to Oil schedule.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Facilitates Capital project integration into turnaround event planning and execution.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Defines Ops leads period of ownership in shutdown and start-up process.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures turnaround readiness, cost and execution status is communicated in real time to management and other key stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees the quality of work, safety, environmental soundness, and overall performance of the entire workforce in the turnaround organization<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops and maintains HollyFrontier turnaround management standards and processes.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides both technical and leadership support for low complexity turnaround events lead by site based event managers.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their manager, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of 15 years of industrial maintenance experience and, depending on assignment, with at least 7 years of turnaround execution supervision are required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelors' degree, OR an equivalent combination of education and work experience, is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to lead and direct a large work force for the execution of a high complexity turnaround. Strong interpersonal and decision making skills and ability to build technical and operational capability. Good spreadsheet, database and word processing applications knowledge. Strong written and verbal communication, negotiating, time-management and organizational skills. Ability to communicate effectively with others and influence multiple operations. Advanced reading and writing skills and the ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Ability to work in a matrixed organizational structure.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b><br> Preferred Skills:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <p> A significant amount of experience in the energy industry and special training in project management.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Responsible for the supervision of approximately 2 to 4 direct reports. During turnarounds, could be responsible for up to 10 direct reports.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with refinery environment exposure and travel up to 75% of the time by land or air. Up to 60% of time will be required to work in petroleum refinery environment. Subject to all weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Artesia, NM is seeking an IT Site Operations Network Admin. This position will be responsible for providing Information Technology (IT) technical support at the local operational level. Resolves mid level to advanced technical issues to the Company's IT equipment and conducts technical assignments and projects for the IT Department under minimal supervision. This position will address and support issues related to the local operational IT systems, servers, network, printers and client support. Coordinate hardware and software upgrades at the local operational level.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides Tier 2 and Tier 3 IT support and after-hours support<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides advanced desktop, telecom, application, and infrastructure support<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manages small to medium projects on an local operational level<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides support for local operational level application support (troubleshooting, testing and upgrades)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides on-site network monitoring and support. Responds to local user support issues as assigned.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports all aspects of the network<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Tests and evaluates routine network systems to eliminate problems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Works with LAN\u002FWAN vendors on problem resolution<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides support for LAN\u002FWAN service issues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Troubleshoots network logs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides server administration duties including configuration and maintenance of Windows Server, and Citrix Server<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides preventative maintenance, including server monitoring, applying and testing patches, and checking for space limitations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Oversees server issue resolution, analyzing and providing solutions for Operating System and Database Hardware issues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes and evaluates current interface configuration, user requirements, and optimizes server topologies<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Recommends add-on technologies and customizations to Company software systems to provide efficiencies to business operations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Writes clear, concise, and accurate documentation and provides training (i.e., work procedures, how to guides)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Protects all Infrastructure systems from unauthorized access (i.e., MPLS, WAN, Wireless, PBX)<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of Six years of job-related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems or related field is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Intermediate knowledge of applications systems and ability to apply this knowledge. Intermediate working knowledge of information systems concepts\u002Fdesign\u002Fdevelopment, systems development life cycle, recovery techniques, performance monitoring and tuning; decision-making, analytical, and problem solving skills. Conceptual and data analysis skills, advanced reading skills, the ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations, intermediate reading and writing skills, and excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication. Ability to lead to lead projects as required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Certifications: Microsoft and Cisco certifications (MCDST, MCSA, MCSE, MCP); Network, and software certifications (A+, N+, NET+) are preferred. ITIL Foundation<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with up to 30% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery and driver based environment including but not limited to chemical, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, working in confined spaces, and exposure to risk of electrical shock. Subject to all weather and varying road conditions. Occasionally required to work long hours which may include nights, weekends, holidays for regularly scheduled maintenance and emergency work and support as well as on-call availability.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 15 ft, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, perceiving color differences, ability to wear personal protective equipment and a respirator during emergency situations as needed (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Holly Energy Partners is seeking a SCADA Programming Technician. The SCADA Programming Technician conducts complex hardware\u002Fsoftware field assignments for the Pipeline SCADA department under minimal supervision. May direct or lead the work of others from time-to-time.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Develops and designs control systems for pipeline control<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Programs PLC’s for the design and implementation of windows based software<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains and programs PLCs and field HMIs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Designs and sets up network structures for field communication<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conducts communication testing for field sites<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops system application specifications utilizing business knowledge and tests developed programs to ensure proper functionality and implementation<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Establishes processes to resolve problems and provides top tier support to system operators and field personnel on the use of field SCADA systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops and maintains system documentation, and documents current field site network configuration and user requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides Communication (SAT) PLC Programming, Wonderware and\u002For ClearSCADA software maintenance, and the upkeep of field server and data<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Relocates technical equipment to and from an assigned location<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Work with all departments and 3rd party companies concerning SCADA<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assist I&amp;E group with troubleshooting field issues<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their manager, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of three to six years or more of on-the-job experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Control operations experience is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of an Associate’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Telecommunications or related field, or the equivalent combination of education and related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED EDUCATION:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Telecommunications or related field is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Advanced knowledge of PLC programming, pipeline and\u002For terminal software, and ability to apply this knowledge to pipeline and\u002For terminal operations and technology. Working knowledge of DOT safety rules and regulations. Good organizational, time-management, ability to effectively communicate with others, both in written and verbal communication, ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Experience with VSAT communication, Telvent OaSys DNA SCADA software, PLC equipment, Juniper network equipment, Wonderware Intouch software, ClearSCADA software, Top Tech software, Telvent Guardian software. Basic reading and writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Experience with PLC 9030\u002Fversamax hardware and Proficy Machine Edition is preferred. Knowledge\u002Fexperience with Top Tech TMS 6 and\u002For Telvent Guardian software is also preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May manage contractors and supplier representatives and direct or lead the work of others from time-to-time.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and field based with up to 50% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, loud noises, vibrations, working in confined spaces, and exposure to the risk of electrical shock. Subject to all temperatures including outdoors, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require talking or hearing, making visual inspections, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid state driver’s license and proof of insurance, perceiving color differences, and wearing personal protective equipment (beards not permitted). Job conditions may require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 20ft, and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Provides technical expertise, direction and training for team members as well as business users.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job <p> A minimum of eight years of direct job related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> SAP IS-OIL and Oil and Gas industry experience is preferred (Midstream\u002FPipeline &amp; Downstream\u002FRefining areas). Self-starter with drive and ability to achieve planned objectives. Advanced ability to work in a fast paced, multi-tasking environment as a team player. Creative, organized, strong time-management and communication skills, both written and verbal, and highly responsive to customer needs. Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills and a high attention to detail and accuracy. Presence and confidence to generate credibility both within and outside the Company. Well-developed interpersonal skills to create a positive interaction with people at all levels within and outside the organization. Ability to communicate effectively with others, both written and verbal communication; intermediate reading and writing skills ; and the ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Responsible for the management of up to two exempt level professional employees in addition to temporary staff assigned during special project efforts.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with travel up to 25% of time by land or air is required. Work conditions may require working petroleum refinery environment, warehouse and plant environments occasionally. Subject to varying road and weather conditions. Occasional long hours, as well as nights and weekends as needed.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require sitting, talking, hearing, making visual inspections, and making precise hand and finger movements. Job conditions may require standing, walking, and wearing personal protective equipment (beards not permitted)<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Dallas, TX is seeking an IT Associate Business Partner- Logistics in which collaborates with the logistics department to ensure that business goals are met through the effective provision of technology solutions and services in collaboration with the IT Commercial Business Partner. The Associate Business Partner, IT - Logistics engages with the key stakeholders in the business organization supporting the development of medium to long term strategic plans and capability roadmaps, ensuring alignment with HF Sinclair objectives. He\u002Fshe acts as a trusted business advisor, providing support to enable the successful delivery of IT services. The Associate Business Partner, IT - Logistics also promotes and supports the management and prioritization of IT services.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Develops and maintains partnerships with business leaders and assists business leaders with articulating their function's needs and requirements. Promotes projects and their value to the IT leaders and community. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Acts as liaison between IT teams and the business for a functional or geographic area (One stop shop or the face of IT to the Business), represents IT value and supports appropriate governance of IT activities. Manages expectations with stakeholders based on IT resource availability.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists in ensuring alignment between business needs and technical capabilities, engaging with Business Analysts and Enterprise Architects. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Collaborates with the IT Infrastructure teams to aid in the successful delivery of the infrastructure roadmap to ensure a healthy network that is considerate of local needs and global direction. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Collaborates and partners with the appropriate departments and resources throughout the value delivery process. Works to identify and support cost efficiencies and deliverable effectiveness. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Collaborates with vendors to meet service level expectations and to comply with business\u002Ffacility related policies. Supports contractual delivery and issue resolution. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Provides support and recommendations for changes to current and future system requirements to meet global business organizational needs. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Assists with consulting on large, cross boundary and\u002For first-of-a-kind projects within the function<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Master's Degree.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> 6 plus years of IT experience or relevant functional Business-Logistics - and process expertise appropriate to the role is required. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Experience with SAP TM or similar TMS platform.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Broad knowledge of relevant business division technologies and trends, and compelling communication to business leadership <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Broad knowledge of the specific business's technologies and capabilities including freight audit and pay processes, rail yard and fleet management, as well as transportation management systems. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Experience with warehouse management is a plus. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Knowledge of functional procurement disciplines and technical IT knowledge (applications, analytics, hardware, software, security, etc.) to identify opportunities to leverage information technology to achieve business objectives and assist in deployment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> IT experience might be waived, if Business experience is strong and person can demonstrate a strong knowledge of IT and refining\u002Fmanufacturing operations. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Experience in strategic decision making and successful influencing on leadership level is required. <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Previous experience with, and exposure to, SAP technology and processes is required. Experience building and communicating future business plans and capabilities along with being able to provide insights into the technologies needed for delivery is required.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Self-motivated, quick and assertive. Extremely detailed oriented and organized. Exceptional time management skills. Excellent writing and communication skills. Knowledge of project metrics, including gathering, reporting, trend analysis, creation, and metrics. Ability to identify issues and problems, generate solutions and choose appropriate alternatives using basic root cause analysis. Manage client expectations, anticipates operational and tactical risks and tracks them. Clarify, identify, and track requirements and issues, remove barriers, resolve minor project issues and escalate to immediate manager where required. Proficient in MS Office applications, MS Project, Adobe Acrobat Professional. Good interpersonal, organizational, analytical thinking, process management, time-management, verbal and written communication skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with travel up to 40% by land and air required. Subject to all weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping. Job conditions may require standing and walking.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Holly Energy Partners located in Woods Cross, UT is seeking a Pipeline Technician I&amp;E. The Pipeline Technician I&amp;E conducts assignments and duties for the Pipeline Department under general supervision. Leads the work of others from time to time as required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Works primarily on pipeline electrical\u002Finstrumentation equipment and ensures equipment is operating properly<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Troubleshoots, tests, maintains, repairs, and installs low voltage (480 volts or less) electrical\u002Finstrumentation equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains pipeline integrity and instrumentation operators use to obtain information<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Installs and calibrates instruments and safety equipment and ensures that all calibration reports are current<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures that all test equipment, gauges and relief valves are certified<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs minor pump repairs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Programs SCADA controls and equipment required to safely operate and maintain pipelines and terminals as necessary<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Balances the terminal (i.e., Barrels in\u002FBarrels out)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs quality control checks on the product<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Responds to upsets and abnormal operating instances<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generates various reports for daily distribution<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Verifies compliance with DOT requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures operations and safety procedures are followed at all times<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May be responsible for “dig test” one call system, monitoring one calls, and dispatching to the location as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> May be responsible for training less experienced technicians<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five years of job-related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED EDUCATION:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Working knowledge of the pipeline industry or related industry. Working knowledge of instrumentation methods and the ability to apply this knowledge as it pertains to the company. Basic reading and writing skills required with the ability to read and interpret wiring diagrams\u002Fschematics. Ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Familiarity with programmable logic controller (PLC), a general familiarization with DOT safety rules and regulations, and special training in Instrumentation and the SCADA system are all preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and field based with up 10% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse and plant environment, out-of-doors, and driver environments, including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, and exposure to the risk of electrical shock. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 48 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards are not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid State driver’s license and proof of insurance required, and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <p>BASIC FUNCTION: <\u002Fp>\n <p>Conducts engineering assignments for the Process &amp; Controls Engineering Group and functions as a technical specialist, formulating and developing moderately complex engineering concepts.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA) <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Uses common engineering concepts in a particular field to perform projects, and assignments for the engineering department with direct supervision and exercises judgment in the independent evaluation, selection and substantial adaptation and modification of standard techniques, procedures, and criteria<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Estimates the cost and feasibility of a given project, supervises contractors and field activities and provides discipline specific engineering assistance, direction and development assistance to colleagues depending on assignment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Resolves a variety of complex problems, (i.e. conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials, difficult coordination requirements), and solves technical problems related to projects, troubleshoots and updates report data for business unit(s) depending on assignment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Apply engineering principles to create control schemes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Design, implement, and maintain DCS systems (includes switches, routers, stations, controllers, I\u002FO, and servers), including planning and implementing equipment upgrades to deal with obsolete equipment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop and implement DCS control strategies for refinery processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide operations support for the refinery process control environment. This includes trouble shooting and maintenance of base level and advanced process control strategies, monitoring of key process indicators of control system health, maintenance of the alarm management system, graphics modifications and database support for the plant operating data historian<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Execute PCS configuration and graphics changes<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> May be required to do some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Perform critical backup duties of a Senior DCS &amp; PCN Engineering Specialist and Senior Control System Engineering Specialist<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mentor and Coach I&amp;E DCS Technicians<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Apply engineering principles to create control schemes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop and implement DCS control strategies for refinery processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Execute PCS configuration and graphics changes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Investigate and resolve work-in-process problems <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Review plans and prepare or review technical specifications, contract documents and estimates<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Upgrade, design, configure, maintain and monitor related equipment and performance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Optimize business unit(s) and analyze data to aid operations with decisions, ensuring maintenance and integrity of business unit(s) data<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review outside vendors proposals regarding purchase of new, or modernization of existing, processing equipment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Improve profitability of the refinery<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain Process PCN System’s Software and License List<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain and upgrade existing process control systems and provide technical support of installed process control systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop and implement advanced process control strategies using multivariable controller technology. Communicates lost profit opportunity due to APC applications not being utilized<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide operations support for the refinery process control environment. This includes trouble shooting and maintenance of base level and advanced process control strategies, monitoring of key process indicators of control system health, maintenance of the alarm management system, and graphics modifications.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Experience:<\u002Fp>\n <p> A minimum of 10 years of progressive work experience in Process and\u002For DCS\u002FControls Engineering<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Instrumentation &amp; Electrical Technician expertise (including PLC)<\u002Fp>\n <p> Refinery or Petrochemical industry experience <\u002Fp>\n <p>Supporting and configuring Foxboro and Honeywell Experion systems <\u002Fp>\n <p>Maintaining Process Control Network (PCN) component systems including Process Control System (PCS) <\u002Fp>\n <p>Familiarity with ISA Safety Instrumented System requirements<\u002Fp>\n <p> Designing\u002FImplementing\u002FTroubleshooting process controls (including tuning expertise and Advanced Process Controls)<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or equivalent experience and technical training<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> REQUIRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Advanced knowledge of commonly used DCS and Controls system engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge. Ability to coordinate all phases of a project<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>PREFERRED SKILLS:<br> Working knowledge of Microsoft products and experience with engineering software is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Familiarity with sequential programming and ladder logic design<\u002Fp>\n <p> TUV certified<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> SUPERVISORY\u002FMANAGERIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fp>\n <p> May be responsible for supervising contractors depending on assignment.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>WORK CONDITIONS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Office and plant based with up to 10% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, perceive color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards are not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential (inability to maintain standard insurance rates is grounds for dismissal), valid State driver’s license and proof of insurance required. Depending on location must satisfactorily complete a comprehensive medical physical examination. Job conditions may require twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, and working in confined spaces as permitted.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>ENVIRONMENTAL, HEALTH, &amp; SAFETY RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Our primary values at HF Sinclair are: We put health and safety first; We care about the environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p> All HF Sinclair employees are expected to work safely every day and be safety &amp; environmental leaders. This includes active participation in the following:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Stops and\u002For reports any unsafe work or conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follows safety &amp; environmental policies and procedures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports safety &amp; environmental goals and initiatives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in safety &amp; environmental meetings, training, emergency drills and hazard recognition programs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reports all accidents, injuries and near misses, and participates in associated investigations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in industrial hygiene, medical surveillance and behavior-based safety programs<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Conducts engineering assignments for the Process &amp; Controls Engineering Group and functions as a technical specialist, formulating and developing moderately complex engineering concepts.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Uses common engineering concepts in a particular field to perform projects, and assignments for the engineering department with direct supervision and exercises judgment in the independent evaluation, selection and substantial adaptation and modification of standard techniques, procedures, and criteria<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Estimates the cost and feasibility of a given project, supervises contractors and field activities and provides discipline specific engineering assistance, direction and development assistance to colleagues depending on assignment<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Resolves a variety of complex problems, (i.e. conflicting design requirements, unsuitability of conventional materials, difficult coordination requirements), and solves technical problems related to projects, troubleshoots and updates report data for business unit(s) depending on assignment<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Apply engineering principles to create control schemes.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Design, implement, and maintain DCS systems (includes switches, routers, stations, controllers, I\u002FO, and servers), including planning and implementing equipment upgrades to deal with obsolete equipment<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and implement DCS control strategies for refinery processes<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide operations support for the refinery process control environment. This includes trouble shooting and maintenance of base level and advanced process control strategies, monitoring of key process indicators of control system health, maintenance of the alarm management system, graphics modifications and database support for the plant operating data historian<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Execute PCS configuration and graphics changes<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> May be required to do some or all of the following:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Perform critical backup duties of a Senior DCS &amp; PCN Engineering Specialist and Senior Control System Engineering Specialist<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Mentor and Coach I&amp;E DCS Technicians<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Apply engineering principles to create control schemes<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and implement DCS control strategies for refinery processes<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Execute PCS configuration and graphics changes<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Investigate and resolve work-in-process problems<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Review plans and prepare or review technical specifications, contract documents and estimates<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Upgrade, design, configure, maintain and monitor related equipment and performance<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Optimize business unit(s) and analyze data to aid operations with decisions, ensuring maintenance and integrity of business unit(s) data<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Review outside vendors proposals regarding purchase of new, or modernization of existing, processing equipment<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Improve profitability of the refinery<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain Process PCN System’s Software and License List<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain and upgrade existing process control systems and provide technical support of installed process control systems<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and implement advanced process control strategies using multivariable controller technology. Communicates lost profit opportunity due to APC applications not being utilized<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide operations support for the refinery process control environment. This includes trouble shooting and maintenance of base level and advanced process control strategies, monitoring of key process indicators of control system health, maintenance of the alarm management system, and graphics modifications.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> A minimum of 10 years of progressive work experience in Process and\u002For DCS\u002FControls Engineering<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Instrumentation &amp; Electrical Technician expertise (including PLC)<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Refinery or Petrochemical industry experience<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Supporting and configuring Foxboro and Honeywell Experion systems<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Maintaining Process Control Network (PCN) component systems including Process Control System (PCS)<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Familiarity with ISA Safety Instrumented System requirements<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Designing\u002FImplementing\u002FTroubleshooting process controls (including tuning expertise and Advanced Process Controls)<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or equivalent experience and technical training<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Advanced knowledge of commonly used DCS and Controls system engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge. Ability to coordinate all phases of a project<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<br> Working knowledge of Microsoft products and experience with engineering software is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Familiarity with sequential programming and ladder logic design<\u002Fp>\n    <p> TUV certified<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> May be responsible for supervising contractors depending on assignment.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Office and plant based with up to 10% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, perceive color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards are not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential (inability to maintain standard insurance rates is grounds for dismissal), valid State driver’s license and proof of insurance required. Depending on location must satisfactorily complete a comprehensive medical physical examination. Job conditions may require twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, and working in confined spaces as permitted.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
