<div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides discipline specific engineering assistance, direction and development assistance to colleagues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Solves technical problems related to projects and troubleshoots and updates report data for business unit(s)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Upgrades, designs, configures, maintains and monitors related equipment and performance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes related components and systems, processes and methods, and refinery processes and economics<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops project scopes, budgets and AFE’s for approval and ensures projects meet budget as well as refinery and OSHA standards<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures the maintenance and integrity of business unit(s) data<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Optimizes business unit(s) and analyzes data to aid operations with decisions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Researches and stays abreast of assigned discipline subjects, innovations and leading edge developments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops systems to document and track the testing and assist in the maintenance of the various systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinate, facilitate and document Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), and participate in and facilitate incident investigations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Participate and contribute to Management of Change (MOC) processes, incident investigations, PSM audits, SIL analysis, PHA’s and Pre-start up Safety Reviews (PSSR) for rotating equipment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Design and size rotating plant equipment and develop appropriate maintenance practices for the plant rotating equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Perform quality assurance witnessing in vendor shops for rotating equipment repairs, rerates and modifications.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop, lead and implement reliability improvement initiatives to improve equipment uptime.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintain metrics to accurately measure equipment reliability Mean Time Between Failure (MTBF).<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop engineering solutions for chronic and sporadic equipment reliability problems and work with technical, production and maintenance to implement solutions. This would include helping build and upgrade maintenance procedures and auditing to ensure improvements are sustained.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide engineering support to other area personnel in areas of vibration analysis, lubrication and oil analysis, mechanical performance, and maintenance practices.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide leadership to organization on the latest Reliability and Maintenance technology and Best Practices.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Continuously seek new technology and improvement practices.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provide stewardship to process safety critical equipment program.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Lead predictive and preventative maintenance on critical equipment.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of five years of progressive work experience in a specific engineering discipline.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in engineering discipline is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to manage a project is essential. Working knowledge of commonly used engineering concepts and ability to apply this knowledge analytically. Ability to stay abreast of new technology developments and processes is essential. Ability to communicate effectively with others, strong verbal communication skills, advanced level of reading and writing, ability to perform advanced mathematical calculations. Advanced ability to work effectively with multiple groups throughout the refinery. Strong spreadsheet and word processing applications knowledge; strong interpersonal, time-management and organizational skills; ability to provide training to multiple groups on a variety of applicable assigned discipline topics.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Working knowledge of and experience with engineering software is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May be responsible for the supervision of personnel as well as contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and plant based with up to 10% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, and out-of-doors environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, wet and\u002For oil contaminated conditions, at both below grade and elevated positions, and working in confined spaces. Subject to all temperatures, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft, perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid state driver's license and proof of insurance required. Job conditions may require twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Holly Energy Partners is seeking a SCADA Programming Technician. The SCADA Programming Technician conducts complex hardware\u002Fsoftware field assignments for the Pipeline SCADA department under minimal supervision. May direct or lead the work of others from time-to-time.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Develops and designs control systems for pipeline control<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Programs PLC’s for the design and implementation of windows based software<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains and programs PLCs and field HMIs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Designs and sets up network structures for field communication<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conducts communication testing for field sites<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops system application specifications utilizing business knowledge and tests developed programs to ensure proper functionality and implementation<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Establishes processes to resolve problems and provides top tier support to system operators and field personnel on the use of field SCADA systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops and maintains system documentation, and documents current field site network configuration and user requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides Communication (SAT) PLC Programming, Wonderware and\u002For ClearSCADA software maintenance, and the upkeep of field server and data<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Relocates technical equipment to and from an assigned location<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Work with all departments and 3rd party companies concerning SCADA<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assist I&amp;E group with troubleshooting field issues<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their manager, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of three to six years or more of on-the-job experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Control operations experience is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of an Associate’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Telecommunications or related field, or the equivalent combination of education and related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED EDUCATION:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Telecommunications or related field is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Advanced knowledge of PLC programming, pipeline and\u002For terminal software, and ability to apply this knowledge to pipeline and\u002For terminal operations and technology. Working knowledge of DOT safety rules and regulations. Good organizational, time-management, ability to effectively communicate with others, both in written and verbal communication, ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Experience with VSAT communication, Telvent OaSys DNA SCADA software, PLC equipment, Juniper network equipment, Wonderware Intouch software, ClearSCADA software, Top Tech software, Telvent Guardian software. Basic reading and writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Experience with PLC 9030\u002Fversamax hardware and Proficy Machine Edition is preferred. Knowledge\u002Fexperience with Top Tech TMS 6 and\u002For Telvent Guardian software is also preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May manage contractors and supplier representatives and direct or lead the work of others from time-to-time.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and field based with up to 50% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, loud noises, vibrations, working in confined spaces, and exposure to the risk of electrical shock. Subject to all temperatures including outdoors, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require talking or hearing, making visual inspections, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid state driver’s license and proof of insurance, perceiving color differences, and wearing personal protective equipment (beards not permitted). Job conditions may require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 20ft, and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Artesia, NM is seeking an Instrumentation Engineer. This position conducts complex engineering duties for instrumentation systems, functions as a technical specialist, formulating and utilizing advanced engineering concepts.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Designs instrumentation and control systems and associated wiring, panels, etc. for refineries<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Independently develops detailed wiring diagrams, instrument\u002Flighting\u002Fgrounding plan drawings, electrical schematics, cable tray\u002Fconduit sizing, cable selection, PLC panel sizing<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides instrumentation design support for small projects<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Applies company and industry standards to generate instrument construction packages<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides discipline specific engineering assistance, direction and development assistance to colleagues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Upgrades, designs, configures, maintains and monitors instrument related equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyzes instrument related components and systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Researches and stays abreast of instrumentation subjects, innovations and leading edge developments<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensures compliance with all safety standards and practices<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors plant instrument performance and reports KPIs on a regular frequency<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assists maintenance and operations to trouble shoot instrument issues as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Performs in depth analysis on bad actor instruments and recommends corrective actions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Serves as an internal consultant in area of expertise<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Seeks and develops new methods for accomplishing goals<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Applies new processes\u002Ftechnologies to work<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Seeks and shares best practices<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates own activities with those of others to meet objectives\u002Fgoals<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Influences others, both internal and external, to achieve objectives<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates resources among departments to produce results<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Recommends solutions to complex issues<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Plans own work to appropriately utilize resources to complete work<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops plans for moderately sized projects or portions of large projects<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors implementation of work\u002Faction plans to ensure successful completion of projects<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Independently performs major accountabilities, using experience to guide actions<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Takes responsibility for technical leadership of projects<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Proposing policies and programs<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of eight years of industrial experience in an instrument related discipline for the Oil &amp; Gas industry or related industry is required. Experience in design of instrumentation loops, PLC controls and DCS controls, sizing and selection of instrumentation equipment for industrial classified areas is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Refinery experience and Professional Engineer registration.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in an Electrical Engineering or similar engineering or science discipline is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Ability to read and fully understand P&amp;ID’s, one-lines, instrument drawings and other documents which describe the scope of work to be done. Ability to manage projects is essential including experience with project development, scoping, change management, cost control and forecasting. Experience with I\u002FO detailed wiring and termination. Familiarity with AutoCAD and MS Office suite. Expertise in I&amp;C design and engineering practices for refining industry. Experience with instrumentation, hazardous location wiring practices, panel design and PLC hardware. Ability to stay abreast of new technology developments and processes is essential. Ability to communicate effectively with others, strong verbal communication skills, advanced level of reading and writing, ability to perform advanced mathematical calculations. Advanced ability to work effectively with multiple groups throughout the refinery. Strong spreadsheet and word processing applications knowledge; strong interpersonal, time-management and organizational skills; ability to provide training to multiple groups on a variety of applicable assigned discipline topics.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Working knowledge of and experience with engineering software.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May be responsible for the supervision of personnel as well as contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and plant based with up to 10% travel required. Subject to varying weather conditions and required to work in all temperatures, including outdoors.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, lifting or carrying up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 200 ft., perceiving color differences, required to wear personal protective equipment as needed and a respirator in emergency situations (beards are not permitted), ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid State driver’s license and proof of insurance required. Job conditions may require making precise hand and finger movements, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, and working in confined spaces as permitted.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Holly Energy Partners located in Artesia, NM is seeking a SCADA Programming Technician. The SCADA Programming Technician conducts mid to high level hardware\u002Fsoftware field assignments for the Pipeline\u002FTerminal SCADA department under minimal supervision. May direct or lead the work of others from time-to-time.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Develops and designs control systems for pipeline\u002Fterminal control<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Programs PLC’s for the design and implementation of windows based software<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Maintains and programs PLCs and field HMIs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Designs and sets up network structures for field communication<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Conducts communication testing for field sites<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops system application specifications utilizing business knowledge and tests developed programs to ensure proper functionality and implementation<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Establishes processes to resolve problems and provides top tier support to system operators and field personnel on the use of field SCADA systems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develops and maintains system documentation, and documents current field site network configuration and user requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides Communication (SAT) PLC Programming, Wonderware and\u002For ClearSCADA software maintenance, and the upkeep of field server and data<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Relocates technical equipment to and from an assigned location<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Work with all departments and 3rd party companies concerning SCADA<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Assist I&amp;E group with troubleshooting field issues<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their superior, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of three years of on-the-job experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Control operations experience is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of an Associate’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Telecommunications or related field, or the equivalent combination of education and related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED EDUCATION:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Telecommunications or related field is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Mid-level knowledge of PLC programming, pipeline and\u002For terminal software, and ability to apply this knowledge to pipeline and\u002For terminal operations and technology. Working knowledge of DOT safety rules and regulations. Good organizational, time-management, ability to effectively communicate with others, both in written and verbal communication, ability to perform basic mathematical calculations. Experience with VSAT communication, Telvent OaSys DNA SCADA software, PLC equipment, Juniper network equipment, Wonderware Intouch software, ClearSCADA software, Top Tech software, Telvent Guardian software. Basic reading and writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Experience with PLC 9030\u002Fversamax hardware and Proficy Machine Edition is preferred. Knowledge\u002Fexperience with Top Tech TMS 6 and\u002For Telvent Guardian software is also preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> May manage contractors and supplier representatives and direct or lead the work of others from time-to-time.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office and field based with up to 50% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, out-of-doors environment, and driver based environment including but not limited to chemicals, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, loud noises, vibrations, working in confined spaces, and exposure to the risk of electrical shock. Subject to all temperatures including outdoors, weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require talking or hearing, making visual inspections, ability to operate and drive all assigned company vehicles at company standard insurance rates is essential, valid state driver’s license and proof of insurance, perceiving color differences, and wearing personal protective equipment (beards not permitted). Job conditions may require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50lbs, climbing up to 20ft, and strenuous physical activity.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair in Sinclair, WY is seeking a project manager who will serve as a leader for the project management team, have the ability to mentor junior project managers, act as the single point of contact on projects and complete projects in a timely fashion and within established budgets.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Accountable for a portfolio of capital projects, each with a total installed cost of $5MM and under.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Works with clients to properly and fully define the project scope. Develops the project charter, Design Basis Memorandum and Project Execution Plan as applicable.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Meets financial objectives by forecasting requirements; preparing project budgets to AACE standards; scheduling expenditures; analyzing variances and initiating corrective actions.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Develops the project schedule in order to meet project needs while considering resource loading and other external factors.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Reports project status, needs and risks to the client on a regular basis.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Manages the multi-disciplinary project team.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Conducts timely design, operability and constructability reviews to identify and address execution issues, project risks and strategies.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Hosts stage gate review meetings with stakeholders after each stage in order to secure approval and funding for the next project stage.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ensures that projects meet all applicable standards, specifications and good engineering practices.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ensures effective change management and project controls consistent with the project priorities and objectives.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Follow-through on commitments made to others.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Create and maintain well-organized and professional-looking work area.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Other duties as assigned by your supervisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education and Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Bachelor degree in Engineering with Chemical, Mechanical or Civil Engineering preferred. PMP registration is strongly preferred. Eligibility for immediate registration is a must. Ten (10) years minimum progressive experience in the industrial construction environment. Preference will be given to those with oil and gas development, petrochemical or refining experience. Strong background in engineering project management and implementation of capital projects with a proven track record of delivering projects within schedule and budget constraints. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to effectively interact with all levels of the organization, from hourly employees to senior executives of the company. Proficiency with stage\u002Fphase gate engineering practices. Familiarity with CII’s FEL process is desirable.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Woods Cross Refining LLC, located in Woods Cross, UT is seeking an IT Site Operations III. This position will be responsible for providing Information Technology (IT) technical support at the local operational level. Resolves advanced to complex technical issues to the Company's IT equipment and conducts technical assignments and projects for the IT Department. This position will address and support issues related to the local operational IT systems, servers, network, printers and client support. Implements hardware and software upgrades at the local operational level.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Job Duties<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES: (functions considered essential as defined by ADA)<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provides Tier 3 IT support and after-hours support<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides complex desktop, telecom, application, and infrastructure support<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manages medium to large projects on an local operational level<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides support for local operational application support (troubleshooting, testing and upgrades)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides on-site network monitoring and support.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Supports all aspects of the network<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Analyses and resolves technical problems for established networks<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Serves as technical specialist in network problems and emergencies<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides troubleshooting and resolving network production problems<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Installs, configures, maintains and documents network components<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Documents network problems and resolutions for future reference<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Executes established methodology for gathering security requirements for active directory account provisioning<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Resolves complex issues regarding operations, installations, on-line transactions, system status and downtime<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides preventative maintenance, including server monitoring, applying and testing patches, and checking for space limitations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Provides server administration duties including configuration and maintenance<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Resolves issues and updates patches and maintains local server infrastructure<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Monitors and troubleshoots virtualized Windows \u002F Linux virtualized server infrastructure. Gathers business and security requirements for server provisioning, adhering to architectural and security standards. Provides hardware support and monitoring for datacenter environments.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Recommends add-on technologies and customizations to Company software systems to provide efficiencies to business operations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Documents activities such as down time, problems, and system configurations<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Writes clear, concise, and accurate documentation and provides training (i.e., work procedures, how to guides)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Protects all Infrastructure systems from unauthorized access (i.e., MPLS, WAN, Wireless, PBX)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinates with SCADA and Process Control admins to advise best practices and coordinate architectural changes with Security, Network and Server engineering<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of nine years of job-related experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Education Level<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> A minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> PREFERRED EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> A Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems or related field is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Required Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Advanced knowledge of applications systems and ability to apply this knowledge. Expert level understanding of company operating systems platforms; advanced working knowledge of information systems concepts\u002Fdesign\u002Fdevelopment, systems development life cycle, recovery techniques, performance monitoring and tuning; decision-making, analytical, and problem solving skills. Conceptual and data analysis skills, advanced reading skills, the ability to perform intermediate mathematical calculations, intermediate reading and writing skills, and excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate with others, both written and verbal communication. Ability to lead others and projects.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><br> PREFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Certifications: Microsoft and Cisco certifications with an emphasis on desktop, network, and server support are preferred:<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Certifications in NET+, A+, N+, MCSA, CCNA, JNCIA, JNCIS, JNCIP, CCIE, MCP Cisco and MCSE.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> Additional support experience using Powershell and vbscript, TCP\u002FIP, WINS, DHCP, SMTP, DNS and anti-virus is a preferred. ITIL Foundation<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Supervisory\u002FManagerial Responsibility<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> None.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Work Conditions<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Office based with up to 30% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery including but not limited to chemical, pressure vessels, tanks, rotating equipment, working in confined spaces, and exposure to risk of electrical shock. Subject to all weather and varying road conditions. Occasionally required to work long hours which may include nights, weekends, holidays for regularly scheduled maintenance and emergency work and support as well as on-call availability.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 50 lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 50 lbs, climbing up to 15 ft, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movements, reaching or grasping, perceiving color differences, ability to wear personal protective equipment and a respirator during emergency situations as needed (beards not permitted).<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b><br> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n   <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><b>Title: Human Resources Business Partner<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Date: Jan 13, 2023<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Location: El Dorado Ks, 67042<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> BASIC FUNCTION: <\u002Fp>\n <p>Accountable for independently leading or performing HR processes under general supervision. Partners with the HR Manager, peers, and leadership to fully resolve conflicts between existing HR processes and business demands. Progression to this level is dependent upon the needs of the business.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES\u002FRESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Reliably performs independent Human Resources studies, analyses, and interpretations to draw sound conclusions and recommendations supporting HR and business efforts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Carries out the Company’s policies and procedures, understands and follows state and federal laws pertaining to Human Resources and creates all needed reports, spreadsheets and letters<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Designs and develops new and improved Human Resources methods and procedures through partnership with the business, HR Operations, and Centers of Excellence (COE)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provides support of employee and labor relations issues under close guidance of more experienced staff in a union or nonunion environment (I.e. employee dispute resolution, grievance administration and Union Committee action items)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Conducts thorough investigations of employment matters including recommended follow up under guidance of more experienced HR staff<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintains, administers and coordinates HR programs and is recognized by peers and managers as having an advanced knowledge and ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leads high visibility community and employee relations events\u002Fprojects with general guidance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coaches and mentors managers on the proper ways to navigate employment issues<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Credibly and constructively challenges and lead the business and internal HR processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Will be responsible for administrating and coordinating HR policies and procedures as needed by the business<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Experience:<\u002Fp>\n <p> A minimum of five years of related HR. experience is required.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> EDUCATIONAL LEVEL:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business, or a Technical field related discipline is required or related work experience in lieu of the degree (four years of related work experience) is required.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>REQUIRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Deals constructively with problems that do not have defined solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintains a calm and productive influence in times of uncertainty <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Acts with a clear sense of ownership<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follows through on commitments and makes sure others do the same<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Builds strong formal and informal relationships within HFC<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leverages relationships to develop solutions within HR and the business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Admits mistakes and gains insights from experiences<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reflects on how their personal style impacts others<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follows through on commitments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Builds trust through a direct and truthful approach<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advanced knowledge of general Human Resources principles and ability to apply this knowledge as it pertains to the company<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advanced skill level in Excel, Word, Outlook, and HRIS applications. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to handle confidential information including Protected Health Information (PHI) and all applicable compliance issues in relation to relevant HIPAA regulations. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to read and appropriately interpret information from multiple sources.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> PRFERRED SKILLS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Professional certifications such as SHRM – SCP, SPHR, GPHR, CCP, GRP, CEBS or other similar external certifications.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> SUPERVISORY\u002FMANAGERIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Will lead projects or teams as dictated by business needs. May supervise HR Generalist activities.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>WORK CONDITIONS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Office based with occasional refinery visits from time to time and with up to 10% travel by land and air required. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, and out-of-doors environment (depending upon assignment). Subject to all weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movement, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 20lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 10lbs, and ability to wear personal protective equipment.<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Basic Function<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Accountable for independently leading or performing HR processes under general supervision. Petroleum refinery, warehouse\u002Fplant environment, and out-of-doors environment (depending upon assignment). Subject to all weather and varying road conditions.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> Job conditions require standing, walking, sitting, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, making precise hand and finger movement, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, reaching or grasping, lifting and\u002For carrying up to 20lbs, pushing and\u002For pulling up to 10lbs, and ability to wear personal protective equipment.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Our One HF Sinclair Culture:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> At HF Sinclair, we are united through our One HF Sinclair Culture, which is underpinned by our five core values of Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Ownership and Inclusion. Developed to empower our people, our five core cultural values are at the heart of everything we do and extend to how we engage our stakeholders. These values influence our decisions, shape our behaviors and keep us connected across the entire organization.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> We maintain a true Safety culture for our employees, communities, environments and customers. Our goal is to make sure everyone returns home safely each day. We have a long-standing commitment to Integrity and ethical behavior and do what is right for our employees, investors, communities and the environment. We encourage employees to Step Up and Stand Out by championing a culture of Teamwork and Ownership. We foster a culture of Inclusion by encouraging diversity of experiences, viewpoints and backgrounds. What makes each of us different, together makes us stronger.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> About HF Sinclair Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation (\"HF Sinclair\"), headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent energy company that produces and markets high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel, renewable diesel and other specialty products. HF Sinclair owns and operates refineries located in Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Wyoming, Washington and Utah and markets its refined products in 19 states principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. HF Sinclair supplies high quality fuels to more than 1,300 Sinclair branded stations and licenses the use of the Sinclair brand at more than 300 additional locations throughout the country. In addition, subsidiaries of HF Sinclair produce and market base oils and other specialized lubricants in the U.S., Canada and the Netherlands, and export products to more than 80 countries. Through its subsidiaries, HF Sinclair produces renewable diesel at two of its facilities in Wyoming. HF Sinclair also owns a 47% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P., a master limited partnership that provides petroleum product and crude oil transportation, terminalling, storage and throughput services to the petroleum industry, including HF Sinclair subsidiaries.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Equal Opportunity Employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p> HF Sinclair Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other prohibited ground of discrimination.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><b> About HollyFrontier Corporation<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> HollyFrontier Corporation, headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent petroleum refiner and marketer that produces high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel and other specialty products. HollyFrontier operates through its subsidiaries a 135,000 barrels per stream day (\"bpsd\") refinery located in El Dorado, Kansas, a 125,000 bpsd refinery in Tulsa, Oklahoma, a 100,000 bpsd refinery located in Artesia, New Mexico, a 52,000 bpsd refinery located in Cheyenne, Wyoming and a 45,000 bpsd refinery in Woods Cross, Utah. HollyFrontier markets its refined products principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. In addition, HollyFrontier, through its subsidiary, owns Petro-Canada Lubricants Inc. whose Mississauga, Ontario facility produces 15,600 barrels per day of base oils and other specialized lubricant products, and also owns a 57% limited partner interest and a non-economic general partner interest in Holly Energy Partners, L.P.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><i><br> Join HollyFrontier where you have the opportunity to develop and own your career!<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> HollyFrontier Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
